Danamati will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase wholesale stock such as cheese, meat, rice, and other products. In this way, she will have a wider variety of food to offer her customers, and satisfy their tastes and needs, which will generate better sales and income so that she can keep striving to meet her medium-term goals: paying for her children’s education, and generating more income from her business in order to provide her children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale stock of cheese, meat, rice, oil and dough for her food stall

loans.name: Mahima Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Asa is 26 years old, standing to the left side in the photo. 

She is married, and has raised and given a good upbringing to six children, the youngest of whom is 3 years old. Asa has a secondary education, and she is a very responsible, honest, and hardworking woman. She is from the village Kusumi of Koraput district and the featured borrower of Mahima SHG-A. Her husband is a green grocer by profession, and he has been selling fresh vegetables at a shop in a nearby town for many years. 

Her husband offers seasonal and fresh vegetables to his customers. He has been feeding his family through the generated income from this vegetable shop. Nowadays, the needs of his family have suddenly increased, and he does not have other sources to cope with these needs. So he decided to expand his current business. He wants to increase his stock on a daily basis so that he can maximize sales of the vegetables.

Therefore, Asa, along with her group member, Bhanumati, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner People's Forum. Asa will use her portion of the loan to help her husband increase the stock of his business. She aspires to purchase a new cow and start a milk business in order to make herself financially independent and add to her savings in the near future.

loans.use: to help her husband to increase the stock in his vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Leotina

texts.en:
Leotina, is 53-year-old, widow, resident of Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She has remained a widow since her husband died and has dedicated herself in taking care of her family. Being a widow is the biggest challenge she faced in her life but with her positive outlook and faith in God she was able to overcome this trial. 

Leotina is thankful that God allowed her to operates a small variety store for ten years already. She does not allow poverty in the Philippines to hinder her from improving in life. She also sells RTW clothes and underwear on the side and has recently opened a small "Piso" net as shown on her photo. This computer net allows for games and search the Internet by one peso per minute.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her businesses, she is requesting a Php 20000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. Part of the loan she will use to pay for several pieces of underwear to sell and pay for a second-hand PC unit. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and to fund her house repair.

Leotina aims to sustain and grow her businesses. She prays that God will will bless her efforts with success and have abundance in life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery and clothing items for her general store and pay for a second-hand Piso-net unit.

loans.name: Leab's Group

texts.en:
An older woman living in Battambang province, Leab is 60 years old and a mother of eight children. Nowadays, she earns an income to support her family by growing rice and beans. She also earns additional income from fishing. Grubs destroyed her beans, so her beans did not grow well. She has been a farmer for 35 years and can save her daily income of about 21,100 KHR per day. 

This is Leab's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her previous loan. With her previous loan, she was able to earn more income to provide for her household. Leab is the leader of a group of two members. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her rice farming, in order to get a good yield. She hopes that she can earn more income from her farming to improve her living standards so that they are better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed for her rice farm

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is aged 31 years, married to Jeremiah, and she supports three children. She has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns her KES 14,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to enable her to get better harvest for sale and family use. 

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients. Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector and also improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to enable her to get better harvest for sale and family use.

loans.name: Mahima Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Gorimani is a 22-year-old single mother of three. She is the lady standing to the left. Two years ago, she started farming to help herself cover the increasing needs and expenses of her family. She has succeeded throughout the years in growing the business and gaining loyal customers. 

She is from the village Kusumi of Koraput district and is the featured borrower of Mahima SHG-D. She is currently engaged in vegetable cultivation and grows a variety of vegetables like potatoes, brinjal, tomatoes and cauliflower. She sells her produce in the nearby market, and the amount she fetches is used to meet her household expenses and raise her three immature children.

Gorimani, along with her other group member, Nabina, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Gorimani will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides and pesticides for her farm in order to enhance the quality of her produce, which will have increased demand in the market.

Gorimani has planned to purchase a vehicle so that she will not have to pay extra transportation charges to make her produce reach the market, and this will facilitate her savings.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, insecticides and pesticides for her farm

loans.name: Renu

texts.en:
Renu, who is 50, lives in a small village Chuakhola in Falakata in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is a courageous lady and blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). She lives with her husband and children. 

Her husband is a worker in a private company. His income is so small that he cannot even afford the educational expenses of his children. Renu’s daughter is an arts graduate and her son is in college.

Renu's son, Abhijit, 22, is a student of Bachelor of Arts in his first year in Falakata College. He has always been an average student. But with his hard work and perseverance, he tries to excel. Abhijit is confident of acing his exams and would like to enroll for coaching classes to pursue higher studies. His parents are unable to provide sufficient study materials and private tutors. The only way out is to borrow some financial help from any microfinance company like BJS that helps poor students to fulfill their dreams. 

To make this dream possible, Renu is seeking a loan from BJS (a Kiva field partner). This loan will go towards her son's coaching fees and purchase study materials that will ensure that Abhijit gets access to quality coaching classes that will lay a strong academic foundation and ensure his bright future.

Renu and Abhijit (as in the photo) are obliged to their lenders.

loans.use: To pay all the education related costs of her son.

loans.name: Edgar Antonio

texts.es:
Edgar de 59 años de edad, casado con un hijo de menor de diez años, el cual está estudiando, es originario de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar sus estudio  y aprendió el oficio de soldador para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad lucha día  a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a  sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica el servicio de taller de soldadura, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación desde hace diez años. Y consiste en la elaboración de verjas de hierro, portones, techo, de perlines etc. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima para las elaboraciones del mismo como; hierro, soldador etc. En la actualidad su mayor desafío es hacer crecer su negocio, y aumentar su clientela, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Edgar agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Edgar, 59 years old, is married with a young son, age ten, who is a student. He is from Carazo, a place that is located in the northern zone of the region and is characterized as begin hard-working, responsible, with desire to improve himself. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, he couldn't pursue an education and learned the job of welding to help with the household expenses. Currently, he fights day to day to offer a better future to his son. 

Thanks to his desire to get ahead, he has as his work a welding shop service. The business has been located in his house for ten years and includes making iron railings, gates, roof beams, etc. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business with the purchase of raw materials to make these such as iron, solder, etc. Currently, his greatest challenge is making his business grow and expanding his customer base so that in the not-too-distant future he can get more income. Edgar is thankful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to purchase raw material such as iron, solder, etc. to make railings, gates, and roof beams.

loans.name: Yorlene Lisbet

texts.es:
El tener un hijo le cambió la vida a Yorlene, una joven de 25 años de edad, casada y madre de un pequeño de cinco años de edad, quien sirvió de principal inspiración para estudiar la licenciatura en Enfermería hace cuatro años. Además que le da mucha gratificación al contribuir a las necesidades de otros. Ella se siente agradecida con todas las personas que la han apoyado en este proceso, en especial cuando solicitó el préstamo anterior con el cual pudo comprar un tensiómetro y una pequeña computadora que le permitió mejorar su calidad de trabajo. 
Hace dos años es operaria y cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien es docente, y de su esposo. Por lo que la motivación por seguir adelante surgen como lluvia en invierno. Por esta razón, solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora nueva y útiles de enfermería, ambos le permitirán tener acceso a un equipo indispensable para sus estudios y área laboral.  En un futuro piensa hacer una maestría para seguir incrementando sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Having a child changed Yorlene's life. She is a young woman, 25 years old, married and the mother of a young child who is five years old, who served as the principal inspiration to study for a nursing degree four years ago. In addition, it gives her a lot of gratification to help with other people's needs. She is grateful to all the people who have helped in this process, especially when she asked for the previous loan with which she could purchase a blood pressure cuff and a small computer that allowed her to improve the quality of her work.

She has been a worker for two years and has the support of her mother, who is a teacher, and her husband, for which her motivation to continue onward springs forth like rain in the winter. For this reason, she asks for a loan to purchase a new computer and nursing supplies, both will allow her to have access to indispensable equipment for her studies and work. In the future, she is thinking of getting a master's degree to continue increasing her knowledge.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer and nursing supplies.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 59 years old, married, and has four children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lourdes has been farming sugarcane for two years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Maa Narayani Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Sabitri is a 41-year-old woman residing in Neheru Pali village of Koraput district and is the featured borrower of Maa Narayani SHG-D. She is standing to the right in the  photo. 

She is the mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop. Her husband is the guardian of the family and is responsible for fulfilling the family members' needs. Sabitri has been running her own beauty salon for the past one year, and she also contributes her income with her husband's to manage the household.

Sabitri, along with her group member, Aela, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sabitri will use her portion of the loan amount to buy different types of cosmetics, creams, hair brushes and other accessories for her beauty salon. Due to financial constraints, she is not capable of buying these items for her business without the loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business so that she can provide better services to her customers. It will also help her to earn a maximally profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

loans.use: to buy varities of cosmetics, creams, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Martha Eva

texts.es: Martha Eva tiene 37 años, es separada y tiene dos hijas pequeñas. Ella estudió un bachillerato en secretariado ejecutivo. Hace 13 años cuando fue mamá tuvo que dejar su trabajo como secretaria, por esa razón ella comenzó la venta de ropa y zapatos por catálogo, siempre le ha sido un negocio redituable, ya que cuando tuvo oportunidad puso una boutique ofreciendo los mismos productos. Actualmente ella tiene un trabajo estable y sigue dedicándose a la venta de zapatos y ropa por catálogo, con un préstamo de MXN 12,000 Martha Eva podrá adquirir zapatos y ropa a un precio bajo, porque es fin de temporada y de esta forma su margen de utilidad será mayor. Ella es una mujer muy tenaz y perseverante, que siempre ha cumplido lo que se ha propuesto, su mayor motivación son sus hijas, su mayor sueño es volver a tener su propia boutique para poder ser independiente económicamente y ofrecerle mejores oportunidades a sus hijas. Ella estará muy agradecida con todas las personas que colaboren con su crecimiento económico y agradece mucho la confianza que ponen en ella, ya que no les fallará.
texts.en:
Martha Eva, 37, is separated and has two young daughters.  She earned a diploma as an executive secretary.  When she became a mother 13 years ago she had to leave her secretary position, so she started selling clothing and shoes via catalogue.  It has always been a profitable business for her because when she had the opportunity she set up a boutique to sell the same products.

Currently she has a stable job and she's still selling shoes and clothing via catalogue.  With a loan for 12,000 MXN [pesos] Martha Eva will be able to buy shoes and clothing at a low price because it's the end of the season.  This way her profit margin will be bigger.

Martha Eva's a tenacious and persevering woman who has always achieved what she set out to.  Her daughters are her greatest motivation.  Her biggest dream is to have her own boutique again so she can be financially independent and give her daughters better opportunities.

She will be very grateful to everyone who helps with her economic growth.  She's grateful for the trust they place in her, because she won't let them down.

loans.use: to buy shoes at a low price because it's the end of the season

loans.name: Maa Narayani Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Kuni is a 22-year-old married woman and a mother of one daughter. She is standing to the left in the photo. 

She is a hardworking and independent mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services at her home. She has been doing this for the past ten years. She very well knows the techniques of stitching. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. 

She started sewing clothes after the birth of her daughter, when she observed that her husband couldn't provide everything necessary for them. Then she decided to start tailoring work at home and since then she has been sewing clothes for her community.
 
Kuni, along with her group member, Mula, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner People's Forum. Kuni will use her portion of the loan to enhance the beauty of her craft, so she would like to buy an automated sewing machine. The professionals use this machine for tailoring because of its speed and fine performance. She would also like to buy some packs of zippers and buttons to meet the increasing demand.

loans.use: to purchase a new, automated sewing machine in order increase the beauty of her crafts.

loans.name: Maa Narayani Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Lalita, 44 years old and standing to the right in the photo, is from the village Neheru Pali of Koraput district. She is a married woman and mother of one son who studies in college. 

She deals in a business selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

Lalita needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she, along with her group member, Lachaman, contacted People/s Forum and applied a loan of 36,000 INR. 

Lalita will use her portion of the loan to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock in order to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Mahima Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Subhadra, aged 25 years, is the featured borrower of Mahima SHG-E from the village Kusumi of Koraput district. She is an enterprising woman standing to the right-hand side in the photo who, two years ago, decided to sell vegetables. She does this work as a street vendor, going through the streets of the municipal market and the nearby areas, which allows her to bring daily sustenance to her home. 

Subhadra lives in her own house with her husband and their three children. Her husband works as a daily laborer in the city, and the income earned by both her and her husband is not sufficient to meet the household requirements.

So, Subhadra, along with her group member, Baidei, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva’s partner Peoples Forum. Subhadra will invest her portion of the loan amount to purchase vegetables in bulk, since she knows that in this way her income will be greater. And this will help her increase her cash flow, thus leading to her economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables in bulk in order to boost her sales

loans.name: Hector Mauricio

texts.es:
Hector es un hombre  de 37 años de edad, soltero, tiene una hija de 15 años y su negocio es el snack pastelería.
Él es buen padre, emprendedor, independiente, constante, activo, generoso, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘ciudad satélite’ caracterizada por contar con grupos de viviendas construidas por el gobierno en diferentes etapas. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados. 
Hector es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por las actividades que realiza. Su vida la realiza con su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en casa de su madre que es propia y está construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de horneados tradicionales como; empanadas de queso, croissants, salteñas, tucumanas, jugos de fruta, postres, mates cocidos, pasteles y otros, “inicie mi negocio por impulso de mi familia, anteriormente me dedicaba al transporte, mi hija también trabaja en el negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su actividad es que la familia se dedica al negocio durante toda la semana, la desventaja es la competencia del lugar. Su sueño es ampliar su negocio para que sea herencia de su hija y pueda trabajar en el futuro, el desea realizar la compra de harina por quintal así como azúcar, levadura, leche, manteca.  Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Hector solicita un préstamo para la compra de harinas para hornear pan y establecer su negocio para futuras generaciones.
texts.en:
Hector is 37 years old and single, and has a fifteen-year-old daughter. His business is a baked snack shop. He is a good father; enterprising, independent, persevering, active, generous, responsible, and very hardworking. He carries out his business in the zone, “Satellite City”, which is characterized by having groups of houses that were built in stages by the government. The climate there is cool and dry, with a daytime temperature that varies between zero and twelve degrees Centigrade.

Hector has olive skin, brown eyes, and short black hair. He is short of stature, with a slim build. His mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks at home; he speaks Spanish with the general public and for his work. He lives with his daughter, who is studying in school, in his mother’s house, which she owns. It is built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof and a wooden floor. It has potable water, electricity, and sewer service.

His business is the sale of traditional baked goods, such as cheese empanadas, croissants, salteñas tucumanas (Bolivian-style empanadas), fruit juice, pastries, mates cocidos (specially prepared tea), cakes, and other items. He says, “I started my business with my family’s encouragement; before, I worked in transportation. My daughter also works in the business…”  The advantage of his business is that the family works at the business throughout the entire week; the disadvantage is the competition in the area.

His dream is to expand his business so that his daughter may inherit it and be able to have work in the future. He wants to purchase flour by the quintal (101.4 lbs.), as well as sugar, yeast, milk, and butter. This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the one year that he has been doing this work.

These are the reasons that Hector is requesting a loan: to purchase flour to bake bread and to establish his business for future generations.

loans.use: to purchase flour for baking bread, and to establish his business for future generations.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 62 años de edad, no pudo asistir a la escuela porque en ese entonces su familia no tenía las condiciones para  poder  enviarla a la escuela, ahora está casada, su pareja es agricultor y tienen 5 hijos, 3 de ellos todavía viven en casa. 

Juana, se dedica al cuidado de su hogar, también eventualmente hace pan para vender porque  desde pequeña su madre  le  enseño, también tiene  una pequeña  tienda en la  cual  su  hijo le  apoya para llevar mercadería; todo marcha bien, ahora su hijo tiene un molino de nixtamal.
 
Juana, necesita el dinero para surtir  más su tienda, porque hay productos que  actualmente no los comercializa, pero que al tenerlos le generaría más ingresos para su negocio. 

Juana, anhela  poder volver a compartir  tiempo con sus 2 hijos, porque  tiene  mucho tiempo de no verlos debido a la distancia; también desea ver prosperar su negocio para tener más ingresos  para  su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juana, age 62, couldn't go to school because at that time, her family didn't have the conditions to be able to send her to school. Now she is married, her husband is a farmer, and they have 5 children, 3 of whom sill live at home.

Juana works taking care of her home and also occasionally makes bread to sell because when she was little, her mother taught her how. She also has a small store in which her son supports her to bring the merchandise. Everything is going well; now her son has a corn mill. 

Juana needs the money to stock her store more, because there are products that she currently doesn't sell, but when she has them they will generate more income for her business.

Juana wants to be able to spend time with her 2 children again, because for a long time she has not seen them due to distance. She also wants to see her business prosper to have more income for her family and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her store with more products.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma, de 52 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, no pudo estudiar porque sus padres desde temprana edad le enseñaron a trabajar, vive sola junto con cuatro hijos, porque su esposo murió hace once años atrás y sus hijos se dedican al trabajo del campo porque son jornaleros en donde los contraten.

Enma, se dedica a hacer tortillas desde hace 20 años, también destaza cerdos y hace tamales para salir a vender, sus hijos le colaboran en cada una de las actividades, pero es ella quien se responsabiliza por hacer bien todo.

El préstamo lo solicita para comprar insumos como maíz y leña para hacer tortillas, también quiere comprar cuatro cerdos para engordarlos y luego destazarlos para vender su carne, por lo tanto también necesita comprar el alimento para ellos.

Enma, sueña con hacer crecer más su negocio, de manera que pueda vender más tortillas y tener más cerdos para seguir destazando en más cantidad; también sueña con que sus hijos logren conseguir un buen trabajo.
texts.en:
Enma, 52 years old, is a hard working woman. She couldn't go to school because, since she was young, her parents taught her to work. She lives alone with her four children because her husband died eleven years ago and her children are dedicated to working in the fields because they are laborers where they are hiring.

Enma has been dedicated to making tortillas for twenty years. She also butchers pigs and makes tamales to sell. Her children help her with each of these jobs but it is she who is responsible for doing everything well.

She is requesting this loan to buy ingredients like maize and wood to make tortillas. She also wants to buy four pigs to fatten them and then butcher them in order to sell their meat so she also needs to buy food for them.

Enma dreams of growing her business more in a way that she can sell more tortillas and have more pigs to keep butchering in greater quantities. She also dreams that her children manage to get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like maize and wood to make tortillas and to buy four pigs to fatten and then butcher to sell their meat.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
When groups and people come together, they are powerful. Philip, who is a 30-year-old farmer, knows that very well. This notion of collective effort led him to join Cheptirmet self-help group. For the past five years he has been actively involved in mixed farming. He never got the chance to get a white-collar job, but this has not been a setback because Philip has been making great profits in farming. Kapsowar has favourable conditions for horticulture farming: good climate, soils, transportation system, and market. 

Philip has always wanted to diversify and start horticulture farming, but the biggest challenge he has been facing is lack of funds to start the business. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds to start horticulture farming. Through Cheptirmet self-help group, which is a group where members co-guarantee each other to secure a loan, he joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance organization that supports young and enterprising farmers. With your loan he intends to buy good quality vegetable seeds, flowers and potatoes. Proximity to an airstrip will allow him to transport the produce faster to an international market, hence earning him more money. This loan will improve his living conditions and help him secure the future of his children.

loans.use: To buy seeds to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Jeaneth Del Rosario

texts.es:
Jeaneth, es una joven muy audaz, le encanta hacer deportes, por eso ella decidió estudiar la licenciatura en Educación Física. Su madre y hermanos, le brindan todo el apoyo que pueden para que ella salga adelante y se convierte en una profesional de éxito. Actualmente ella se encuentra en su penúltimo año de la carrera, lo que quiere decir que la cantidad de clases ha aumentado, así mismo los trabajos. 
Es por eso que ella ha solicitado un préstamo de Kiva junto a MiCrédito, que le dé la oportunidad de adquirir una computadora portátil. Esto le ayudaría hacer sus trabajos con mayor eficiencia y calidad. Sus planes a futuro es graduarse y trabajar como docente de educación física, así mismo planea estudiar una maestría relacionada a la educación para niños de primaria.
texts.en:
Jeaneth is a very courageous woman. She loves to play sports, so she decided to study for a degree in physical education. Her mother and siblings offer her all the support that they can so that she gets ahead and becomes a successful professional. Currently, she is in her second-to-last year in the program, which is to say the quantity of classes has increased, as well as the workload.

For this, she has asked for a Kiva loan through MiCrédito, which gives her the opportunity to get a laptop computer. This will help her do her work more efficiently and with better quality. Her future plans are to graduate and work as a physical education teacher, and to study for a master's degree related to primary school education.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.es:
Gabriel es un gran hombre de 37 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad  de Sololá. Gabriel con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la agricultura, el lleva  cinco años de ejercer esta humilde labor. Gabriel es uno de los jóvenes que tienen el gran corazón de preocuparse por la familia por tal razón ahora se ve a la necesidad de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la remodelación de su casa, compra de cemento, block y arena, porque su casa se encuentra ya en muy mal estado.
El gran anhelo de Gabriel es seguir mejorando su casa para el bien de su familia.
texts.en: Gabriel, 37, is single and lives in Sololá with his parents.  He has worked as a farm laborer for five years, work that helps support his family.  He is one of those men who will do anything to help their families and he wants to help his now by making repairs to the family house.  The house is crumbling in places and Gabriel is applying for a loan that he will use to buy materials--cement block, sand, etc.--for making the necessary repairs.  He hopes to make other repairs to the house in the future and continue improving it for his family.

loans.use: to buy materials for house repairs.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge tiene 65 años de edad es padre de 2 hijos y vive con su esposa, su actividad principal es la caficultura y agricultura, cuenta con más de 15 años de dedicarse  a esta actividad obteniendo muy buenos ingresos.
Don Jorge esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de abono para su cultivo y espera que esta inversión le permita salir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir apoyando a su familia, uno de sus sueños es tener bien abonados sus cultivos y asi obtener una muy buena producción este año.
 Espera que este  apoyo que le brinda Prisma le permita cumplir sus sueños y metas.

Trojes, Honduras - Junio del 2015
texts.en:
Jorge is 65 years old. He is the father of 2 children and lives with his wife. His primary work is coffee growing and agriculture. He has worked in this field for more than 15 years, getting very good income.

Jorge is asking for the loan to purchase manure for his crops and he hopes that this investment will allow him to get ahead with his business and be able to continue supporting his family. One of his dreams is to have well-fertilized crops and in this way to have very good production this year.

He hopes that this help offered by Prisma will allow him to achieve his dreams and goals. 

Trojes, Honduras - June 2015

loans.use: to purchase manure for his business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn was encouraged that she continually receive support to purchase various direct selling products needed in her business. Being a widow is the biggest challenge she faced in her life but with her positive outlook and faith in God she was able to triumph. 

Marilyn trusts that she can avail herself of a PHP 30,000 loan to pay for more personal products like cosmetics, toiletries and cleaning products. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their daily sustenance.

Marilyn's simple dream is to grow her business and to always have a happy and healthy family.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies. 

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise needed for her business.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Adolfo de 45 años, elabora deliciosos productos de repostería que comercializa desde su panadería ubicada en una urbanización de Cartagena de Indias, esta labor la realizaba cuando trabajaba en un autoservicio y gracias a su ardua experiencia decidió independizarse.  Todos los días sus clientes pueden pasar a degustar panes de queso con bocadillo, pan francés o de mantequilla, tortas, pasteles de hojaldre y demás exquisiteces, acompañándolas con diferentes bebidas como gaseosas, chichas de arroz o maltas. Sus clientes lo prefieren por su calidad y servicio que día a día reciben desde su negocio, en la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para adquirir un horno y comprar materias primas.  Adolfo cuenta con treinta años de experiencia y ha logrado tener éxito en su negocio, su meta a futuro es construir su local en un terreno al lado de su vivienda y adecuar su panadería.
texts.en: Adolfo, 45, makes delicious breads and pastries that he sells from his house in Cartagena de Indias.  He learned the business working at another bakery and decided later to strike out on his own.  His customers can come to buy breads, cakes, sandwiches, all made by hand, and drinks, too, some of which he also makes here.  His customers come again and again for the quality of the goods that he sells and for the excellent service that he provides.  Adolfo is applying to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for a Kiva loan that he will use to buy an oven and other supplies to carry on his business.  He has been a baker for thirty years and built a successful career.  For the future, he hopes to build a shop on land next to his house where he can operate his bakery.

loans.use: to buy an oven and other supplies for his bakery business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Jane operates a stall selling grocery vegetables. She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, 2 crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more motorcycle parts.

loans.name: Reyna Obilia

texts.es:
Reyna, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, su familia siempre fue de escasos recursos económicos  y por esta razón ya no pudo seguir estudiando, está casada y tiene 4 hijos, uno está trabajando y aporta económicamente con los gastos del hogar, los demás hijos están estudiando y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Reyna, se dedica a vender diferentes productos de primera necesidad en una tienda que posee, ella se dedica a este negocio desde hace 10 años, su esposo fue el que la animo a que pusiera la tienda y desde entonces ella la administra, sus hijos le ayudan a vender cuando ella está ocupada en la costura, porque tamnbien es costurera.

Reyna, utilizará el préstamo para comprar pan, frijoles, arroz, detergentes, etc. para satisfacer a sus clientes, porque no actualmente no tiene mucha mercadería para ofrecer y los clientes mejor se van a comprar a otras tienda.

Reyna, sueña con tener un negocio más grande para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y que logren terminar sus estudios universitarios para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Reyna, 52 years old, went to school up to the sixth grade. Her family always had limited resources and, for this reason, she couldn't continue her education. She is married and has 4 children, one is working and helps with the family expenses. The other children are students and her husband works in agriculture. 

Reyna works selling different basic products in a store that she has. She has worked in this business for the past 10 years. Her husband was the one who motivated her to establish a store and, since then, she has run it. Her children help her when she is busy with sewing because she is also a seamstress. 

Reyna will use the loan to purchase bread, beans, rice, detergents, etc. to satisfy her customers because currently she doesn't have a lot of merchandise to offer and the best customers go to make their purchases at other stores. 

Reyna dreams of having a larger business to be able to get her children ahead so that they manage to complete their university education so that they become professionals.

loans.use: to purchase bread, beans, rice, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Arely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Arely, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, debido a que sus padres eran de escasos recursos y ya no le pudieron ayudar; es madre soltera, por razones familiares tuvo problemas con el padre de sus tres hijos y se separaron, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y solo uno está estudiando.
 
Arely, tiene experiencia en las labores agrícolas desde los 15 años de edad, su padre le enseño a trabajar la tierra para que fuera independiente; en la actualidad aún se dedica a las labores agrícolas con ayuda de sus dos hijos varones y para poder ir a ver sus cultivos, tiene que caminar una distancia de un kilómetro aproximadamente, la mayor parte del trabajo la realiza por la mañana, además posee ingresos por cuidar a su sobrina discapacitada a quien asiste desde los dos años de edad. 

Arely, utilizara el crédito para comprar fertilizantes y sulfato de amonio para su cultivo de maíz, el cual ya tiene sembrado., con este crédito esperea que su cultivo sea más productivo y así obtener una mayor producción.
	
Arely, sueña con poder construir una casa de sistema mixto, porque donde vive actualmente es de bahareque y lámina por lo que es muy insegura y en la temporada de invierno se dañan las paredes.
texts.en:
Arely, 40 years old, went to school up to the third grade, due to the fact that her parents had limited resources and they couldn't help her any more. She is a single mother; for family reasons she had problems with the father of her three children and they separated. All of her children are older and only one is a student.

Arely has had experience in agricultural work since she was 15 years old. Her father taught her to work the land to be independent. Currently she still works in agriculture with her two sons and to be able to see her crops she has to walk a distance of approximately on kilometer. The large part of her work is done in the morning, in addition she has income for caring for her niece with a disability who she has cared for since she was two years old. 

Arely will use the loan to purchase fertilizers and ammonium sulfate for her corn crop which is already planted. With this loan, she hopes that her crop will be more productive and in this way get a larger harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and ammonium sulfate for her corn crop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two young bulls for his livestock business.

loans.name: Gladys Lourdes

texts.es:
La señora Gladys de 32  años de edad,  tiene  un hijo que depende de ella vive con su esposo en casa propia está ubicada en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Gladys se dedica desde hace 06 años al negocio de venta de abarrotería está solicitando ha solicitando como ser: jabón, frescos, churros, granos básicos, detergentes, carnes, embutidos, condimentos, verduras, jugos, etc., es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
Doña Gladys uno de sus sueños es que  es tener una de las pulpería más fuerte de la zona, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y por ende su calidad de vida.
Su Sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
Gladys, 32 years old has a son who is dependent on her and lives with her husband in their own house located in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras.

Gladys has worked for the past 6 years in the grocery store business. She is asking for a loan to purchase items such as soap, soft drinks, churros, basic grains, detergents, meat, cold cuts, seasonings, vegetables, juices, etc. She is a hard-working woman with desire to get ahead.

One of Gladys's dreams is to have one of the strongest grocery stores in the area. With the help of the loan, she plans to improve her business and, in the end, her quality of life.  

Her dream is to improve her business. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - June 2015.

loans.use: to purchase soap, soft drinks, churros, basic grains, detergents, meat, cold cuts, seasonings, vegetables, juices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is aged 38 years, married to Peter and she supports six children. 

She has been a shopkeeper for the last two years, and the business earns her KES 15,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase more stock of bread, sugar and cooking fat for sale to clients in order to meet their needs. 

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of bread, sugar and cooking fat for sale to clients.

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
Marcella is aged 43 years and she supports seven children. 

She has been a farmer for the last two years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase more fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural business.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in her customers' orders, shirts, sandals and perfumes.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 58 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Mary would like to save enough money in order to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a single mother of one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over five years, she has operated an open-air food-selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, Irish potatoes and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, Irish potatoes and cooking fat.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman who is living together with her husband and six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past ten years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Thorn is 57 years old and a mother of four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. 

Growing rice and selling Khmer noodles are the main businesses which she has been involved in for ages. As she lacks capital, she is leading a group of three to get a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This will be her first cycle. 

As a leader of this group, she will use her loan to buy fuel, fertilizers, pay for plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers for her farming business. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standards so they are much better than ever before.

loans.use: to buy fuel, fertilizers, pay for plowing fees and buy organic fertilizers for her farming business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Rin's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Rin is 35 years old and a mother of four dependent children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her rice gave her a bad yield, so she was only able to sell it at a low price. 

She has been involved with her farming for 12 years and it earns her about 29,400 KHR per day. For Rin, this is her eighth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. Her past loans helped to improve her family's conditions so they are better than before. 

In a group of six members, she is a group leader. She will manage her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for labor fees to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get a better yield to get more income so she can improve her lifestyle and make it better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed and pay for labor fees to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Devota

texts.en:
Devota is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Devota operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over ten years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Devota dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a married mother of four children; two of them attend school. She has no additional family members. She is a poultry farmer. She has been in this business for several years. 

She has applied for a loan of 500,000 Uganda Shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy poultry feed. She generates additional income from rental rooms. She works from home seven days a week operating on retail basis. Her major business challenges include diseases which affect the quality of the birds. 

She would like to build more rooms to expand her business. She resides in the family home with access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Las Rosas Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca se localizan comunidades que mantienen rasgos de la antigua cultura mazateca cuyos habitantes erigieron sus asentamientos. Los bailes, la vestimenta y los valores de los lugareños recuerdan dicho pasado del cual se sienten muy orgullosos. De igual forma lo que define a esta comunidad es su trabajo dedicado a la agricultura sobre todo al cultivo de caña de azúcar, limón y papaya.
   El grupo Las Rosas proviene de una de estas comunidades y está conformado por seis mujeres entusiastas. Ellas son: Areli quien vende cosméticos y ropa por catálogo; Eva, comida; Paola y Tomasa, cosméticos; Beatriz, tacos y Catalina, ropa y recipientes de plástico por catálogo.
   Beatriz es mejor conocida como Bety en su comunidad, también es conocida por su buen humor y sus ganas de salir adelante. Está casada con Antonio de quien aprendió el tradicional oficio de la elaboración de tacos; a su vez él aprendió de sus padres por lo que considera dicha actividad una tradición familiar. 
   Desde hace dos años la pareja decidió establecer su propia taquería pues es muy sencillo para ellos trabajar en equipo. Así, mientras Bety preparara la verdura, las salsas, el agua de temporada y limpia el local, Antonio cocina la carne y elabora los tacos de acuerdo al gusto del cliente. Manejan un horario extendido desde las 4:00pm y hasta las 12:00 am, y ofrecen promociones del 2 x 1 los días miércoles y domingo.
   Bety se encuentra muy contenta con el negocio, pues con las ganancias y los préstamos adquiridos ha comprado sillas, mesas, dos refrigeradores, una bocina y desde luego solventas los gastos de su casa. “Hemos logrado abrir otra taquería, lo cual resulta satisfactorio pues es resultado de nuestro trabajo, esfuerzo y compromiso” comenta satisfecha de sus logros. En esta ocasión necesita el préstamo para comprar carne, aceite, tortillas, platos, servilleteros, saleros, manteles y tres mesas con el fin de inaugurar su nueva taquería.
   Todas las integrantes de Las Rosas agradecen a quienes hacen posible las oportunidades de nuevos préstamos con los cuales mejoran sus actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el negocio de doña Eva quien viste blusa color rosa, la niña aparece en la foto es hija de Catalina de blusa color gris; Bety es quien viste blusa color verde olivo.
texts.en:
In Oaxaca there are communities that maintain traces of the ancient Mazateca culture whose inhabitants built their settlements. The dances, dress, and values of the people in these places recall this past of which they are very proud. Equally, what defines this community is their work in agriculture, above all in growing sugar cane, lemons and papayas. 

The Las Rosas group is from one of these communities and is made up of six enthusiastic women. They are Areli, who sells cosmetics and clothing from catalogs; Eva, food; Paola and Tomasa, cosmetics; Beatriz tacos; and Catalina, clothing and plastic containers from catalogs. 

Beatriz is better known as Bety in her community. She is also known for her good humor and her desire to get ahead. She is married to Antonio, from whom she learned the traditional work of making tacos, which he learned from his parents, so this work is considered a family tradition.  

Two years ago, the couple decided to establish their own taco shop because it is very easy for them to work as a team. So, while Bety prepares the vegetables, sauces and the seasonal water and cleans the shop, Antonio cooks the meat and makes the tacos according to the customer's taste. They have an extended schedule from 4:00 pm to 12:00 am and offer promotions of 2 x 1 on Wednesdays and Sundays. 

Betty is very happy with the business since with the earnings and the loans she has gotten, she has purchased chairs, tables, two refrigerators, a speaker, and then covered the household expenses. "We have managed to open another taco shop, which has been satisfactory since it is the result of our work, efforts and commitment, she says, satisfied with her achievements. This time, she needs the loan to purchase meat, oil, tortillas, plates, napkin dispensers, salt shakers, tablecloths and three tables with the end of opening the new taco shop. 
 
All the members of Las Rosas are grateful to those who make possible the opportunities for new loans with which they improve their businesses. 

*The photo was taken in Eva's business, who is wearing a pink blouse. The girl who is in the photo is Catalina's daughter (who is wearing a grey blouse), Bety is wearing an olive-green blouse.

loans.use: to purchase meat, oil, tortillas, plates, napkin dispensers, salt shakers, table cloths and three tables.

loans.name: San Valentin Group

texts.es:
La cercanía de los cerros, los sembradíos de caña, el sol y las nubes son los factores encargados de brindar una vista agradable durante el recorrido para poder llegar a la comunidad donde los adultos mayores aún hablan el mazateco, lengua indígena. Otros productos de la tierra muy importantes para la economía de la región son el mango, el maíz, el limón y el plátano. En este lugar se conformó el grupo San Valentín un 14 de febrero; los integrantes y sus actividades económicas son:

Paula -  Carnicería 
Romualda, Adalberto -  Cultivo De Caña De Azúcar
Susana,  Juana - Venta de Fertilizantes 
Celia, Adriana,  Marcelina - Venta de Antojitos 
Yessica - Venta de Refresco
Liliana, Felicitas, Felipa - Venta de Pollo 
Martina - Venta de Tamales Y Fertilizantes 
Evarista, Imelda, Abrahan - Venta de Abarrotes 
Filogonia - Panadería 
Luisa – Venta de Tamales  
Pascuala - Venta de Caña Y Antojitos 
Juliana - Venta de Ropa 

La señora Romualda es una mujer muy trabajadora, en la comunidad le conocen como “Mualda”, está casada con Eduardo y son padres de un niño de 8 años y de una niña de 5 años, ambos patrocinados por Word Vision México, institución humanitaria socia de VF México que proporciona ayuda para mejorar las condiciones de vida de los niños.

Mualda ha vivido en el mismo lugar desde que nació; sus padres se han dedicado al cultivo de caña de azúcar ya que es la actividad principal de la zona. De pequeña, ella acompañaba a sus padres al campo y fue así como aprendió las actividades de la tierra. Hace 7 años heredó parte de la parcela de sus padres lo que le permitió iniciar su propio negocio de venta de caña. En temporada de zafra (cosecha) el esposo de Mualda se encarga de quemar la caña para proceder al corte y de supervisar a los trabajadores que los apoyan, mientras que ella se encarga de preparar la comida para todos y llevarla hasta el campo. Después del corte, los jornaleros forman camellones o surcos en la tierra, lo que les permite volver a sembrar el producto; también intercalan siembra de frijol y maíz para aportar nutrientes a la tierra y que esta se mantenga fértil. Los meses siguientes, los trabajadores abonan la tierra y la limpian de la maleza que roba nutrientes. Para mantener la parcela limpia, Mualda y su esposo acuden desde temprano con su azadón y moruna.

Los préstamos anteriores han ayudado a la pareja a comprar fertilizantes y abono y las ganancias de la venta de caña solventan los gastos familiares, la educación de sus hijos y han hecho remodelaciones a su casa. El préstamo actual lo necesitan para comprar fertilizantes, abono y dos bombas manuales para mantener la tierra irrigada. Para incrementar sus ganancias, Mualda planea comprar 5 hectáreas más de tierra donde sembrará únicamente maíz y frijol.

“Gracias por confiar en nosotros y brindarnos un nuevo préstamo para nuestras  actividades, que son la fuente de solvencia económica para brindar buena calidad de vida a nuestras familias” 

 *La fotografía fue tomada en el patio de la casa de Mualda, ella es quien viste blusa azul y está cargando a su hija quien viste de color verde agua, los demás niños de la foto son hijos de las integrantes.
texts.en:
The proximity of the mountains, the cane fields, the sun and the clouds are the factors responsible for providing a nice view along the way to reach the community where the elderly still speak Mazatec, an indigenous language. Other products from the land that are very important land for the economy of the region are mango, corn, lemon and banana. Here, the San Valentin group was formed on February 14; The members and their economic activities are:

Paula -  Butcher
Romualda, Adalberto -  Farming sugar cane
Susana,  Juana - Selling fertilizer
Celia, Adriana,  Marcelina - Selling "antojitos" (street food)
Yessica - Selling drinks
Liliana, Felicitas, Felipa - Selling chicken 
Martina - Selling tamales and fertilizers 
Evarista, Imelda, Abrahan - Selling groceries 
Filogonia - Bakery 
Luisa – Selling tamales  
Pascuala - Selling sugar cane and street food 
Juliana - Selling clothing 

Romualda is a very hard working woman. In the community, she is known as "Mualda". She is married to Eduardo and they are parents of an 8 year old boy and a 5 year old girl. Both are sponsored by World Vision Mexico, a humanitarian institution partnered with VF Mexico that helps to improve the living conditions of children.

Mualda has lived in the same place since she was born. Her parents have been dedicated to farming sugar cane since it is the main activity of the area. Since she was young, she accompanied her parents to the field and there learned farm work. Seven years ago, she inherited part of her parents' land which allowed her to start her own business selling sugar cane. In the harvest season, Mualda's husband is in charge of burning the cane to proceed with the cutting and with supervising the workers who support them. Meanwhile she is in charge of preparing food for everyone and taking it to the field. After cutting, the workers form ridges or grooves in the land, which allows them to return to plant the product. They also intersperse bean and maize seeds to provide nutrients to the land so that it remains fertile. In the following months, the workers fertilize the land and clean it of brush that robs nutrients. To keep the land clean, Mualda and her husband go early with their hoes.

The previous loans have helped the pair to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and the income from selling cane pays their family expenses, their children's education, and to make repairs to their house. They need the current loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizers and two hand pumps to keep the land irrigated. To increase their income, Mualda plans to buy 5 hectares more of land where she will plant only maize and beans.

"Thanks for trusting in us and providing us a new loan for our work, which is the source of our economic solvency to provide a good quality of life to our family."

* The photograph was taken on the patio of Mualda's house. She is the one in a blue blouse and is carrying her daughter who is dressed in blue green. The other children in the photo are children of the members.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers and two hand pumps.

location.town: La Tabaquera,Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oaxaca

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of fingerlings and sardines fo sell to clients

loans.name: Choub's Group

texts.en:
A mother of three dependent children living in Battambang province, Choub is 42 years old. She earns income to support her living conditions via rice cropping on a one hectare area and selling grocery items to get more income. 

Because of drought, her rice is not growing well. She has been involved this business for 15 years and she can save on a daily basis about 35,400 KHR. This is her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. With her past loan, she got more income to improve her family’s living standards and to keep her children in school as well. 

In a group of two, she is a group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for plowing fees to support her rice farm. She hopes that her rice farm can give her more yield and provide a better income than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, organic pesticide and pay for plowing fees to support her rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of tomatoes, onions and kale for sale to clients.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is aged 26 years, married to Samuel and she supports five children. She has been a farmer for the last 5 years and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get better harvest for sale and family use. 

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow to have milk production she can sell to clients. Her hope is to be financially stable, expand her agricultural activities and also improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

loans.name: Aseera

texts.en:
Aseera, age 50, is married and has four children of ages ranging from 5 to 18. All attend school in Hoima, Uganda. 

He ventured into mechanics, mainly repairing bicycles, motorcycles and vehicles and selling their spare parts, alongside farming, mainly growing cassava and beans. 

He has always hoped to expand and develop his business; however, inadequate capital hinders the achievement of his desires. He will use the loan to buy more tyres to sell.

loans.use: to buy more tyres for sale.

loans.name: Hsu Ka Lat Village

texts.en:
The fund will help 24 members of Hsu Ka Lat Village Group. The featured borrower, Sein, is 58 years old and married with eight children. The parents are proud that some of their children are working on their own and some are studying. The family has six acres of crop farm and Sein has forty years of experiences in the crop farming business. 

Proximity Design's loan will help him to purchase gas for crop machines and fertilizers for the farm.

His goal for this year is to hire more labors than previous years and expand the crop farm up to nine acres. Sein is also taken as leader for social occasions held in the village and has helped many people in their downtimes. 

Pictured above are the members of Hsu Ka Lat Village, named, Sein, Mya, Chin, Kat, Chit and Myint. The whole group is comprised of 24 village customers and they will be helped to purchase gas and fertilizers for their farms from Proximity's loan. 

The village is located in Ayeyarwaddy Delta Region in Upper Myanmar. They mainly focus on crop farming and also do the plantations.

loans.use: to purchase farming materials such as fertilizers and gas for machines.

loans.name: Grupo Las Estrellas De Chuatzam. Group

texts.es:
Manuela  (la que se ubica en la parte de atrás de la foto con blusa color amarillo) es mujer de grandes aspiraciones en la vida, ella tiene 43 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijas de las edades entre 10 y 20 años, ellas viven en una comunidad de Sololá. Para Manuela su familia es muy importante y para brindarles lo mejor se dedica a la elaboración de blusas de su región, con esta labor lleva 25 años de ejercerla, pero para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la confección de cortes. Manuela por ser una de las costureras con más experiencia, mucha gente busca su producto, por lo que ahora se ha dado cuenta que ya no se da abasto con los materiales que cuenta, por tal motivo organizo a un grupo de señoras para solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos para elaborar blusas.
El gran sueño de Manuela es prosperar con su negocio para que a sus hijas no les falte nada y contar  con una casa propia.
texts.en:
Manuela (the lady in the back, wearing a yellow blouse), is a woman with great aspirations in life. She is 43 years old and married. She has a beautiful family of three daughters between the ages of ten and twenty. 

They live in a community of Sololá. Manuela’s family is very important to her; and in order to give them the best, she works making regional blouses. She has been doing this work for 25 years, but to improve her income, she also works as a dressmaker.

Because Manuela is one of the most experienced dressmakers, many people seek her products, and she has realized that she doesn’t have enough materials.  That is why she organized a group of ladies in order to request a loan. She will invest it in the purchase of fabric and thread for making blouses.

Manuela’s great dreams are to prosper with her business so that her daughters will lack for nothing, and to have a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Miray

texts.en:
Miray is a 20-year-old married mother of one child. She decided a year ago to open a grocery shop to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is trying hard to develop her business. 

Today, Miray is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests.

Miray hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new items and products to satisfy her customers' requests

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase vegetables, meat, chicken, etc. for her dishes and metal sheeting to build an enclosure, all with the end of improving her business.

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en:
Rodah is aged 23 years and she supports 2 children.
 
She has been a farmer for the last 2 years and the business earns her KES 15,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get a better harvest for sale and family use. 

She plans to educate her children and purchase a dairy cow to produce milk for sale to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to enable her get a better harvest

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María  del Carmen olivares de 35 años de edad, soltera con un hijo mayor de edad, independiente económicamente es originaria de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Por medio de la perseverancia ha podido mantener su actividad económica la cual la desempeña con muchos gustos, ya que ha sido la forma de obtener un ingreso.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería  que consiste en vender productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, café, fósforos, detergente, maíz, jugos, gaseosas, etc.  Ella dedica a su negocio unas  doce horas diarias, ofreciendo sus productos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Maria del Carmen agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María del Carmen Olivares is 35 years old and single with one independent adult son. She is from Carazo, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. She is hardworking, responsible, and open to self improvement. Through perseverance she has been able to maintain her economic activity with many interests, as has been the way to earn an income.

Thanks to her desire to succeed, her economic activity consists of a grocery store where she sells food products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, matches, detergent, corn, juice and soda, etc. She devotes 12 hours daily to her business, offering her products. Her business is located in her home. The purpose of the loan is to invest the capital in her work and support her business by purchasing food products, so that in the not too distant future she can have a better income. Maria del Carmen is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders provide to people with little resources, and poor countries such as Nicaragua, to have a dignified job.

loans.use: to support her grocery store with products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, coffee, matches, detergent, corn, juice, soda, etc.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village.
Her family has a latrine but it is old and not hygienic.

She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build the toilet.
In 2013, Loan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Loan has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

loans.use: to build a new hygienic latrine for the health and welfare of her family

loans.name: Channak's Group

texts.en:
Channak, 48, is a farmer living in the rural area of Ou Reang Ov district of Kampong Cham province and a married mother of a child who is dependent on her. To support her family’s living, she has been growing rice as the main source of income for 30 years. 

Unfortunately, this year she cannot manage to earn good income as the price of crop products declined. She is now leading a group of two to get a new loan. She is not new and she has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three loans already. She has paid back her past loan successfully and it enabled her to provide her family members with proper clothes. 

This fourth time, the loan will be used to buy rice seeds, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to increase crop productivity. She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standards so they are much better than ever before.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, organic pesticides and organic fertilizers to increase crop productivity.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Alina

texts.en:
Alina, her husband and their three children live in Aknalij village of Armavir region. They keep two cows, 5 calves and cultivate tomatoes as a main crop in their farm. Last year they have improved their cultivation of tomatoes and were able to enlarge it. With the income gathered from sales of this harvest, Alina and her husband were able to improve their living and purchase supplies for their kids. 

Now aiming to increase their agribusiness, Alina has applied for this loan. She plans to purchase fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation. 
As this is Alina's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The First-Chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history. Through this joint initiative, almost 500 borrowers like Alina get a chance to have their first loans and develop their businesses. Alina and her husband hope to receive lenders' support and build a farm of their dream.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and hire workers for land cultivation

loans.name: Saroem's Group

texts.en:
Saroem the farmer lives in the Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province and is a 40-year-old mother of two dependent children. 

Her main businesses to make a living are growing rice and weaving scarves to sell, which she has been doing for 20 years. Sometimes she works for others for a fee so that she can supplement her income. Now the price of her crop products and handmade products cannot be sold at a high price since the cost of production was already high. 

This will be Saroem’s second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan has been paid successfully and it has enabled her to improve her living standard. 

As a leader of a group of three members, she will use her loan to buy thread to weave more scarves and to buy organic fertilizer to enrich the farmland with nutrients. 

She hopes to earn a better income from her business to renovate her house so that she and her family can live in a comfortable shelter as others do.

loans.use: to buy thread to weave more scarves and to buy organic fertilizer to enrich the farmland with nutrients

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es:
Rosa, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, su familia siempre fue de escasos recursos económicos  y por esta razón ya no pudo seguir estudiando, actualmente está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos todos están acompañados, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y también a la agricultura, con ella vive su esposo, una de sus hijas, tres nietos y su yerno.

Rosa, se dedica a vender diferentes productos de primera necesidad en una tienda, se dedica a este negocio desde aproximadamente 8 años, hace mucho tiempo su mamá tenía un negocio de frutas y ella le ayudaba a vender y fue de ahí que ella se motivó a poner su propio negocio, también se dedica a la venta de tamales, ella los elabora y sale a venderlos casa por casa en toda su comunidad, este negocio lo realiza solo los fines de semana.  

Rosa, utilizará el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como arroz, aceite, sal, azúcar, etc. y asi mantener surtido su negocio, ella considera que con la inversión que realice tendrá más diversidad de productos para su tienda y por ende aumentar las ventas y generar más ganancias para tener una mejor calidad de vida para ella y su familia.

Rosa, sueña con tener un negocio amplio y con buenas condiciones, además desea mejorar su vivienda y vivir cómodamente con toda su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa, 52, had to leave school after the first grade because her family didn't have the money for her to go on.  She has her own family now, a husband and 3 grown children.  Her husband is a construction worker and part-time farm laborer.  Rosa's daughter, son-in-law and three grandchildren live with her and her husband.  

Rosa has operated a grocery business for 8 years.  She sells the everyday products that her buyers need.  Her mother had a fruit sales business, she says, and taught her the value of building a business of her own.  Rosa also makes tamales on weekends and goes door to door to sell them.  

Rosa is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her grocery business with the merchandise that she sells: rice, cooking oil, salt, sugar, etc.  The investment will help her to stock the wide range of products that her customers want and, in turn, generate a better income for her and her family.  

For the future, Rosa hopes to continue growing her business.  She would also like to improve her house and make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to stock her grocery business.

loans.name: Krishana Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Sunamani, aged 48 years is the featured borrower of Krishana SHG-C from the village Bhaluguda of Koraput district.She is the one standing to the left. She is a mother of two daughters and one son, and her husband has been running his own meat business for the past 10 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and managing the household. 

Sunamani's husband wants to purchase animals for his meat business, but due to financial constraints, her husband is unable to purchase these cattle. Therefore, Sunamani along with her group member has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. This loan will enable Sunamani’s husband to buy the cattle he needs to fulfil the needs of his meat business. This will also be good for him to earn the maximum profitable income derived from his business.

Sunamani aspires to provide quality education to all her children, ensure her daughters marry into reputable families and use a part of her savings in renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more cattle in order to meet the rising demands of the customers.

loans.name: Rasheeda

texts.en:
Rasheeda is 50 years old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business of selling clothes. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Rasheeda  is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. 

Currently she needs a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase good-quality clothing of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good-quality clothing of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment

loans.name: Grupo Chuimanzana L Group

texts.es:
Ana Julieta (la segunda de derecha a izquierda de blusa roja)  es un mujer de 28 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus dos hijos de las edades entre 2 y 4 años, en una comunidad de Sololá.
