Ana Julieta para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia es comerciante en el la plaza de su comunidad, pero para obtener mejores ganancias se dedica a lavar ropa y cuida de un niño en su tiempo libre, con esta actividad lleva cinco años. Ana Juliaeta gracias al esmero que le pone a su trabajo mucha gente lo busca y para poder satisfacer mejor las necesidades de los clientes, ella solicita un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de telas, hilos para elaboración de güipiles típicos.
El gran sueño de Ana Julieta es que su negocio prospere para obtener mejores ganancias y construir su casa.
texts.en: Ana Julieta (second from the right, to the left of the red blouse) is a 28-year-old woman who is single and lives in a community in Sololá with her two children between the ages of 2 and 4. In order to make a living and improve her family's situation, Ana Julieta is a vendor in the town square of her community, but for additional income she works washing clothes and caring for a child in her spare time. She has been doing this for five years. Thanks to the care Ana Julieta puts into her work, many people seek her out, and to better meet the needs of her clients, she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of fabric and thread for the production of traditional blouses. Ana Julieta's dream is that her business prospers so her earnings go up and she can build her house.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread for the production of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Krishana Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Dhobali, aged 35 years is the featured borrower of Krishana SHG-A from the village Bhaluguda of Koraput district. Dhobali is the one standing to the left in the photo. She lives with her husband who works as an electrician in a local shop and a daughter who is in primary school. 

Dhobali is a hardworking woman who for many years has made decorative pieces to beautify homes. She sells them to the people in her community and in the local market.

Along with her group member, she has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Dhobali will use her portion of the loan amount to buy paint brushes, paint and good-quality clay. She has a plan to use her income to paint her house and renovate the roof of the house which is damaged due to cyclonic storms.

loans.use: to purchase paint brushes, colourful paints and good quality of clay.

loans.name: Krishana Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Pramila, a 43 years old woman is the featured borrower of Krishana SHG-B from the village Bhaluguda of Koraput district. She lives with her husband and a 28-year-old son who got married 2 months ago. 

Her husband is engaged in paddy cultivation and her son helps him in the field. She is engaged in a dairy business and has two cows. The amount that she gets after selling the milk is used to meet the household requirements.

Now Pramila’s situation is hard because she has a health problem. She along with her group member is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. Pramila will use her portion of loan amount to pay for medical expenses and medicines so she can recover her health and continue her work. After treatment, she wants to take a loan to purchase a few more calves for breeding. She needs your financial support.

loans.use: to pay for medicines and other medical expenditures.

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Lesbia de 50 años de edad, casada con  un hijo menor de edad, el cual está estudiando en la universidad, es originaria de Carazo, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  Se inició en esta actividad económica por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para apoyar a su familia económicamente. En la actualidad lucha para salir adelante día  a día con su negocio hacer crecer día a día para obtener mejores beneficios.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante  tiene por actividad económica la venta de cosméticos y venta de ropa  de forma ambulante, el negocio consiste en vender ropa como: pantalones, shorees, faldas, vestidos, ropa de niño, ropa interior, etc. Tiene  seis años desempeñándose en dicha actividad, la rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unas ocho horas diarias, el cual sale a la calle a vender sus productos con el bulto de unos 20 kg llevando su mercadería a clientes fijos y por encargos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio con productos de cosméticos y ropa, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Lesbia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lesbia is 50 years old, married, with a son who is a minor and is studying at the university. She is from Carazo, a place which is located in the northern zone of the region, and is characterized as being hard-working, responsible, with the desire to improve herself. She began with this work due to the need to have a source of income to support her family. Currently, she struggles to get ahead day by day with her business, making it grow daily to get more income.

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she has as her business the sale of cosmetics and clothing as a street vendor. This business consists of selling clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, children's clothing, lingerie, etc. She has been doing this work for six years; this woman's work routine is eight hours each day, when she goes out into the street to sell her products with a bundle of some 20 kg carrying her merchandise to established customers and to order. The goal of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business with cosmetic products and clothing, so that in the not-too-distant future she can get more income. Lesbia is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and in poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of new clothing such as pants, shorts, skirts, dresses, children's clothing, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Francis Yanett

texts.es:
La señora  Francis de 49 años  de edad  es casada y vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación,  en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, Valle al sur de Honduras, cuenta con un puesto en el mercado local y vende lo que es ropa interior para dama y caballeros, ropa de niño, juguetes, desodorantes, cremas, etc.
Doña Francis  es una persona muy luchadora  y está muy contenta con el apoyo que se le está brindando, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de ropa nueva como blusas, vestidos, pantalones, camisas, braseares, blúmeres, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo espera mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es  surtir más su negocio y obtener mejores ganancias.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Junio del  2015
texts.en:
Francis, 49, is married and lives with her husband in her home in a community in San Lorenzo, Valle, in the south of Honduras.  She has a stall in the local market where she sells men's and women's underwear, children's clothing, toys, deodorant, creams, and so on.  She's a very persevering person and she's very happy with the support she's getting.

Francis is requesting the loan to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, bras, underwear, and other new clothing.  She hopes to improve her income as well as her quality of life with the support of this loan.

Her dream is to stock her business more and earn better profits.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, June 2015

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, pants, shirts, bras, underwear, and other items

loans.name: Tujijuke Cb Group

texts.en:
Christine is a group leader; aged 54 years.She is married with 4 children aged between 14 and 20 years. They all go to school. The group is called TUJIJUKE means “FIGHT FOR IGNORENCE” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for changing their better future. She sells foodstuffs and has been running in a business for 8 years. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, banana, cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, banana, cassava for sale.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
A residing of Battambang province, Sary is 52 years old and a mother of five children. She earns income to support her family’s livelihood via cassava growing and working for others for a fee to get more income. Her rice does not grow well because she has not enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her farm. 

Each day she can save about 18,800 KHR and she has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

This is first time for Sary with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan to buy fertilizer and pay plowing fees for her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get good yield from her cassava farm so she can improve her living conditions so they are better than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay the plowing fee for her cassava farm.

loans.name: Janes

texts.en:
Janes is aged 57 years, married to Onyango, and she supports four children. She has been a farmer for the last nine years, and the business earns her KES. 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to enable her get a better harvest to sell and for family use. 

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients.

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector and also improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for top dressing her crops to enable her get a better harvest to sell and for family use.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma, a 39-year old married woman, lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol. She has three children. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 11 years old. 

She engages in selling household items like frying pans, ready-to-wear and plastic ware. She has been engaged in this kind of business for more than 10 years.

Vilma needs additional funds to finance her existing business.

She is asking for a loan to buy mats, mosquito nets, basins and other kitchen utensils. With these, she cab cater to the orders of her respective customers and able to improve her income. Thus she could able to provide her children with nutritious diets and better living conditions. 

Vilma dreams to expand her livelihood to make it productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy mats, mosquito nets, basins and other kitchen utensils

loans.name: Jagannath Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Chanchala aged 32 years from Ramgiri village of Koraput district is the featured borrower of Jagannath SHG- A. She is the one standing to the right in the photo. She lives with her husband and 8 children, among whom 3 work in the city close to the village. 

Chanchala's husband is a farmer by profession. He has been working on his own land for many years. He learned his profession from his parents. He mainly grows paddy along with other seasonal vegetables. Chanchala looks after her household work, and after that, she helps her husband in his activities. As a farmer, he has a great passion for his profession, as all day long, without regard for climate, he goes to look after his crops. The couple works tirelessly to provide financial sustenance to their family. They gained many good customers by their polite and simple behaviour and good quality crops at a cheaper rate. Like the other farmers, they also dream of extending and improving their production. 

Chanchala along with her group member has requested for a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount in order to purchase a vehicle to transport the produce from the place of production to the market. This will help her in avoiding the middlemen charge and will result in a bigger cash flow. She aspires to use her profit for her children's education and ensure her daughters can marry into a well-settled family.

loans.use: to purchase a vehicle for the smooth transportation of her produce.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is 57 years old, a married woman. She is a vigorous lady, and for the past many years, has been running a clothing purchase and sale business. She buys clothing in various fabrics, in different colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Now, she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan. Nasreen  expects a boost in her earnings with the loan and she plans to spend the part of her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of clothing in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her business

loans.name: Yeat's Group

texts.en:
Yeat, 59, is a farmer living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province. She is a widow woman, who has one dependent child. This breadwinner has been trying hard for ages to grow cassava to earn the main source of family’s income. 

This year, she is so disappointed with the price of crop products in the marker; she has to sell at a lower price. She leads a group of two to get a loan, which will be her third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan was paid back successfully and enabled her to improve her living standard . 

As a group leader, she will use her loan to buy cassava seeds, organic pesticides to prevent harm to the crops, and organic fertilizers to enrich the crop with nutrients. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living standards so they become much better than ever before.

loans.use: to buy cassava seeds, organic pesticide and organic fertilizers.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Janeth Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Janeth es una mujer laboriosa y emprendedora de 44 años de edad, casada, madre de 2 hijos de 10 y 17 años, Janeth es propietaria de una pulpería en su domicilio donde ofrece una amplia variedad de productos, trabaja junto a su esposo quien le ayuda a atender a los clientes y solicita por quinceava vez el financiamiento en la institución, ella ha mostrado ser una cliente fiel, responsable y puntual con los pagos, con los créditos anteriores logró comprar una mantenedora y dos vitrinas, actualmente solicita el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente y papel higiénico.
texts.en: Janeth is a hard-working and enterprising woman, 44 years old, married, and the mother of 2 children, ages 10 and 17. Janeth is the owner of a grocery store in her home where she offers a wide variety of products. She works with her husband who helps her serve the customers and asks for her fifteenth loan from the institution. She has shown herself to be a loyal client, responsible and punctual with her payments; with the previous loans she has managed to purchase a cooler and two display cases. She currently is asking for a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent and toilet paper.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen  is 63 years old and is a married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband  assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market and dealing with customers by sitting at the shop. 

Over time they have become popular in their community for providing good quality products and make enough to meet their expenses. Currently she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea to cater for a maximum number of customers and so generating healthier source of income. 

She is positive about her future earnings and will spend the part of her income on buying more items for her store.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items including grains, peas, flour, sugar and tea.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina  is a 34-year-old married woman who runs a home-based general store with her husband.  Her husband  purchases his inventory from the market and has maintained many contacts over the years. She has 3 children and is motivated to provide her family with quality food, clothing, and health. 

She wants to grow her business and requested a loan of 40,000 PKR  to buy salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juice to handle increasing demands. She will serve her customers efficiently, increase her earnings, and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy salt, biscuits, rice, spices, and juice.

loans.name: Nazeeran

texts.en:
Nazeeran  is a 46-year-old  married woman who raises animals. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She has 6 children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. 

She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase goats and calves to serve more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase goats and calves.

loans.name: Safaa

texts.en:
Safaa is a 45-year-old married woman with three children. Four years ago, she started selling home products and gifts. She is a sacrificing mother and hard working lady who is trying to help her husband to meet the increasing needs and expenses of their children.

Safaa is working hard to develop her business and requessts a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with a new collection of gifts and wedding decorations.  She plans to satisfy her customer's special requests for all occasions.

Safaa hopes to expand her business,increase her income, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of gifts and wedding decorations.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells green bananas from the market. She has been in this business for 6 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy bunches of green bananas. She sells to all categories of people on a retail basis seven days a week.

She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy iron sheets to roof her rental house. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, potatoes, yucca, plantains, churros, meat, juice, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is married with four children who all go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She sells fried chips at the market. She has been in this business for 5 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken, and cooking oil. She works seven days a week, selling to all categories of people on a retail basis.

Hadijah would like to buy a fridge to start selling cold drinks. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of Irish potatoes, beef, chicken, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Jodelyn

texts.en:
Internet cafés are beneficial to most Filipinos who cannot afford a monthly internet subscription. They can pay for one hour internet rental for an average fee of PHP 15 and they can still connect with their social network. Jodelyn, 50, knows this need that’s why she decided to create an internet café with an adjacent variety store beside her house in Davao City. She can help those students who need to research their school assignments, those families with members abroad who long to see each other through skype, and also those bored individuals who want to play online games. She is shooting two birds with one stone because she sells commodities while watching over her internet café. 

There are times when her internet café has few users. But during peak hours, customers line up to wait for their turn. Jodelyn wants to buy another computer to meet the needs of internet users during peak hours. She is requesting your help for an amount of PHP 20,000 for this purpose. She will use part of the loan to procure beverages for her store. This will ensure a higher profit for her so she can continuously support their daily expenditures and the educational expenses of her children. 

In due time, she will establish another business like this in a more populous spot. She is doing all these efforts to give her children a brighter future. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy another computer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 50 boxes of mineral water

loans.name: Dolores Del Socorro

texts.es: Dolores es una mujer laboriosa y emprendedora de 46 años de edad, soltera y madre de un hijo universitario de 22 años, a quien apoya para que sea un profesional exitoso. Hace cinco años emprendió con sus ahorros el negocio de venta de ropa y perfumes,  a causa de la creciente demanda de sus clientes solicita por quinto ciclo el financiamiento de la institución para comprar pantalones, camisas, camisetas y perfumes. Con el redito anterior logró mejorar su vivienda, su nueva meta es poner una pulpería en su domicilio.
texts.en:
46-year old Dolores is a hardworking and enterprising woman. She is the single mother of a 22-year old son who attends university. She supports him so that he can become a successful professional. 

Five years ago Dolores started a business with her savings selling clothing and perfume. Because of growing demand from her customers, she is seeking a fifth loan with this institution to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts, and perfume. With her earnings from her last loan, she managed to make repairs to her house. Her new goal is to open a small store in her home.

loans.use: buy pants, shirts, t-shirts and perfume

loans.name: Boss

texts.en:
Boss of  Kamwenge, Uganda used his previous loan to buy more items to sell at his store, like soap, salt, and many others. He now has five children and operates a retail shop, which he started so as to get income and improve his standard of living and pay school fees for his children. He earns additional income from farming and intends to expand his business into a wholesale shop. His main challenges are competition, inadequate capital and high rate of defaulters in his business.

He is requesting a loan to buy more items for his retail business like bread, basins and many others.

loans.use: to buy more items for his retail business like bread, basins and many others.

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.en:
Apolonio is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

He is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.  Apolonio has been in this business for 22 years. Apolonio earns more income from raising pigs.

Apolonio has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. He dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more beer.

loans.name: Jamlick

texts.en:
Jamlick is a married man with one child which attends school.He lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water.His greatest monthly expense is food and school fees .

He has operated a motorcycle business for the five years.In addition he operates a timber selling business that earns him another source of income.
He mentioned transportation is his business.

With the loan he is requesting he wants to add to his savings to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle to expand his business

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a widow and lives together with her four children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 20 years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Jemima

texts.en:
Jemima is a widow with six children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water .Her greatest monthly expense is food. She has been operating a farming business for the past three years. 

With the loan of Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do good farming.  She decided to join Yehu to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to do farming which is her business

loans.name: Sang Houy's Group

texts.en:
Sang Houy, 31, lives with family members in a rural area of the Battambang province and is a mother of two schoolchildren. She can earn income to support her family condition via cooking for weddings or other ceremonies. 

She does not have enough capital to buy ingredients to support her business well. For Sang Houy, this is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loan completely. With her past loan, she got good income to update her living to better conditions. 

She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy chairs, pans and more vegetables to support her cooking business. 

She hopes that she can get more income from her business to improve her family conditions.

loans.use: to buy chairs, pans and more vegetables to support her cooking business.

loans.name: Horn's Group

texts.en:
Horn, a farmer living in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, is 41 years old and a married mother of two children. She is a hard working woman.

Horn tries to earn income to support her family’s needs through working as a vendor. She has been in this job for ten years. Now, she lacks capital to support her business’ growth. Thus, she has decided to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). This will be the second time for her. With the previous loan, she earned benefits like being able to provide her family with enough healthy food and an improvement in their living standards. For this new cycle, the loan will be used to buy vegetables and chicken meat to sell in the market.
She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard much more than before.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and chicken meat to sell in the market.

loans.name: Ta's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in the Phnom Proek district of Battambang province, Ta is 50 years old and a married mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been selling some grocery items and desserts in her community for ages as her main source of income. Her husband works as a construction worker to supplement the family’s income.

Lacking capital to buy items to sell, she decides to lead a group of two members to get a new loan. This will be the second time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The previous loan, which she has already repaid, enabled her to renovate her house to a better standard than before. With the new loan she is applying for, she will buy some grocery items to sell and buy some ingredients to make desserts to sell.
She hopes to earn more income to improve her living standard to a much better level than before.

loans.use: to buy some ingredients to make desserts to sell and buy some grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Seanglen's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer, who lives in Sithor Kandal district of Prey Veng province, Seanglen is 32 years old and a married mother of three dependent children, one of whom is in school and the other two are under age of school. She has been making dessert to sell and raising pigs as the main sources of income for 12 years already. As she works alone on her business, she finds it hard to make more desserts and deliver it to customers. These lead her to earn not so much income. 

Leading a three-member group to get a loan, Seanglen is first to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her loan to buy rice and to buy pig feed for pig-farming business. She hopes to earn more income to support her family’s needs and improve the living condition much better.

loans.use: to buy rice and to buy pig feeds for a pig-farming business.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem  is a 46-year-old  hardworking woman who mends clothing. She is quite popular for her sewing skills. Tasleem ’s work brought the family out of a financial crisis that they were facing when she started working. 

Over the years, she has established a good customer base and requests 60,000 PKR to purchase a new stitching machine, thread, and laces to meet the demands of her customers. 

She aspires to save money for their prosperous future.

loans.use: to purchase a new stitching machine, thread,  and laces.

loans.name: Saima

texts.en: Saima  is a 30-year-old married woman who makes woolen items. She weaves caps, sweaters, and bed sheets at home, to sell in the market. She has requested  55,000 PKR to purchase yarns in different colors.  She plans to earn more income in the future and cover her household expenses.

loans.use: to purchase wool yarn.

loans.name: Anila

texts.en:
Anila is a 34-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is her husband, who is a van driver by profession. He drives in the main city and makes enough income to cover all the expenses of his family. 

He wants to change the van's engine, as it is causing a lot of pollution and is consuming too much oil for its work. That is why Anila has a requested a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers. 

Anila is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for the van to provide better facilities to his customers

loans.name: Lakshirani

texts.en:
41-year-old Lakhsmirani is a homemaker who hails from Falakata, Alipurduar district. A mother of two children; a son and a daughter, Lakhsmirani always strives hard for her children to receive proper education which she was deprived of in her childhood for her family’s financial issues. 

Her husband runs a small wood business and the income from the business is spent on the household expenses. So they are unable to provide their children with adequate study materials.

Her son, 17-year-old Uttam, has just started college and is studying for a B.A (bachelor of Arts) 1st year at Falakata college. He is a serious and studious boy. He has a long-cherished dream to be a teacher and wants to pursue a 3- year B. Ed. (Bachelor of Education) course. But his parents could not afford the college fee and the course fee as well. So Uttam thinks that his dream will be unfulfilled due to lack of money. In this situation Uttam's mother Lakhsmirani has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). 

With the help of this loan she will purchase her son's study materials, books and pay his course fees as well as college fees. She will also enroll her son in some coaching centre to continue his education so that he will be one step ahead towards his aim.

Lakhsmirani and Uttam are very much thankful to their generous lenders.

loans.use: To pay for the educational costs of her son's college education.

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena has successfully built her business of scrap with the support of Kashf Foundation and Kiva. She is working hard running her household activities. Previously, with the help of a Kiva loan, she was able to expand her business. 

Now she has applied a loan of 50,000 PKR  to buy more bottles in different sizes for increasing her sales.

loans.use: to buy more bottles in different sizes for increasing her sales

loans.name: Khalinur

texts.en:
Khalinur is 43 years old and lives in the village of Parangerpar in Falakata with her family members. She is a proud mother of 4 children (three sons and one daughter). Though she is illiterate and can sign her name, she was determined to provide education to her children. She is successful in her mission.  Her elder son completed his post-graduation in Arts. Two other sons, having a secondary level education, work for a small private company. Her only daughter studies in grade 11. Her husband is a fish vendor by profession.

Khalinur's elder son, 23-year-old Khadimul, is a bright young boy. He has completed his Masters Degree from Rabindra Bharati University. Now he is pursuing a 3-year B.Ed. (Bachelor of Education) course with an aim to be a good teacher. His father is the only member of the family earning money. Through his tireless efforts he earns an amount which hardly covers their family expenses. But Khalinur is keen to provide her elder son with a good education so that he can lead a life far better than theirs. For this, she approached Kiva’s partner BJS to fund for her son's education. 

She wants to utilize the loan amount to purchase materials necessary for her son to study as well as a bicycle and she will pay course fees. She also hopes that Khadimul will help them financially by doing a job after completing his B, Ed. degree. 

Khalinur and Khadimul (as in the photo) are thankful to their lenders.

loans.use: To bear the expenses for her elder son's Bachelor of Education degree.

loans.name: Gehan

texts.en: Gehan is 44, married to a government official and has 3 children. Her husband's income is very small and can't cover the family's monthly expenses. So she decided to start a crops packing project and signed a contract with a big company in Minia. She will supply the company with packed okra and will make a very good income out of that. She is requesting 15,000 EGP loan from TADE to buy okra from her neighboring farmers to pack more okra and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy okra from neighboring farmers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 63-year-old married father of seven children and a Palestinian refugee who lives in a Palestinian refugee camp. Due to the low social and financial situations of Palestinians in Lebanon, especially those who live in camps, he started four years ago renting motorcycles to cover the needs and expenses of his family.

Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy three more motorcycles in order to develop his business and satisfy more customers. Mohamad hopes to expand his business in the future through opening a motorcycle repair and accessories shop to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions inside the camp.

loans.use: to buy three more motorcycles in order to develop his business

loans.name: Callen

texts.en:
Callen is 52 years old and supports five children.  She has been a farmer for 10 years and earns 11,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for 25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for a better harvest. 

She plans to educate her children and purchase a dairy cow for milk production.

Her hope is to be financially stable, expand her agricultural sector, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
The key to a more appealing “sari-sari” or variety store is its wide inventory. 

Jovelyn’s store is still struggling, as you can see in the picture. This is why she wants to avail herself of a PHP 50,000 loan to buy a volume of supplies, like grocery items and dry goods. These additional stocks will enhance the competitiveness of her store within her community in Davao City. 

If her sari-sari will grow and progress according to her plan, its income can sufficiently meet her basic needs and she can constantly support her nephews and nieces in their school needs. Her next plan is to beautify the façade of her store, to entice more buyers. 
 
Every week, Jovelyn meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from God. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay their microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a volume of supplies, like grocery items and dry goods.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 21 years old, single and has two children. She wants to earn for an income to provide her children so she engaged in fish vending. Buying fish and selling them in the market.She aims for a better income because of the increasing needs of her children so she decided to buy more fish for selling and be able to sell more fish in the market that will generate more income.

Josephine plan for the future to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish for selling.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 30 years old and  supports two children.  She has been a farmer for 10 years and  earns  15,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for  25,000 KES from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizer for a better harvest. 

She plans to educate her children and purchase a dairy cow for milk production. 

Her hope is to be financially stable, expand her agricultural sector, and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Hoima Uganda. She is a very hard working lady who loves having a stable source of income, hence dealing in the produce business mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice. 

In order to supplement her business she ventured into farming of cassava and beans. She is seeking for credit facility to buy more maize and beans for sale.

loans.use: to buy more maize and beans for sell.

loans.name: Mary Salomy

texts.en:
Mary Salomy is a 52 year old single parent with 1 child living in Fort Portal Uganda. She owns a restaurant a business she started with a hope of earning income. She faces challenges of less capital that hinder expansion of her business. 

Mary Salomy has asked for a loan to buy food and more tables for her restaurant business.

loans.use: to buy food and more tables for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Relyn

texts.en:
Relyn is 33 years old, married with three children. 

Relyn is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Relyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Relyn has been farming sugarcane for three years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Relyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 детей. У Назгул - среднее образование. Она работает поваром в кафе, также в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи она занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с 1,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Назгул, на сегодняшний день имеется: корова, 10 овец, в аренде 0,50 ГА поливной земельной доли, на которой она ежегодно выращивает ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 нетелей для откорма на пастбище и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на постройку сараев для скота.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 35, married, and raising three children with her husband.  She has a secondary education.  She works as a cook in a cafe.  She also provides an additional income for her family by working in agriculture and animal husbandry.  She started these two activities 15 years ago with a capital of 1,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns one cow and ten sheep.  She also rents 0.5 hectares of irrigated land on which she grows barley annually for domestic consumption on the farm and for resale.  She makes a monthly income of 19,000 som (KGS).  

In order to further grow her business, Nazgul has turned to Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy two heifers which she will fatten up in the fields and then resell.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to increase her numbers of domestic animals.  She also wants to save enough money to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to fatten up in the fields and then further resell.

loans.name: Philistinah

texts.en:
Philistinah is a single woman with one child, who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.
With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Sokheng's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Battambang province, Sokheng is 48 years old and a mother of three children. She grows cassava. Her husband is a carpenter and earns extra income to improve the family's living condition. 

She has not have enough capital to buy fertilizer to support her cassava farm. This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous loan.  She is a group leader and will use her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to plow her cassava farm. 

She hopes that she can increase her income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Kady

texts.en:
Kady is 35 years old and married. His wife is a housewife and they have a son and a daughter.

Kady is a farmer. He started a small butcher shop project as he has some experience in butchery. Kady is requesting a 3,000 EGP loan to buy meat and generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell in his butcher's shop.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem  is a 38-year-old married woman who sells animals. She buys baby goats and calves at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She earns enough money  to contribute to the family's income. She also sells milk to generate additional income. 

She contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of 40,000 PKR  to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. She plans to expand her business and income.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, wood, and nails to build a small shed outside on the porch of her house

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana es una mujer laboriosa de 43 años de edad, casada y madre de cuatro hijos de los cuales dos tiene a su cargo  y dos son independientes, hace cinco años ella emprendió un nuevo negocio de venta de ropa y calzado, con la oferta de ello logra satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, pero tiene un nuevo propósito que consiste en desarrollar el negocio, por tanto solicita el crédito por sexta vez en la institución para la compra de camisas, talladores, chores y sandalias, con los créditos anteriores logró mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en: Ana is a hard-working 43 year old woman. She is married and the mother of four children, two of whom she takes care of and two are independent. Five years ago she started a new business selling clothing and footwear and offering them she has manged to satisfy demand from her clients. But she has a new proposal which is to expand her business. So she is requesting her sixth loan from the institution to buy shirts, brassieres, shorts and sandals. With her previous loans she has managed to make improvements on her house.

loans.use: to buy shirts, brassieres, shorts and sandals.

loans.name: Jose Gustavo

texts.es:
El señor Jose tiene 41 años de edad, vive en una comunidad de Trojes, El Paraíso, al Oriente de Honduras, Su actividad principal es la Caficultura, actividad productiva con la que cuenta con 15 años de experiencia.
Don Jose de esta actividad el  obtiene los ingresos para cubrir sus gastos familiares y financieros contraidos, es una persona muy conocida en la aldea por ser muy responsable y muy dedicado al trabajo, el crédito que nos ha solicitado espera la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivos.
Don José espera que esta inverison le genere mayores ingresos en el hogar, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su finca y en las proximas cosecha obtener mejores resultados.



Trojes, Honduras – Junio del 2015.
texts.en:
41-year old Sr. José lives in the community of Trojes, El Paraíso, in the east of Honduras.  His main job is growing coffee, a job he's had for 15 years. The money he earns is used to cover household expenses and financial arrangements. He is well-known in the municipality as a very responsible person who is dedicated to his work. The loan he is seeking will be used to buy fertilizer for his fields.

With this purchase José expects to generate more income for his family. One of his dreams is to improve his farm and have  better harvests in the coming years.

Trojes, Honduras --  June, 2015

loans.use: buy fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost his posho sales by buying more posho for selling

loans.name: Martha Elena

texts.es: Doña Martha es una mujer  trabajadora de 49 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos quienes son independientes gracias al esfuerzo que hizo ella para sacarlos adelante, ella es propietaria de un a pulpería desde hace cinco años, con el apoyo de su marido han logrado sacar adelante el negocio de manera que,  él le ayuda a despachar a los clientes ó realizar las compras de los productos que se ofrecen en la pulpería. Una de sus metas es desarrollar el negocio, por tanto solicita por quinta vez el financiamiento en la institución a fin de lograr aumentar la oferta de productos en su pulpería,  el crédito lo solicita para la compra de arroz, azúcar, aceite, jabón, detergente, papel higiénico y gaseosa.
texts.en:
Doña Martha is a hardworking woman of 49 years. She is in a relationship, and has four children who are independent, thanks to the effort she put into bringing them up.

She has been the proprietor of a grocery store for five years. With the support of her husband, they have successfully grown the business through him assisting clients or ringing up the products people purchase which are on offer in the store.

One of their goals is to expand their business, therefore, Doña Martha is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, toilet paper, and soft drinks.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil, soap, detergent, toilet paper, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Grupo Amanecer Group

texts.es: Grupo Amanecer está conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas y un hombre trabajador, coordinado por concepción de 36 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de diez años, quien es su mayor motivación para salir adelante, desde hace cinco años ella se ha dedicado a la hecha y venta de nacatamales el crédito lo solicita para la compra de carne, maíz, papa, vegetales y hojas de chagüite, la segunda socia es Karla de 5 años quien se dedica a la venta de comida, el tercer socio es Eliseo de 39 años quien se dedica a la venta de ropa y la cuarta socia es doña Julia de 42 años propietaria de una pulpería.
texts.en:
The Amanecer group is made up of three hard-working women and one man, coordinated by Concepción. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of a ten year old son who is her main motivation to get ahead. For the past five years she has worked making and selling nacatamales (a Nicaraguan steamed corn-cake). She is requesting the loan to buy meat, corn, potatoes, vegetables and banana leaves.

Karla is the second member. She has been selling food for five years. The third member is Eliseo who is 39 years old and sells clothing. The fourth member is Julia who is 42 years old and the owner of a small store.

loans.use: to buy meat, corn, potatoes, vegetables and banana leaves.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie has been so devoted in managing her current business for five years now. Since the couple has to ensure the security of the future of their children, they are indeed striving hard to provide for the family today. 

Driven to really achieve a better life in the future, Anie exerts a lot of effort to improve her resources. Previously, she had a loan from KIVA and it was a great relief for the family because she was able to continue her business operations and also use a portion of it for her food stall business.  

Hoping that you can help her again, Anie would like to ask for a PHP 15,000 loan. She would like to use this amount to purchase additional stock of a variety of products for her sari-sari store business. She expects that, through this, she can experience a boost in her product sales. 

It is her dream to expand her business someday and she believes that without a sense of passion, life is plain nothing. So, she really hopes that you help her with this and she'll pursue for her dream in return. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of a variety of products for her sari-sari store business.

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
TWITEZIMBERE a group led by Venantie who is 53 years old. The group name means “Develop each other” in English. She is married with 6 children aged 15-30. She sells food stuffs and has been doing this business for the past 10 years. The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more beans and rice for sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and buy a cow for rearing.

loans.use: to buy more beans and rice for selling.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Contribute now for Juanita. Recently, she was granted a loan which she used for improving her inventory. With heartfelt thanks, she would like the help of another loan worth PHP 30,000. This time, she will utilize this to add heaps of grocery items to her sari-sari store. 

Surely, this loan, if granted, will help sustain the family needs basically their main expenses for everyday living. She is hopeful that through your helping hands, she will be able to expand her trade someday. 

She simply prays that she will have the strength to endure and work hard so she can give her family a better life someday. She meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to add grocery items to her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more items such as snacks, biscuits, mineral water, soft drinks, cigarettes, tissues etc to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is aged 26 years, married to Timothy, and she supports 2 children.

She has been a shopkeeper for the last 3 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase additional stock of home products like cooking oil, baking flour, and soap for sale.

She plans to use the profit she gains to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and repay the loan.

Her hope is to increase her stocks of maize and beans for selling to clients.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of home products like cooking oil, baking flour, and soap for sale.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 28, lives in Wangeyo-Kibaale. He had viable business ideas but didn’t have enough capital to start his own business until he joined Ugafode, where he attained training on how to establish and run profitable business activities.
Francis is married and looks after three children aged five, three and two. One is school-going. Before joining Ugafode, he didn’t have the confidence to run a business.
After the training, he has improved his business and was able to start building a house for which he wants a loan of UGX 3,000,000 to improve his living standards and those of his family members.
He dreams of seeing all his children graduate. He is a produce dealer but faces problems like price fluctuation and his additional farming business is also too seasonal.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Holmuhammad

texts.en:
Holmuhammad is an active guy. He was born in the southern part of Tajikistan into a family of workers. He is single and his family is big. He is a second year student at university. He studies well and is well known among his friends and course mates. He likes his major and wants to be a professional. He likes to read, and help his parents with the household. He is well mannered and a gentle person.

Holmuhammad appealed to IMON asking for a loan to pay his higher education costs. He hopes to be supported and awaits Kiva lenders' kindness.

loans.use: to pay his higher education costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and to pay for school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest for family use and for selling the surplus to clients.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 54 years old, married and supports a family of seven children. 

He has been operating his retail shop for the last 15 years earning KES 18,000 per month. 

James has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to supply him in that area to gain more income. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and to supply him in that area to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy swine feed swine and inventory for sari-sari store, as well as to pay for school fees

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is aged 37 years and he supports three children. He has been a brick seller for the last three years and the business earns him KES 7,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase iron sheets, timber, nails and posts for making a house to keep his fired bricks. This will avoid them being rained on and getting damaged or destroyed.

He plans to use his business profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate his children. His hope is to eradicate poverty and expand his agricultural sector and also improve his housing.

loans.use: to purchase iron sheets, timber, nails and posts for making a house to keep his fired bricks and avoid them being rained on and getting damaged or destroyed.

loans.name: Rodelyn

texts.en:
Rodelyn became an entrepreneur four years ago. She currently handles a direct-selling business. She started only with a small amount of capital with which to buy her first products. But, because of her steadfast determination, she has now earned the trust of her customers. Although, there are times when she struggles, such as when there are delayed payments, she still works hard because she believes that such situations are an inevitable part of handling a business.

She is 43 years old, married to Dionirio and has three kids. She sells different kinds of products, mostly personal products like soaps, lotion, perfumes and the like. The profit she gets from the business becomes a great help for their family basically in terms of their daily expenses. 

Rodelyn is a typical mother with a typical dream for her children. There is nothing more that she hopes aside from her children gaining a better quality of education and getting college degree. 

That is the reason why she wants to further improve her resources.  If you would allow, she wants to ask for an 8,000 PHP loan which she will use for buying more products to sell. With this, she can surely gain more income. Part of what she will gain she will save for future investments and part will be used for their everyday living.  

You’ll be a great blessing in advance. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness. 

Rodelyn meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is aged 58 years, married to Beatrice and supports three children. 

He has been a dairy farmer for the last two years and the business earns him KES 4,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily. 

He plans to use the gained profit to repay the loan and purchase chicks for rearing. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector and be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of liters of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Peterson

texts.en:
Peterson is 38 years old, married and supports a family of three children. 

He has been practicing sewing for the last 20 years earning KES 15,000 per month. 

Peterson has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply him in that area to gain more income.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. 

His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply him in that area to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Damiano

texts.en:
Damiano is an old client of the institution. He is married with three children who attend school. He is a resident of Rugorogoro Rwanja West. Damiano is an agriculturalist, a job he has done for over 15 years. He also runs a retail shop to supplement the family income. 

His major hindrance is limited capital to expand his agricultural projects. He has applied for a loan of UGX 2,500,000 to buy agricultural inputs like fertilizer so as to increase on his production. Damiano thanks UGAFODE for its assistance, which has enabled him to increase on his income from agricultural production. He encourages UGAFODE to continue supporting low-income earners.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is a smallholder farmer based in the Chuka area of Kenya. He is married and has 4 children. For 20 years, Timothy has been doing mixed farming. He has dairy cattle, poultry, tomatoes, bananas, vegetables and trees on his 1 acre farmland.

Timothy is seeking a loan to construct a cowshed for his 4 cows. He will use the money to buy construction materials and pay for the relevant transportation and labor costs.

The cowshed, once constructed, will provide an ample environment for his cows to feed and rest. This loan investment will help Timothy to cut animal healthcare expenses and make more income from enhanced productivity of the animals.

loans.use: to construct a cowshed

loans.name: Urumuri Group

texts.en:
Marie Alice is a group leader; she is aged 32 years. She is married with 1 child who is 5 years old. The group is called Urumuri, which means “Light” in English. They sell different products and they wish to expand their business for making their future better.

She owns a shop and has been running her business for 8 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, and snacks to sell. The profits from the business will be used to add to her savings and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and snacks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Alex

texts.en: Alex is a new client in this institution; he deals in timber trade and production in the Rwakabengo ward in the town on Rukungiriwhich. He has operated this business for 6 years. He applied for a loan of ugx2,000,000; the purpose of this loan is to purchase more trees for cutting timber so that he can increase his capital and earn more profits to satisfy his family financial needs, most especially school for his children. Alex has been limited by his capital to expand; therefore he hopes to expand his business using the loan facility from Ugafode. He is appreciative of the UGAFODE support and partnership.

loans.use: To purchase trees for cutting into timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production to supply his area for more income gain

loans.name: Los Lirios Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los lirios esta conformado por tres mujeres laboriosas coordinado por Besayda de 42 años de edad acompañada y madre de dos hijos de la edad de 20 y 16 años, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada de manera ambulante desde hace diez años, una de sus metas es poner su propia tiendita de ropa. Solicita por cuarto ciclo el financiamiento en ADIM, para la compra de chores, blusas, camisetas y chinelas con el crédito anterior logró aumentar su capital y realizar mejoras en su vivienda, la segunda socia es Reyna de 40 años quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y la tercer socia es doña Ruth de 48 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y prendas.
texts.en:
The solidarity group called “Los Lirios” (The Lilies) consists of three working women. The group coordinator is Besayda. She is 42 years old, in a relationship, and the mother of two children (ages 20 and 16). Besayda has been selling used clothing as a street vendor for 10 years. One of her goals is to open a small clothing store. She is requesting her fourth loan from ADIM in order to buy shorts, blouses, T-shirts, and slippers. With her previous loan, she was able to increase her capital and make improvements to her home.

The second member is Reyna, age 40, who sells cosmetics. The third member is Doña Ruth, age 48, who sells cosmetics and clothing.

loans.use: to buy shorts, blouses, T-shirts, and slippers.

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith es residente en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla y se dedica al comercio desde el  año 2005, su idea de negocio surgió cuando decidió seguir el consejo de una amiga de invertir sus ahorros  en mercancías varias y se dio cuenta que era un buen negocio.  Con esta experiencia tan favorable, desde entonces ha continuado en el comercio de prendas de vestir y artículos para el hogar, adicionalmente ofrece a sus vecinos y transeúntes del sector desayunos todas las mañanas a partir de las 6 a.m. Judith con empeño y dedicación ha logrado sacar adelante sus negocios, ella está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en tendidos de cama y prendas de vestir; camisa, jeans, vestidos.  Esta inversión le permitirá entregar prontamente pedidos a sus clientes y adquirir buenas ganancias.  Su meta de prosperidad es ampliar su negocio y ser conocida en otras localidades de la ciudad.
texts.en:
Judith lives in a community south of Barranquilla and has been working in this business since the year 2005. The idea for her business started when she decided to follow the advice of a friend, to invest her savings in merchandise.  She realized it was a good business.

With this positive experience, she continued selling clothing articles and home goods. In addition, she provides her neighbors and passers-by in the area with breakfast every morning starting at 6 a.m.

Judith, with a lot of effort and dedication has been able to get her business ahead. She is applying for a "credikiva", this is the first loan she request from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in bed covers and clothes; shirts, jeans, dresses. This investment will allow her to deliver the orders to her customers faster and generate better income. Her goal to succeed is to expand her business and to be known in other areas of the city.

loans.use: to invest in bed covers and clothes; shirts, jeans, dresses.

loans.name: Roselle Joyce

texts.en:
Education is the most important thing in a person's life. It is the key to what you call "success". 
It's heartbreaking to know that, around the globe right now, only a few percent of young students finish their college degrees. Worse, either they end up building a family at a young age or working for their family. 

But Roselle holds a dream- a dream that she can't just let go just because of financial incapacity. She has the urge to study. In fact, she loves reading books and she enjoys her mathematics classes. She's taking up a Business Administration major in the Financial Management department at Trinity University of Asia. She's 17 years old and currently residing at Novaliches, Quezon City with her family. 

"I see myself having a position someday in a certain company five to ten years from now. That's why I'm doing my best to maintain good grades.", she said. 

Her mother operates a direct-selling business to support them (Roselle and her two siblings). School wasn't easy, she admits, especially when they have group work and lots of requirements. "Though my first semester is not that challenging, I found myself realizing that I need to really become more responsible in managing my time. In college life, you really need to be independent." 

She really wants to graduate and be successful someday. And that won't happen if she stops right now. She's almost near the finish line. With full hope, she believes that you'll help her. A 30,000 peso loan would be enough to cover her needs in school, like tuition fees and other miscellaneous fees. 

"I know we are like a family. That's why I'm thanking in advance those who will be touched to help me. I'm taking this as a very good opportunity. Thank you for letting me apply indeed."

loans.use: to cover her needs in school, like tuition fees and other miscellaneous fees.

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
This is Perla and she would like to borrow a loan that will definitely help improve her business. 

Perla, 43, is a resident of Las Pinas City. She is married to Felix. Today, they are already blessed with five kids and three of them are currently studying. It was a tough responsibility, indeed, to be parents, but the couple is really working hard to provide for their children's education. 

In fact, in four years in her enterprise, Perla has always made sure that her business (sari-sari store) is always in good condition, ensuring that it is a reliable source of income. As a plan, she would like to borrow a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be using this to fill her store with additional variety products to sell. This will become a good opportunity for her to further establish her business since she offers commodities, which are always in good demand from the people. 

She wants to include that your help will never be wasted once you entrusted her this chance. Instead, she will be using every open door to work hard and slowly reach her dream of expanding her business. With this, she can save money, enough to send her children to college and enable them finish their studies. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to fill her store with additional variety products to sell.

loans.name: Flor De Jazmin Group

texts.es:
¨Flor de Jazmin¨, es un grupo de mujeres emprendedoras y luchadoras, ellas  tienen su negocio y solicitan por primera vez a ADIM y a los socios de KIVA el financiamiento para aumentar las ganancias. 
Quien coordina el grupo es Teresa, soltera y con 3 hijos, de edades de 14, 11 y 8 años, quienes esforzadamente los manda al colegio de secundaria y primaria para que reciban la preparación necesaria que los haga salir adelante. A sus 35 años esta señora se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida, inicio este negocio con dinero que su mama le proporciono hace 5 años, con el dinero que recibirá lo invertirá para que su inventario sea mayor y comprara arroz, repollo, plátano, aceite, harina, leña, pollo y carne. Entre sus sueños esta ampliar el negocio y hacerles mejoras al local para que el ambiente se vuelva más agradable. Las demás socias son Danelya, de 32 años y Juana de 51 años, ambas se dedican a la venta de plantas en su comunidad.
texts.en:
"Flor de Jazmin" is a group of entrepreneurial and hard working women. They have a business and are requesting, for the first time, a loan from ADIM and the Kiva members to expand their earnings.

Teresa coordinates the group. She is single and has three children who are 14, 11 and 8 years old and who she vigorously sends the secondary and primary school so they receive the necessary preparation to succeed. At 35 years of age, she is dedicated to preparing and selling food. She began this business with money that her mother gave her five years ago. With the money that she will receive, she will invest so that her inventory improves and will buy rice, cabbage, plantain, oil, flour, wood, chicken and meat. Among her dreams are to expand the business and make improvements on the shop so the ambiance becomes more pleasant. The other members are Danelya who is 32 and Juana, 51. Both are dedicated to selling plants in their community.

loans.use: to buy rice, cabbage, plantain, oil, flour, wood, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Paula

texts.es: Paula de 46 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad a lado de su esposo y de sus tres hijos de 14, 9 y 5 años de edad. Paula es una mujer que posee una pequeña tienda de productos básicos entre los cuales tenemos: bebidas, sopas, golosinas,  huevos, entre otro productos más de consumo diario, además junto con su esposo se dedican a vender verduras de forma ambulante en los alrededores de su comunidad con el objetivo de generar mayores ingresos económicos. Paula por motivos de que su negocio día a día va creciendo gracias a la preferencia de las personas por su productos a tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito FUSAI para poder  comprar una refrigeradora más grande ya que actualmente posee una en la que ya no le alcanza el espacio para guardar todos sus productos que necesitan estar en refrigeración como lo son los lácteos, las bebidas, embutidos, etc.
texts.en:
Paula is 46 years old and resides in her own home along with her husband and three children (ages 14, 9, and 5). She has a small store where she sells basic products such as beverages, soups, snacks, eggs, and other everyday items. In addition, she sells vegetables with her husband as traveling vendors by going to the surrounding neighborhoods of her community. They do this in order to generate more income.

Paula is motivated to grow her business, which is expanding every day thanks to the people who choose to buy products from her. She decided to request a loan from FUSAI in order to buy a larger refrigerator. The one that she currently has does not have enough space for storing all of her products that need refrigeration such as dairy items, beverages, sausages, and other goods.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her store.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is aged 37 years, married to Everline and supports five children. 

He has a farmer for the last six years, and the business earns him KES 16,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest. 

He plans to use the gained profit to educate his children and repay the loan. 

His hopes are to expand his agricultural business and to be financially stable.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest

loans.name: Ana Yessica

texts.es:
Ana, de 31 años de edad, se dedica al comercio y la agricultura, estudio hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un niño de 3 años de edad y creció con su papá porque su madre la abandono.

Ana, se dedica a comercializar granos básicos como maíz y frijoles en su vivienda y en el mercado de la ciudad, porque en ese lugar obtiene mayores ventas de los productos que tiene.  

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar más granos básicos e incrementar la mercadería para su negocio, porque de esta manera su negocio seguirá dando buenas ganancias.

Ana, desea adquirir otro crédito más grande para comprar vacas y empezar a elaborar lácteos para tener otra fuente más de ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is 31 years old and makes a living selling and with agriculture. She studied until high school, is a single mother of a 3 years old son and grew up with her father because her mother abandoned her.

Ana makes a living selling basic grains such as corn and beans in her house and in the city market, because in this place she sells more of her products.

Ana needs a loan to purchase more staple grains and increase the merchandise for her business. This way her business can continue to provide good income.  Ana would also like to obtain another loan to purchase cows to start making dairy products and have another source of income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more basic grains and increase the merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a small-scale grower of organic Hass avocado. He is 56 years old and lives in Chao, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. He has been engaged in agriculture for many years, and has supported his family with his farm.

Felix is seeking a loan of $1,700 in order to buy more Hass avocado trees and expand his production. The increased income will help  Felix support and improve the education of his grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more organic Hass avocado trees and expand his production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed

loans.name: Tres Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Tres mujeres¨, está conformado por emprendedoras que trabajan el día a día para sacar adelante a su familia y brindarles mejores condiciones económicas.
La coordinadora del grupo es María de 44 años de edad, ella es una mujer alegre y con muchas virtudes, solicitando a ADIM crédito para mejorar su negocio, se dedica a la venta de especies hace 16 años, este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda económica de su esposo, tiene 2 hijos del cual uno trabaja y su hija cursa la educación secundaria. Con el dinero invertirá en la compra de achiote, salsa inglesa, mostaza, canelas y clavos de olor. 
Las demás integrantes son Yeslenia quien desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de especies de manera ambulante y Petrona también se dedica a la venta de especies desde hace 12 años.
texts.en:
The group named “Tres Mujeres” (Three Women) consists of entrepreneurs who work each day so that they can help their families get ahead and provide them with better financial conditions.

The group coordinator is María, age 44. She is a cheerful woman who has many virtues. María is requesting a loan from ADIM in order to improve her business. She has been selling spices for 16 years. María started this business with financial help from her husband. She has two children, one who is working and another who is in high school. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of annatto, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, cinnamon, and cloves.

The other members include Yeslenia, who has also been selling spices for seven years as a street vendor. Petrona sells spices as well and has been doing this for 12 years.

loans.use: to buy annatto, Worcestershire sauce, mustard, cinnamon, and cloves.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo Reyes is 48 years old, is married and has three children. He lives in Chao-La Libertad - Peru, and supports his family by growing organic avocados. His wife and children help him with the farm work.

Eduardo needs a loan of $ 1,300 to buy fertilizers and improve organic Hass avocado production, because he wants to giver a higher quality education for their eldest daughter, who wishes to become a civil engineer.

loans.use: to grow and sell organic avocados, so that his eldest daughter may study to become a civil engineer

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
