Rosalina is 36 years old, married and has three children. To earn living and be able to help her husband, who is a driver, she is engaged in a sari-sari store business to provide for the needs of her children. 

She aims for a better income for her family, so she decided to borrow a loan to buy more goods to sell and increase her store's inventory to generate more income.

Rosalina's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more goods to sell.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 59 years old and single. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. 

Gloria requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to resell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gloria has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional amount of electronic mobile load to sell

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is a young single mother of two who lives and works in the Majengo area in the outskirts of Gikomba Market. For over five years she has been running a mini-bar restaurant, through which she provides for her two children. However, by the end of this year, Laura’s goal is to expand her business ventures, and as she says, her business interests are within the service provision industry.

Laura has experienced poor sanitation first-hand. Prior to Majengo, she lived in Kayole’s informal settlement, and the lack of toilets for her family has been a consistent challenge.

Since Fresh Life Toilets began penetrating her neighborhood, she has been keen to note the impact access to toilets has had in her community, hence her interest to join the movement.

By establishing a Fresh Life Toilet enterprise, she is optimistic that she will not only ensure her family and neighboring community has access to clean and hygienic toilets at all times, but that ultimately sanitation will improve in the whole Majengo area.

Let us help Laura in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheelbarrows for the transportation of construction materials to required sites

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina hails from Dumanjug, Cebu. She is a 40-year-old married woman and has six children. The oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest child is 9 years old. She has been in the business of raising hogs for 9 years. Each month she earns about PHP 4,500. Gina’s husband is a driver; they work together to be able to provide for all the needs of their children. She is asking for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy additional piglets and feed, and to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she hopes to have her own capital to run a business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married mother of two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over five years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is a Clinical Officer at Kiambu Hospital. She is also an entrepreneur who runs a pharmacy shop in her home area, Makongeni.

At home, Josephine is popularly known as "daktari" (doctor) because she provides her community with healthy living tips as well as medical attention when they need it. 

In some areas of Makongeni, toilet access has not been easy to come by, and as such Josephine's community has grappled with sanitation-related illnesses such as diarrhea. For her part, she has helped provide medical attention to the victims, as well as mitigation measures against sanitation-related illnesses.  

Since Fresh Life Toilets began penetrating these areas, Josephine has been among those acknowledging an improvement in sanitation standards among community members. They are now fond of Fresh Life Toilets, hence she is motivated to establish a facility in her ongoing expansion project of her pharmacy into a Clinic Center. 

She anticipates that this facility will not only serve her customers and staff, but through it she will further help her community internalize good hygiene practices such as hand washing, a feature she loves about the Fresh Life Toilets.

Let us help Josephine in acquiring one Fresh Life Toilet!

loans.use: To pay for one Fresh Life Toilet.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chemicals to spray on her crops to kill fungi and weeds that compete for soil nutrients  to enable her to get a high quality of produce to sell.

loans.name: Transito Del Carmen

texts.es: Transito de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol), se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, vende sus productos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abono, etc. para continuar con sus siembras y así poder tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Transito is 42 years old and lives in a her own house with her husband and two children. Transito has been making a living growing basic grains (corn and beans) for four years. She sells her products in neighbouring towns and uses profits from sales to cover some household costs. 

Transito is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure and more and continue with her crops. She can thus earn a higher income and enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure and more.

loans.name: Work For Work Group

texts.en:
Isatu is a 34-year-old business woman and a member of Work for Work solidarity group, which has four members, all women.  Isatu sells drinks and has been in this business for the past three years.  She opens her business six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. 
Isatu established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Isatu  is in the middle of the group picture.
Isatu and her group members need a loan of 4,000,000 SLL of which Isatu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL which she will use to buy assorted drinks for her business.
She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Isatu is married and has two children, ages 5 and 2 with the older child in school.
In the future, Isatu plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to the university level will better the lives of her family.
Isatu is very appreciative to anyonewho can help.

loans.use: to buy assorted drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To boost her matresses business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: José Federico

texts.en:
José Federico owns 20 cows and dedicates himself to selling their milk. He used to pile his cows' manure up outside his farm, where it was generating bad smells and attracting a lot of flies, in addition to being a source of the spread of disease. 

In parallel, he was spending an important proportion of his revenue on LP gas to supply his home and farm with energy. By investing in a waste-to-energy biodigester, José Federico will be able to transform what he used to see as waste into a precious resource: biogas. By connecting the biodigester to the cookstove, boiler, and eventually the milking machine, he will be able to fully displace LP gas, thereby saving money and protecting the environment by eliminating fossil fuels from his farm. 

Not only will his operations become more cost-effective, but he will also live in a cleaner, more sustainable environment and reduce his carbon footprint.

This loan represents 27% of the total cost of the biodigester, the remaining part being covered by a government subsidy.

loans.use: to invest in a 40-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a single mother of four children, all attending school. She also takes care of additional family members. She operates a food stall. She has been in this business for six years. She has applied for a loan from MCDT-SACCO to buy green bananas, tomatoes, onions, cassava and cabbages. She works from the market seven days a week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality of food and high transportation costs. She would like to start farming in the future to expand her sources of income. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying rent.

loans.use: to buy green bananas, tomatoes, onions, cassava and cabbages.

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana tiene 37 años de edad, y habita con su grupo familiar conformado por  su esposo y sus tres hijos de 17, 13 y 6 años de edad. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto a su esposo luchan a diario para que en el hogar nunca falte el pan de cada día. Ella se dedica desde hace varios años  al arte de corte y confección en la elaboración de: vestidos para boda, quince años, primera comunión, trajes para boda entre otras muchas prendas más en su casa de habitación. Ana con el propósito de brindar a sus clientes un trabajo mas rápido y no defraudar la confianza que los clientes depositan en su persona a tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial rana con el propósito de brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y mayor rapidez en la entrega de sus servicios.
texts.en:
Ana is 37 years old and lives with her family, which is made up of her husband and their three children, who are 17, 13, and 6 years old. Ana is a hardworking woman who, along with her husband, fights every day in order to ensure that their household is never lacking its daily bread. For many years, she has made a living as a seamstress, creating things like wedding dresses, quinceañera dresses, communion dresses, wedding suits, and many other things in her home. 

In order to provide faster service and not betray their confidence, she has decided to take a loan from FUSAI in order to purchase an industrial sewing machine. This way, she will be able to provide better service and faster turnaround.

loans.use: to purchase an industrial sewing machine in order to provide better service and faster turnaround to her customers.

loans.name: Arca Del Pacto Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Arca del pacto está conformado por tres mujeres emprendedoras, coordinado por Ángela de 45 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo, ella es una mujer laboriosa que hace dos años inicio con recursos propios el negocio de venta de ropa usada, solicita por quinto ciclo el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de pantalones, camisas, sabanas y cubre camas, con créditos anterior logro mejorar el techo de su vivienda, la segunda socia es Yahoska de 28 años de edad quien se dedica a la venta d tarjetas de invitación y recuerdos y la tercer socia es María de 23 años propietaria de una mini pulpería.
texts.en:
The "Arca del Pacto" communal bank has three enterprising members, all women, and is coordinated by 45-year-old Ángela. She is married and mother to one son. Ángela is hard working and two years ago started her business with her own capital. She sells used clothes. 

She is now applying for her fifth loan in order to buy trousers, shirts, bed sheets and bed covers. With previous loans, Ángela was able to make improvements to the roof of her home.

The second member of the group is 28-year-old Yahoska, who makes a living making invitations cards and souvenirs. The third member is 23-year-old María, owner of a mini grocery store.

loans.use: to buy trousers, shirts, bed sheets and bed covers.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: This is Vasil and his wife Gjeline, who need your financial help again. She had the surgery with your previous loan sometime ago and she has to continue being on medication and this is why they are requesting this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his wife's medical expenses.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Luis Antonio de 44  años de edad, vive con su esposa,  tiene 01 hijo que dependen de él,  posee casa propia y se dedica desde hace mas de 25 años al negocio del transporte, sus clientes son los alumnos de la escuelas, iglesias, colegios y de las fincas también vecinos y amigos que lo conocen.
Don Luis Antonio es un hombre emprendedor que quiere salir adelante con su hijo está solicitando el préstamo para la compra de seis llantas semi nuevas, con el apoyo del préstamo podrá suplir su necesidad de financiamiento,  y podrá mejorar su unidad de transporte, está muy contento de seguir trabajando con Prisma es su cuarto préstamo que solicita. Su sueño es seguir mejorando su carro y comprarse otra unidad.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2015
texts.en:
Luis Antonio, 44, lives with his wife in his own house.  He has one dependent child.  He's an enterprising man who wants to get ahead with his son.  He has worked in the transportation business for more than 25 years.  His customers are students in schools, churches, and high schools, as well as farm neighbors and friends who know him.

Luis Antonio is requesting the loan to buy six pre-owned tires.  He'll be able to satisfy his need for financing and improve his vehicle.

He's very happy about continuing to work with Prisma.  This is the fourth loan he has requested.

His dream is to keep improving his vehicle and to buy himself another one.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, June 2015

loans.use: to buy pre-owned tires for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase potatoes, tomatoes, onions, etc. in order to have other products to offer to her customers, who purchase her delicious tortillas daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips, candies, canned goods, noodles, soft drinks, laundry soap, bath soap, powdered juice, and powdered milk.

loans.name: Marino

texts.es:
Marino tiene 50 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos en casa propia de material rústico en el caserio San Isidro que pertenece al distrito de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. La vida en este distrito es tranquila, los pobladores se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Marino se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, cuenta con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que se le otorgará lo utilizará en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para realizar un adecuado mantenimiento de su cultivo de café así como para la contratación de mano de obra para la época de cosecha. Con esto Marino espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que tendrá un impacto positivo en su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Marino is 50 years old and lives with his partner and their children in a home made of rustic materials. They live in San Isidro in the Callayuc district, which is in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the mountains of northern Peru. Life in this district is peaceful and the residents primarily work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle raising.

Marino works in agriculture and grows coffee. He has more than 10 years of experience in this area and has many good references, both personal and work.

The loan that he has received will be used to purchase manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee crops and to pay laborers for the harvest season. Marino hopes to offer higher quality coffee to his customers, which will have a positive impact on his income and, by extension, on his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase manure and fertilizer to adequately maintain his coffee crops and to pay laborers for the harvest season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chemicals to spray on her crops to kill fungi and weeds that compete for soil nutrients to enable her to get a high quality of produce to sell.

loans.name: Carolina Jhazmin

texts.es: Carolina tiene 18 años de edad, esta soltera y dicta clases particulares de inglés a niños de su barrio ya que las madres desean que sus hijos aprendan el inglés básico desde pequeños. Ella esta estudiando la carrera de contabilidad y finanzas en una universidad privada donde ya va por el V ciclo de la carrera, es justamente por esto que el préstamo lo utilizara para pagar las cuotas de la universidad y así dejara de preocuparse y se pondrá a estudiar para culminar sus estudios satisfactoriamente. Ella tiene como plan a futuro poder administrar el colegio de su familiar y viajar al extranjero para poder realizar una maestría. Carolina está muy contenta y agradecida con el apoyo que está recibiendo por parte de los inversionistas de KIVA.
texts.en: Carolina is 18 years old, is single and teaches private English classes for children from her neighborhood, since the mothers want their children to learn basic English from a young age. She is studying for a degree in accounting and finance at a private university where she is already in her fifth semester of the degree program. She will therefore use the loan to pay her university fees and thus stop worrying and apply herself to studying so she can finish her studies in a satisfactory manner. In the future, she hopes to be able to manage the finances of a relative's high school and to travel abroad to do a master's degree. Carolina is very happy and grateful for the support she is receiving from the Kiva investors.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Forty-two-year-old Marlyn engages in farming. She grows and sells rice. She is a married woman with a twelve-year-old son. She has been engaged in farming for five years now. She resides in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband also has an income that could help her defray the family's daily needs.

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. These will boost the yield of her farm and enable her to have a bountiful harvest. With these, she could start to expand her rice farming livelihood and be able to venture into any business possibilities. She could now settle her obligations and be able to handle her finances.

In the future, Marlyn dreams of raising chickens and putting up a sari-sari (variety) store to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 42 years old and she supports eight children.

She has been a farmer for the last 20 years and the business earns her KES 20,000 per month.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase chemicals to spray on her crops to kill fungi and weeds that compete for soil nutrients to enable her to get a high quality produce to sell in the market.

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients.

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals to spray on her crops to kill fungi and weeds that compete for soil nutrients to enable her to get a high quality produce to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia is a married mother of three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more clothes. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David and his family live and farm on a 2-acre farmland in Bomet, Kenya. He is married and has two children who are infants. He practices dairy and poultry farming on a small-scale basis. His main income sources are milk and a salary.  

David is seeking a loan to invest more on his dairy farm. He plans to use the borrowed money to buy a heifer. Through this asset, his family will benefit from calves and milk. Income generated from this investment will help David to grow his business and work towards full self-employment and financial stability.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aida Luz

texts.es: Aida es una carismática joven de 19 años de edad, residente en un barrio del municipio de Soledad en donde comercializa pasabocas, postres y pasteles de arroz.  Su suegra la vinculó al negocio hace dos años y hoy en día cuenta con una buena base de clientes que degustan diariamente de los productos que elabora.  Sus compras las realiza en abastos y graneros del sector y para capitalizar  su negocio está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en harina, carnes, queso, huevos y demás ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Aida desea continuar en su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar accediendo a fuentes de financiación que le permitan mejorar la imagen de su negocio.
texts.en:
Aida is a young, charismatic 19-year-old. She lives in a neighborhood in the municipality of Soledad, where she sells snacks, desserts, and rice cakes. Her mother-in-law connected her to the business two years ago, and she now has a good customer base who enjoy the products that she makes every day. She purchase her supplies at grocerty stores and granaries in the sector.

In order to obtain more capital, she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. She will invest in flour, meat, cheese, eggs, and other ingredients necessary to make the products. Aida would like to continue her business in order to improve her quality of life and continue to access financial resources that will allow her to improve her business's image.

loans.use: to invest in flour, meat, cheese, and eggs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riego, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, maicillo y jocotes, tiene 5 años de experiencia en la actividad agrícola y vende sus productos en agencias de granos básicos con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, etc. y mejorar el terreno para poder obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
The young woman (whose face is blurred in the photo) is 26 years old and lives in a high risk zone. She makes a living by growing corn, beans, sorghum, and jocote (a type of fruit). She has worked in agriculture for 5 years and she sells her products to the staple crop agencies.

With the money that she earns from her sales, she hopes to pay off some expenses that have come up in her household. She lives in her own home with her husband and their son. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc. and to improve the land so that she can obtain a better harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, manure, fertilizers, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Challage Group

texts.en:
Hawa is a 47-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of “Challenge” solidarity group. “Challenge” solidarity group has four members who are all women.  Hawa sells clothing to the general public. She has been in this clothing business for the past six years. She opens her business six days in a week from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Hawa established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profits she gets from her business.

Hawa and her group members needs a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL of which Hawa is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy more bales of clothing, etc. for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profits to support her family. Hawa is married and has three children who are going to school.

In the future, Hawa plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. Hawa and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bales of clothing, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 years to 10 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to open a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rosa Esmeralda

texts.es:
Rosa, de 24 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera de un niño.

Rosa, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura durante la mañana y tiene una tienda, mientras ella sale a sembrar en la mañana, su madre le administra la tienda y  en el transcurso de la tarde ella se encarga de cuidar la tienda. 

Rosa, necesita el crédito para comprar un molino, porque donde reside no hay, esto le ayudara mucho porque incrementara sus ingresos  para el sustento de su familia.

Rosa, sueña con construir una vivienda digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 24 years old and attended school until the ninth grade. She is the single mother of one son. Rosa works in agriculture during the mornings and has a store. While she tends to the fields in the mornings, her mother runs the store. In the afternoons, Rosa is in charge of the store.

Rosa requests this loan to purchase a mill because there is not a mill where she lives. This will help greatly because it will increase her income so that she can support her family. She dreams of building a dignified home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a mill.

loans.name: Sababu Group

texts.en:
Margaret is a 45-year-old businesswoman and a member of Sababu solidarity group. Sababu solidarity group has four members; all are women.  

Margaret is married and has five children aged 32, 27, 23, 10 and 4 years, who are both going to school. She sells cooking ingredients like rice, Maggi, onions, cooking oil, and tomato paste to many households. Margaret has been in this grocery business for the past three years. She opens her business six days a week from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. 

Margaret established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from her business. Margaret is on the left of the picture.

Margaret and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL, of which Margaret is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy two bags of rice, cartons of Maggi, onions, oil, etc., for her business. She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. In the future, Margaret plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family.

Margaret and the rest of the group members will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice, cartons of Maggi, onions, oil, etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and widowed. Her brother and her sister are living with her. She wants to earn a living so that she can help her parents in providing for her siblings, so she engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn a living. She aims to increase her income so she decided to borrowed a loan to buy more good items to sell and increase her store inventory, which will result in a greater income.

Teresita's plan for the future is to save money from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To buy more good items to sell.

loans.name: Wan Ward Sisters Group

texts.en:
Adama is forty-two years old and married with four children. Three of her children are of school-going age. Adama belongs to a solidarity group of 5 women, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams. “Wan Ward Sisters” is the name of Adama’s solidarity group. The “Wan Ward Sisters” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000 SLL of which Adama will receive 1,000,000 SLL in order to purchase an additional 50 bags of charcoal for resale. See Adama is in the middle of the group picture. 
She established her charcoal business in the year 2009; she established the business to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs, especially her children. She uses the profit from this business to provide a livelihood for her family and support her children’s education. She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Adama is a hardworking woman, and she opens her business from 8 am to 6 pm.
In the future, she plans to support her children so that they can acquire a university education. She hopes to do more than what she is doing presently. She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 50 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: August Group

texts.en:
As a single parent, M’balu is responsible for her four children who are 27, 25, 18 and 10 years old. They are all attending school in Freetown and one of them has graduated to university level. It is through this business that she has been able to provide for her family, including her parents who live in the village (see group picture, M’balu is in the middle).  
Twenty years ago she established her drinks business to support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning material and provides food from the profit she gets from the business. She sells 6 days a week from 10am to 6pm.
M’balu plans to use the loan to buy 10 crates of maltina, 5 crates of assorted drinks and 3 cartons of juice for resale. She will use the proceeds from the business to open a savings account which will be used in paying her children's school fees. She plans to give her children the best education, build a house and live a happy life.
M’balu and her group members need a loan totaling 5,000,000 SLL of which M’balu is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL. M’balu and the rest of the group members thank you for your support.

loans.use: to buy 10 crates of maltina and 5 crates of assorted drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy coconut wine.

loans.name: Thauy's Group

texts.en:
Thauy, 57, is a farmer living in Bakan district of Pursat province and she is a mother four children, two of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She has been growing paddy rice on two-hectare area of farmland as the main source of income and she has been in this business for 30 years. As lacking of water supplying in farmland and lots of weeds and pests, the crop cannot produce good outputs to her to sell at good price in the market. 

Now, she is leading a group of two members to get a loan. This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has repaid her past loan successfully. The previous loans help her to growth her business. For this new loan, she will use to buy woods and land to fill the land surrounding her house. She hopes to have a better house for her family and wishes earn more income to improve her living standard and support her children’s studies.

loans.use: to buy woods and land to fill the land surrounding her house

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a rain-fed area of Kenya where agriculture is the main economic activity of the populace. He is married and has three children. He relies on crop farming to provide for the needs of his family.

Among Kenyan smallholder farmers, reasonably priced Indian motorcycles are the preferred means of farm transportation because of their affordability and agility. Joseph is seeking a loan to buy such a motorcycle. Your loan will enable him access formal markets in new geographical and economical regions. As a result, he will improve his income and agricultural productivity in the long run. 

Your loan will enhance the quality of life of Joseph's family since the newly acquired asset will create new markets for their produce and facilitate interactions among them and other actors in the agriculture value chain.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable location. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita, aged 45 years, is a resident of Parangerpar in Falakata. She lives with her husband and two children.  Her husband runs a small carpentry business which is the only source of income for the family. Her 15-year-old daughter is a student in grade 10.

Rita's son, 23-year-old Sudip is a good and hardworking student.  He is doing his Bachelor of Arts education from Falakata college. For India's underprivileged, education is often the path to prosperity. A solid education gives children, even from the poorest backgrounds, a fighting chance at securing higher studies and hopefully, a stable job thereafter. That's the dream for Sudip. He wants to become an engineer and that's why he wants attend coaching (private) classes which his parents can't afford. His father's low income does not leave Rita much room to save and as a result, she is unable to afford the high fees of Sudip's coaching classes, and she often fails to provide necessary study materials to her son.  

Rita is willing to do whatever it takes to help Sudip be successful in his formal education and to this end, she is seeking a loan from Kiva via BJS. This loan will help her pay the high coaching fees, and she plans to purchase necessary study materials and a bicycle for her son.  She hopes it will be an important step for Sudip towards a bright future.

Rita and Sudip (side by side in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To cover the cost of her son's college education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy shutters as well as cement to complete his house

loans.name: Altanzagas

texts.en:
Altanzagas, 38 years old, lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Using her previous loan, she has purchased an electric car for transportation. Now she is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to buy furniture such as drawers, a closet and a table for home decoration. By doing so, her family will live in a comfortable place where they can rest fully.

loans.use: to buy furniture

loans.name: Budhobala

texts.en:
Budhobala hails from Dhupguri.  She is 37 years of age, married, and is blessed with three children. She lives with her husband and children at Altagram, a small village situated in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. Her 12-year-old son is in grade 7; her 15-year-old son is in grade 9.

Budhobala's 17-year-old daughter Sumitra is studying in grade 11 in Kalirhat Dewan Chandra High School. Like many girls in rural India,  Sumitra dreams of scoring good marks in the exams. Unlike many girls from low income families, she also struggles hard to give her best in her studies. Her mother is a housewife and her father is engaged in agriculture, growing seasonal vegetables. The family income is not enough to bear the ongoing education of their children. The family needs financial assistance so that Sumitra can focus on her studies and carry on an uninterrupted education to reach her goals without any anxiety. 

So Budhobala is seeking financial help from BJS. The Kiva loan will be used to purchase her daughter's educational articles like books, appropriate clothing, and pay for school fees and tuition fees. Budhobala hopes the loan will enable her daughter to reach to her goal of being a nurse after successfully completing her education.

Budhobala and Sumitra (as seen in the photo) express their gratitude to their generous lenders.

loans.use: To pay for her daughter's education: purchase her daughter's educational articles like books, appropriate clothing, and pay for school fees and tuition fees.

loans.name: Amriya

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Amriya lives in Dhupguri. Her family consists of her husband and three children. Due to insufficient economic resources, her elder son remains illiterate and now works as a day laborer. Her only daughter is married. Amriya lives in Board School Para with her husband and two sons.

Amriya's 17-year-old son Hasinur is a commendable student in Salbari High School. He reads in grade 12. He scored good marks in his last annual exam. He is very serious about his studies and always wants to get high marks in the exams. Hasinur will appear for his grade 12 board examination next year and in the future, he wants to be a teacher. So, he needs special guidance from a private tutor and some books for his next academic year. He wants to join coaching classes this month because he and his family know how important the grade 12 result is to build a career. His father is a farmer. His family’s monthly income hardly meets the household expenses and it seems like a difficult task now to bear educational costs for him. To support Hasinur's schooling, Amriya is seeking an education loan from Kiva's field partner, BJS. Amriya hopes the loan will help Hasinur to continue his studies without any financial problem.

Amriya and Hasinur (shown in the photo) convey their heartiest thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay school fees and course fees and purchase education articles for her son.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy four dozen blouses, two dozen trousers, and four dozen tee shirts.

loans.name: Edinah

texts.en:
Edinah is 26 years old, married to Samson, and she supports two children. 

She has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns her 7,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops.

She plans to educate her children and purchase a dairy cow for milk production to sell to clients. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector as well as improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops

loans.name: Richard Moises

texts.es:
Richard Moises tiene 27 años de edad, vive en el caserio de Lishinas del distrito de Pucara, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaen que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Él brinda servicios de transporte en mototaxi, realizando esta actividad desde hace 5 años, adicionalmente se dedica a brindar servicios como peón agricola, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa para invertir en arreglos de su mototaxi y de esta manera generar ingresos adicionales para mejorar calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Richard Moises is 27 years old and lives in the settlement of Lishinas, in Pucara district, a community with a hot climate. Its population is dedicated to agriculture, commerce, and livestock raising. Lishinas is located in the Province of Jaen, pertaining to the Cajamarca region of Peru's northern mountains.

Richard offers transportation services by means of his 'motortaxi.' He has done this for some five years now. In addition he works as an agricultural day laborer.

Richard is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternativa to invest in making necessary repairs to his 'motortaxi' and, in this manner, generating added income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to make needed repairs on his  'motorbike-taxi.'

loans.name: Anowara

texts.en:
Anowara is a 36-year-old married woman from Dhupguri. She is a mother of two children; one boy and one girl. Both are students. She dreams of giving the best education to her children. Her husband is engaged in cultivation. His meager income is spent on household expenses.

Anowara's daughter reads in grade 11 and her son, 18-year-old Rajib, is a student of Geography honors in B.Sc. (Bachelor of Science) 1st year at Aditya Narayan Mahavidyalaya. Being an average student, Rajib tries his level best to score better marks with the aim to be a teacher in the future. So far, he had studied by himself but now he needs the help of private tuition to complete his graduation. His parents want their children to lead a decent life with a good education in the future. But their income is barely sufficient to manage the family properly. Sometimes they have to face hardships to pay school and college fees on time for their children. Due to the family's economic adversity, Rajib cannot afford adequate study materials and enroll himself in a good coaching class, which he needs badly.

So, to provide an uninterrupted education for Rajib, Anowara is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan will be used to pay his college fees and purchase the necessary study materials for him. The education loan will allow her son to access his right to education and look forward to a brighter future.

Anowara and Rajib (in the photo) are thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her son's college education.

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Virgilia, who is engaged in a variety store business in her community in Davao City. She sells various commodities that are essential to everyday living of the people in her area. Her inventory includes sachets of toiletries, snacks, candies, bread, repacked condiments, canned goods, and many other items. She and her husband, Carlos, work diligently to raise their three children well. Basically, Virgilia earns enough to provide some of their basic needs but there are times that it’s not sufficient. She’s not content just to make a daily living because she aspires to save more for the future. 

With this forward-looking mindset she wants to make her business more profitable. She would like to ask for a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP to buy more quantities of dry goods and grocery items for her store. She is hoping that additional income from this loan will sustain their everyday needs, boost her savings, and ensure the studies of her children. It can also cover the longtime debts of her customers. She is looking forward to developing her store into a mini-grocery someday. She is also planning to buy a motorcycle as another source of income. Ultimately, she wants to buy a residential lot where her family can live happily and harmoniously. She draws inspiration from her co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories of their life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more quantities of dry goods and grocery items for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a 35-year-old housewife from Falakata, surviving with three children (a son and two daughters) and her husband. Her husband runs a very small agribusiness from which he earns insufficient income. They are running a tough life due to their poverty. Jyotsna wants to have their children properly educated.

Her 16-year-old elder daughter Ritu is a student in grade 11 who is a very intelligent student of Raichenga Vidyaniketan. Until now, she studied without the help of any private tutor. Now she needs private tuition for her further studies and enough study materials to secure good marks. Due to inadequate income, Jyotsna is taking out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy educational equipment and pay her daughter’s school fees, tuition fees, etc., so that she can pass all her regular examinations smoothly.

Jyotsna does not want her daughter to lose any educational years because she dreams of her daughter’s uninterrupted education. She wants to give a firm educational base to her daughter and make her more successful in life.

Jyotsna and Ritu (in the photo) both are grateful as they received great help from BJS and Kiva as well, due to their funding.

loans.use: To bear the education cost of her elder daughter.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a married woman living with her husband and three children in Borodoba village in Falakata, West Bengal. She is 51 years old and a housewife. Her elder daughter did not continue her education after grade nine due to poverty. Her younger daughter is in college and her only son is engaged in a shuttering business.

Her husband is doing sewing work and maintaining their livelihood. Their monthly income is not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses. Her younger daughter Lipika is 19 years old and a student of the Bachelor in Arts education (1st year) in Falakata College. She is a good student and wants to go on to higher studies. She wants to be a school teacher and so she wants to enroll herself in a private coaching class, but due to a lack of money, her parents are not in a position to do it.

For continuation of her daughter's studies, Malati wants to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will purchase study materials and a bicycle and pay all the educational fees of her daughter. The financial help will enable Lipika to continue her B.A education and give her an opportunity to make a career in the teaching sector.

Malati and Lipika (as shown in the photo) are grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's educational costs.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 69 years old, married to Tom, and she supports four children. 

She has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns her 7,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops. This will enable her to get a better harvest and hence make more income from the sales in order to support her family.

Teresa plans to educate her children and purchase a dairy cow for milk production with the anticipated profits. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to get a better harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to improve her harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy timber, beams, steel, cement and gravel to build a cement ceiling in his home.

loans.name: Ana Yaneth

texts.es:
Ana, de 53 años de edad, tiene varios años de dedicarse a la agricultura y al comercio de granos básicos como frijol y maíz, este oficio lo aprendió gracias a sus padres que se dedicaron a estas actividades, estudio hasta noveno grado y tiene 2 hijos.

Ana, comercializa los granos básicos que produce, pero también compra en el mercado de la ciudad, se levanta las 3:00 a.m. para llegar temprano y ofrecer sus productos.

Ana, necesita el crédito para comprar semilla, pesticidas, abono y para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde siembra.

Ana, sueña con comprar vacas lecheras, para iniciar la producción de leche y la elaboración de lácteos.
texts.en:
Ana, 53 years old, has for various years devoted her efforts to agriculture and the sale of basic grains such as beans and corn. This skill she learned thanks to her parents who were dedicated to these activities. Ana studied until the ninth grade and she has two children.

Ana sells the basic grains she grows and makes her purchases in the city market. She arises at 3:00 am in order to arrive at the market early to sell her produce.

Ana needs the loan to purchase seeds, pesticides, and manure, and to pay rent on the land she farms.

Ana dreams of buying milk cows so that she can initiate milk production in order to make milk products to sell.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides, and manure, and to pay rent on the land she sows.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Thirty-two-year-old Jayanti is a lovely mother from Ruidanga village in Falakata whose goal in life is to provide her children with the best education she can afford. She is blessed with three children (one son and two daughters). All of them are students. She could not continue studies after class 10 due to poor financial resources of her parents.

Jayanti's husband is a farmer by profession. He grows vegetables on his own farmland and sells to the village market. His monthly income is not sufficient to meet his monthly household expenses along with the children’s education expenses. Her 14-year-old daughter Sushmita reads in grade 10 in Falakata Subhash Girls' High School. She will appear for the board examination next year. She is a very intelligent and studious girl. She tries heart and soul to score good marks for the examination. But with their poor financial condition, her father cannot provide her with the necessary educational equipment and pay her school fees on time. So Jayanti wants to take a loan from Kiva's partner BJS.

The loan will help Jayanti to complete her daughter’s education without any financial strain. She will purchase necessary educational materials (books, notebooks, pens, uniform, etc.), pay school fees and will engage a private tutor for her daughter so that Sushmita can get ahead with a dream of doing a Master's Degree in Arts.

Jayanti and her daughter Sushmita (in the picture) are grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education expenses.

loans.name: Kanan

texts.en:
Kanan is a 43-year-old woman from Falakata who lives with her husband and three children. She never got an opportunity to study in school due to family problems and her husband is also illiterate and can only sign his name. Kanan's elder son is now in university while her 19-year-old daughter is in college and her younger son is a student in grade 12. Kanan herself is a housewife so she has to look after all the household matters including her children’s education. Her husband is a driver by profession to earn a livelihood. Kanan is interested in making her children eligible to help their father in earning money for the household expenses.

Kanan's elder son, 23-year-old Manoranjan, is a student of Master of Science in North Bengal University.  He is a very intelligent student. His aim is to be a teacher in future.  His father is the only earning member for a family of five. After doing hard work, he earns a merger income which is inadequate to maintain his family and to cover the educational expenses of their children. 

So Kanan is seeking a loan from BJS, Kiva's partner. She will use will use the loan amount to purchase study materials and pay all the educational fees of her son.  Her son Manoranjan is hopeful that the loan will help him to go one step closer to his goal of being a teacher in future.

Kanan and Manoranjan (in the photo) are very much thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To pay for her son's university education: to purchase study materials and pay all the educational fees of her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to improve her harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops to improve her harvest.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 65 years old, married to Florence, and supports two children.
 
He has been a farmer for the last six years and the business earns him 12,000 KES per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest.
  
He plans to use the gained profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and educate his children as well as to repay the loan. 

His hope is to expand his agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing his crops so as to get a better harvest

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Good day lenders! This is Adelaida. She is already 56 years old now and has three children. She manages her current sari-sari store business and is certainly hopeful for it to succeed. As of now, she is working persistently to provide for the daily needs of her household. 

Sari-sari stores are often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most like a convenience store, but quite smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are commonly needed, such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and on a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

To improve her sales, Adelaida likes to ask for help from you. She would like to borrow a loan worth 15,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store. With this, she expects to grow her sales and provide a better solution for their family’s daily living condition. And, today, you can be a big part of her life. 

Rest assured that what you will entrust to her will have a better outcome. As was once quoted, "A woman who walks in purpose doesn't have to chase people or opportunities. Her light causes people and opportunities to pursue her." 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional products and merchandise items for her store.

loans.name: Monserrat Group

texts.es:
¨Grupo Monserrat¨, está coordinado por Rosa, de 30 años de edad, soltera, con dos hijos, uno de 4 añitos y su hija de 11 años quien actualmente está cursando primaria. Tiene su taller de costura donde elabora trajes típicos como huipiles, cotonas, y blusas folclóricas del país. Este taller los tiene desde hace 11 años, lo formo con ahorros personales y ahora tiene 2 trabajadoras que les ayudan aumentar su producción. Ahora está con ADIM, por primera vez y solicita del financiamiento para la compra de materiales como tela, hilo, seda, trencillas, y más. 
Las otras integrantes son María José, de 21 años y tiene su taller de costura donde también elabora trajes típicos desde hace 5 años, y Saleska de 21 años tiene una venta de calzado y cosméticos en su domicilio.
texts.en:
The Monserrat Group is coordinated by Rosa, who is 30 years old and single with two children. Her son is four years old, and her daughter, who is currently studying in primary school, is eleven years old. She has a sewing workshop where she makes traditional clothing like embroidered shawls, jackets, and her country's folkloric shirts. She has had this workshop for 11 years; she started it with her personal savings and now has two workers who help her increase her production. She is with ADIM now for the first time and is asking for financing to buy materials like fabric, thread, silk, braiding and more.

The other members are María José, who is 21 years old and has a sewing workshop where she has made traditional clothing for the last five years, and Saleska, who is 21 years old and sells shoes and cosmetics in her home.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread, silk, braiding and more.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Hello, lenders. Meet Willy. He is a 41-year-old smallholder farmer based in Kitale, which is a small rural town in the Rift Valley region of Kenya. 

Willy has been blessed with a lovely family. For four years, Willy has been a mixed farmer. He keeps dairy cattle and poultry on his farm. He also grows vegetables, among other crops. Despite prevailing animal diseases, he finds dairy farming to be the most enjoyable commercial farming activity. 

Besides dairy farming, he has a deep connection with gardening. In African communities, gardening is the most popular, yet the least exclusive hobby for farmers. You really don't have to be born with a green thumb to give life to a glorious garden; any farmer with a homestead and a few square feet of earth is doing his best to make his little corner of the world more gracious and beautiful. 

Willy is taking this a little step further. He is seeking a loan to start horticultural farming. This is a big deal for him. He is very excited to start growing different varieties of crops for commercial purposes. The demand for vegetables and other greens is always high. 

Income from this venture will cover the high farming expenses he has to deal with currently. In the long run, with increased income, he will finally be able to satisfy his family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to start horticulture farming.

loans.name: El Me Da La Mano Group

texts.es:
¨El me da la mano¨ es un grupo solidario quien busca financiamiento de ADIM, para el desarrollo de sus microempresas y así mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Están con ADIM por 8va vez.
La líder del grupo es la señora Avis, de 41 años, acompañada, y con dos hijos de 10 y 6 años a quienes trata de brindarles las mejores condiciones económicas y actualmente están cursando la primaria. Ella se dedica a la venta de artesanías y viaja a diferente departamentos del país para la comercializarlos. El negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años y lo empezó con ahorros propios. Con el dinero que obtendrá comprara juegos de artesanías con diseños de palomitas, casitas, soles y lunas. Así podrá ofrecer variedad. Con el crédito que obtuvo anteriormente pudo aumentar sus ganancias. 
Las demás integrantes son Gricela, de 50 años se dedica a la preparación y venta de nacatamales y sopas en su domicilio. Y Guillermina de 46 años tiene su taller de calzado y elabora variedades de estilos para ofrecerlos a su clientela.
texts.en:
“El me da la mano” is a communal bank who seeks financing through ADIM to develop their microenterprises and to improve their living conditions. They are with ADIM for the 8th time. 
The leader of the group is Avis, 41 years old, who lives with her partner and two children, 10 and 6 years old. She tries to provide them the best economic conditions and they are currently studying in primary school. She is dedicated to selling handicrafts and she travels to different regions of the country to sell them. She has had the business for 4 years and she started with her own savings. With the money that she will obtain, she will buy handcrafted games with designs of little doves, houses, suns, and moons. That way, she will be able to offer a variety. With the previous loan that she was granted, she was able to increase her earnings. 
The other members are Gricela, 50 years old, who prepares and sells tamales and soups from her home and Guillermina, 46 years old, who has her shoe workshop and makes various styles to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy handcrafted games with designs of little doves, houses, suns, and moons.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 43 years old, married to Joseph, and supports two children. 

She has been a hair dresser for the last two years and the business earns her 5,000 KES per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to purchase hair neutralizer, detergents, hair conditioner, and a blow drier to provide better services to clients.
 
She plans to use gained profits to purchase a dairy cow for milk production, chicks for poultry keeping, and fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm. 

Her hope is to expand her business sector and also her agricultural sector.

loans.use: to purchase hair neutralizer, detergents, hair conditioner, and a blow drier to provide better services to clients

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stocks of maize cereals for sale to clients who have increased in number and in demand for maize product.

loans.name: Abel

texts.en:
Abel is 53 years old, married, and he supports a family of 5 children.
He works as a local butcher for the last 8 years earning KES 12,000 per month.

Abel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production for an additional income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children.
His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production for additional income gain.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 58 years old. He is married to Mary and supports 5 children.
He has been offering motorcycle transport services for the last 3 years and the business earns him KES 6,000 per month.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as engines, tires, and rings for repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so that he can offer better and faster transport services.

He plans to use the profit to purchase a dairy cow for milk production and repay the loan.
His hope is to expand into the agricultural sector and to purchase more cows and goats.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts for the repair and maintenance of his motorcycle so that he can offer better and faster transport services.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
With a goal of putting up a big furniture shop some day, Armando, 54, is exerting his best efforts to improve his business. He buys mahogany or Gmelina wood lumber, and then he uses it to make simple furniture, including tables, chairs and cabinets. Sometimes he cuts it into strips of various sizes and sells them at retail. One paid helper assists him at his shop, which is located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, one of the areas that was devastated by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. 

Rehabilitation and construction of houses and other structures is still ongoing in this area, and the demand for furniture and lumber continues to increase. Armando wants to grab this opportunity to enhance his income, and that’s why he’s applying for a PHP 30,000 loan. He will use these funds to buy more mahogany and Gmelina wood to use as raw materials in his business. He is positive that he won’t have any problem in paying the loan back, because he already has contact buyers. 

Armando is married to Erdelyn, and they have children who are still studying in college. He believes that education is very important, so he really strives to reach his dream that his children will have professions someday. He also aspires to own a family vehicle soon. He gains inspiration from his co-fellowship* members, who meet every week to share stories of their lives and businesses and to draw strength from their fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more mahogany and Gmelina wood as raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Yosia

texts.en:
Yosia a resident of Kyenjojo-Uganda is married with four children. He deals in cattle fattening alongside goat sales and milk sales for additional incomes. The main reason to start business was to get income to meet his family’s increasing needs. 

The loan purpose is to buy cattle for fattening to sell after a short time to feed an ever increasing population. His family dream is to educate his children as his business dream is to increase on the number of cattle for sell in the present and future markets. His business challenges include price fluctuations and prolonged droughts leading to lack of water and cattle diseases for his animals.

loans.use: to buy cattle for fattening to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 2 cartons of tinned milk, 1 carton of sardines, 2 cartons of powdered milk and bags of sugar, etc

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 63 years old and married. He has three children who attend school.

John is a small scale farmer. He sells his farming surplus and also operates a retail shop at Ryengyerero Bugangari to earn extra income to meet his family needs. He has done this business for over 10 years.
John is hindered by limited capital to expand this business, so he decided to join Ugafode for financial assistance to improve his business. He had taken loans from Ugafode that enabled him to expand and sustain his business. Recently, he has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy more stock, such as posho, sugar, rice, soap, and other retail goods, to sell in his retail shop.

John thanks Ugafode and Kiva for the financial assistance which has enabled him to sustain his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks for his retail shop

loans.name: Rebeca Elizabeth

texts.es: Rebeca de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la venta de elotes típicos vende de manera ambulante en su carretón por las diferentes colonias, ya tiene clientes fijos con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicita un crédito para la compra de mas elotes por mayor y así seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Rebeca, 31 years old, lives in her own home with her family. She sells traditional corn on the cob in a mobile way, traveling with her cart around different communities. She already has regular customers. With the earnings from her sales, she will help her family forge ahead. She is requesting a loan to buy more corn wholesale and therefore continue with her work since that is her only source of income.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en: Jason is 40 years old, married, and supports a family of five children. He has been driving a taxi for the last 15 years, earning KES 15,000 per month. Jason has applied for his first loan, of KES 25,000, from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production, which he will distribute via his taxi to earn more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce milk, which he will deliver via his taxi to earn more income.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
A single stick or even a bundle of ten sticks can easily be broken using one’s bare hands, but if it’s bundled like a broom, as seen in the picture above, it cannot be broken. This is the main principle of people’s solidarity in an organization or cooperative. “The people united will never be defeated” states one famous Chilean song. This provides an interesting parallel with of Nenita’s product – the broom or broomstick. She sells both soft brooms and hard brooms, often combined with a dustpan. 

The soft broom is usually made of dried rice hay, while the hard broom is made of dried palm leaves. She pays three workers, who help her from manufacturing to delivery. She delivers her products on special order and also sells them along with other supplies in her variety store located in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. 

Nenita is a widow who raises two kids, and sometimes her income doesn’t suffice for their daily needs. She hopes to increase her income by producing more brooms and expanding her market. She will buy more raw materials to use in making brooms with the aid of her PHP 25,000 loan from kindhearted lenders like you. She will also use part of the loan to pay her workers. Payment for volume orders from her store sometimes comes in late, and she needs to adjust her cash flow so her workers’ salaries won’t be affected. Nenita is a devoted member of CCT Credit Cooperative, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more raw materials to use in making brooms for sale.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a widow and has been blessed with five kids who all attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 
Faith operates a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.Faith dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel hails from Kapyego village, situated in the Kapsowar region of Kenya. His home is on a small parcel of land, where he raises livestock and engages in crop farming. Ezekiel ventured into farming five years ago. He relies on the help of his family to run the farm, where they keep dairy cows and plant a variety of crops. He also has trees on the farm, which must be looked after from time to time. Ezekiel is seeking a loan to venture into horticultural farming. 

Striking a balance between livestock farming and crop farming works out very well for farmers. The crops he plans to grow will provide him with a source of additional source, besides his pay from the day job he holds, in order to meet his family's needs. The produce will provide food for his family and fodder for his animals. He will also sell produce at the local market to earn further income.

loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm.

loans.name: Belona

texts.en:
Belona dreams of building a house for her parents and siblings, and of providing them with a stable business income that will sustain their needs. She is married to Bradley James and they have a child, but she cannot disregard her responsibilities to her parents and siblings. She wants to see that they too have good living conditions. She owns a boarding house in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, and she runs a variety store where she sells items that include frozen goods and ready-to-wear clothes. 

Like other business owners, Belona suffers from delayed payments of customers, which sometimes depletes her capital. As of now, she needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 for her business. This will help her buy raw materials to build an extension of her boarding house. Additional income from the extension will be used for their daily needs to renovate of their house. Her goal is to develop her boarding house into beautiful apartment units and to convert her shop into a big grocery store. 

Belona is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision of alleviating poverty, and she meets regularly with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from their fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to build an extension on her boarding house.

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma.Luisa is 50 and she comes from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Happily married to Rodelyn, a driver. Life in a third world country like Phils is not easy but the couple work hard to provide for their children and for their daily needs.

A year ago, Ma. Luisa decided to open a small general store to augment their income. Although there are other general store around her area she is still glad and thankful with the good turnout of her store as it really helps meet her family's everyday needs and school needs of her children. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 700 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her store she hopes she can avail of a 19000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items like canned goods, coffee, eggs, instant noodles, beverages etc. She takes the competition as healthy since she is challenged to offer more kinds of food items on her store thus attract more customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. She values her store so much since it is where she gets the funds to support her children's school needs.

Ma. Luisa dreams to open a small eatery by her store.  She trust that God will bless the works of her hands and bless their lives with abundance. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional  grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 37 years old, married, and supports a family of three children. He has been operating a motorcycle transport business for the last five years, earning KES 7,000 per month. Samuel has applied for his first loan, of KES 25,000, from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to produce and supply milk and thus earn more income. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to produce and and supply milk, to earn more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in order to sustain a better harvest

loans.name: Magret

texts.en: Magret is 49 years old, and she supports 4 children. She has been selling clothes for the last two years, and the business earns her KES 5,000 per month. She has applied for her first loan, of KES 25,000, from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional bales of clothes for sale to her clients. She plans to use her profits to buy a dairy cow, for milk production, and also to buy chicks for poultry keeping and fertilizer for top dressing the soil on her farm. Her hope is to expand both her business and agricultural sectors.

loans.use: to purchase additional bales of clothes for sale to her clients.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is aged 60 years, married to Joseph and she supports six children.She has been a farmer for the last 10 years and the business earns her KES 10,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get better harvest for sale and family use. 

She plans to repay the loan and purchase a dairy cow for milk production for sale to clients.Her hope is to be financially stable and expand her agricultural sector and also improve sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get a better harvest for sale and family use.

loans.name: Seak's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Seak is 52 years old and a married mother of two children, one of whom is dependent on her. Rice farming business is the main business of her and she has been in it for 34 years already. Seak sometimes harvests rice for others for a fee to supplement income. This year, drought has made her business grew slowly and produced lower-than-expected products. 

Now, she leads a group of three members to apply for a loan, which will be her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

With the previous loan, it enabled her to improve her living condition better. For this new loan, she, the group leader, will use it to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to increase the productivity of crop. She hopes to earn more income to buy a pumping machine to supply water to her rice field, so that the crop will produce more outputs.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to increase the productivity of her rice crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Other people perceive the task of managing a “sari-sari” (variety) store as a simple “wait and sell” practice. It’s not really that effortless. Jenelyn, from Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, wakes up very early in the morning and goes to sleep late at night, in order to meet the demands of customers. Sometimes a customer knocks at the door at 4:30 am to buy one sachet of shampoo for five pesos. At times, she has to stay until 12 midnight to take the orders of a group drinking beer in front of her store. Jenelyn needs to be patient indeed, or else the customers will brand her as unfriendly and will patronize other stores. 

It’s a good thing that Jenelyn’s husband, Nardie, takes turns in looking after the store. She can also rely on her children to watch the store after school.
