They share the task because their everyday needs are supported by the income from the variety store. However, the income from the store is not enough to meet the educational expenses of her children. This is why she also ventured into selling fish. She acquires fish from wholesalers early in the morning and sells them in the market. She’s determined to improve her business and increase her profit, and she is seeking to obtain additional capital of PHP 50,000, which she will use to buy different varieties of fish in volume. She will also add more dry goods, grocery items, and soft drinks to her inventory. She dreams of having a stable business and a new house and lot some day, but her top priority is to see her children with completed college degrees. 

Jenelyn shares her aspirations with her co-fellowship* members, who meet every week to strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy different varieties of fish in volume, for resale.

loans.name: Who Bear Group

texts.en:
This is forty-five years old Fasia, married with three children, all are school going children.  Fasia belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams.  “Who Bear” is the name of Fasia’s solidarity group.  “Who Bear” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000SLL of which Fasia will receive 1,000,000SLL in order to purchase additional 10 cartons of fish for resale.  See Fasia (is in the middle of the group picture). 

Fasia established her fish business in the year 1999 to ensure her family gets enough money for their basic needs especially her children.  Fasia uses profit from this business to provide livelihood for her family and support her children’s education.  She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week. Fasia is a hardworking women, she opens her business from 8 am to 6 pm.

In the future, Fasia plans to support her children to acquire university education.  She hope to do more than what she is doing presently.  She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase an additional 10 cartons of fish

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as sociable. She operates a farm, where she keeps pigs and grows crops. She has been involved in this business for twelve years. Her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge as fluctuations in the prices of animal feeds. She will use her KES 40,000 loan to buy piglets and renovate her pigsty. This is her third loan from SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy piglets and renovate her pigsty.

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 39 years old married woman and a mother of 8 children. In order to support her husband(also shown in the photo) in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. 

She has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR  to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses

loans.name: Deus

texts.en: Deus, 37, is married and has three children, two of whom attend school. He operates a bar as his main source of income, as he has done for more than ten years. Deus faces the challenge of limited capital. Guided by his friend, Deus decided to join Ugafode to access financial assistance. Deus has applied for a loan of UGX1,000,000 to add capital to his business. He hopes to expand his business, using the loan from Ugafode, and he encourages Ugafode to continue supporting low-income earners, since it has improved peoples’ standards of living.

loans.use: to boost his pub by stocking it with sodas and beer.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a 35-year-old married mother of three children. Nine years ago, she started selling clothes in an attempt to help her husband in covering the increasing needs of their family. She is an ambitious lady, who succeeded through out the years to gain her loyal customers. Marlyn is trying hard to develop her business.  

Today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes to satisfy her customers on all occasions. 

Marlyn hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more inventory, increase her earnings and try to make it possible for her husband to come back from working in Dubai

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Living in Battambang province, Chantha is 61 years old and a father of five children. To support his family’s living; he grows rice on three and half hectares area and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. He has been involved this business for 10 years and he can save his daily income about 18,400KHR per day. 

This is his fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid back his past loans completely. With his past loans, he can get more income to upgrade his family condition to get better than before. 

He leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, he will manage his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support his rice farm. He hopes that he can earn more income from his rice farm to update his lifestyle better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees to support his rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Geraldie

texts.en:
Geraldie is a 26-year-old man and has three children.  The oldest child is seven years old and the youngest child is two. 

Geraldie is from Badian, Cebu. He has been running a hog raising business for a year. He earns about PHP 6000 per month and works hard to support his family. 

Geraldie is asking for a loan to buy piglets and feed to keep his animals healthy and disease-free. Geraldie dreams to have a bigger space for his swine in the future.

loans.use: buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, where she has been involved for 10 years. Her business is located in a favorable location. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, brown sugar, powdered juice, buko (young coconut fruit juice), hot dogs, kikiam (a mix of ground pork and vegetables with flour) and fish balls

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is 44 years old and widowed with two children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelyn is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Emelyn has been raising pigs for 8 years and also earns additional income from direct selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 30 years of age, a hard worker and always says, “I eat from my sweat.” He is based in Kiriti, a rural village in Nkubu. He has been blessed with a lovely family and has been practicing farming for the past nine years and has never looked back. 

His primary source of income has been milk, eggs and crops. Most of the small holder farmers in Kiriti village own approximately half an acre per household and this has made them work extra hard to fully utilize their farms. Anthony has been practicing mixed farming and he enjoys the income he gets, but he has been facing challenges delivering his products to the market. Kiriti village is a very remote area and the roads are in pathetic condition; this has hampered Anthony from making timely delivery of products to the market while still fresh. Anthony sells vegetables, milk and tomatoes which are very perishable and require quick delivery if you are to fetch a high price. 

Anthony is seeking a loan to buy a motorbike that will help him deliver his products to the market in a timely way so he can overcome the challenge of facing losses. Through the loan he will deliver the products quickly to the market and this means he will never suffer losses, which will translate into an immediate increase in profits. 

Anthony plans to employ someone who will help him on the farm and deliver products to his large client base. Profits from the loan will be used to comfortably repay the loan fully and invest in a solid foundation for his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for timely delivery of his agricultural products to the market.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is a 30 year-old married woman from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. Her husband works at the coffee factory. Ketevan started tailoring at a private workshop and has been a hired worker for 10 years. She has a big list of loyal costumers who rely on her and are very satisfied. Now, Ketevan wants financial support to purchase a sewing-machine and open a sewing workshop of her own. She will sew various kind of clothing from private orders and generate her own income. She requested the loan within the framework of a start-up program joint initiative of Kiva and Credo that gives people the chance to start or re-start businesses.  
Having her own business will become much more profitable for the family and Ketevan will tackle her financial difficulties. She and her family members rely on the good will of the lenders and are very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing-machine and make her business more productive

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy some cooking ingredients like 2 bags of rice, cooking oil, palm oil, etc for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a tent, a grill, an oven, chairs, tables and a heated display case.

loans.name: Sapaty Group

texts.en:
Foday, who is 32 years old, was unanimously appointed to lead the group because of his wealth of experience in managing people.  

Foday is married with four children.  His children are all school-going children.  Foday belongs to a solidarity group of two men and three women, who have come together to complement each other achieve their individual dreams.  “Sapaty” is the name of Foday’s solidarity group.  “Sapaty” group needs a total loan of SLL 5,000,000, of which Foday will receive SLL 1,000,000, in order to purchase one bale of used clothing for his business.

Foday trades in used clothing in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown.  His business, which has been in existence for over eleven years, is the main source of his livelihood and that of his family's, and supports his children’s education.  Foday opens his business Monday through Saturday every week from 7 am to 6 pm.  

Foday is a hardworking man.  In the future, he plans to support his children to acquire university education.  He hopes that one day he will become an international business man.  He will be very appreciative to anyone who can help.  He thanks you for supporting them.

Foday is in the middle of the group picture.

loans.use: buy used clothing

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan, de 36 años de edad, está acompañado, creció con sus padres, quienes le enseñaron acerca de la agricultura y la ganadería, estudio hasta noveno grado, su familia está conformada por su esposa y su hija de 10 años de edad.

Juan, se dedica a trabajar en las parcelas que alquila durante la mañana y en la tarde se dedica a vender pan en los cantones aledaños a su residencia, todo para obtener un ingreso adicional, mientras su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Juan, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, semilla y pesticidas, para obtener una buena cosecha que ayudara a obtener buenos ingresos para el sustento de la familia.

Juan, sueña con comprar una yunta de bueyes, para que le ayuden a arar la tierra donde trabaja.
texts.en:
Juan  is 36 years old and married. He grew up with his parents, who taught him about farming and livestock-raising.  He has a ninth-grade education and his family is made up of his wife and his 10-year-old daughter.

During the morning, Juan works the parcels of land that he rents, and in the afternoon sells bread in the cantons neighboring his home; all to earn extra income. His partner is a housewife. 

Juan needs the loan to buy fertilizer, seed and pesticide, so that he can obtain a good harvest, which will help him obtain a good income for supporting his family.

Juan dreams of buying a team of oxen to help him plow the land that he works.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seed and pesticides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy pig feed & fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pig feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy fabric

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a 55-year-old married woman with seven grown children. She has been running a poultry (duck raising) farm for five years.  Her husband is a laborer. They work hard to support their children when they were young. 

Leonora earns about PHP 5000 per month, and she is requesting a loan of PHP12000 to buy feed. This will result in her ducks producing more eggs and  her having more income.  

Leonora is from Malabuyoc, Cebu.  She plans to expand her business, like raising chickens, in the future.

loans.use: buy duck feed

loans.name: Twisungane Group

texts.en:
Valentine is a group leader, aged 35 years.  She is married and has 4 children aged between 4 and 11 years. They all go to school. 

Valentine's group is called TWISUNGANE, which means “SOLIDALITY” in English. The members sell different products and they wish to expand their businesses to better change their future.  

Valentine has a shop and has been running her business for 15 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, sugar, biscuits and juice for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and to buy a cow for rearing.

loans.use: restock her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase trees for cutting and making timber to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more dozens of dried fish for her business

loans.name: Tekam Ladies Group

texts.en:
Memunatu is a member of the Tekam Ladies solidarity group. Memunatu has been in the business of sellling textiles for the past 10 years. She uses proceeds from her business to pay for her children’s education and to support her family.(Memunatu is on the left of the group picture).
Memunatu and other group members are requesting their first loan. Memunatu and her group members are in need of a loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Of this amount, Memunatu will personally receive 1,000,000 SLL to purchase two bales of textiles for her business. 
Memunatu is 31 years old, married and has one child.
Memunatu hopes that her business continues to exist so that she can save enough money to build a house and also prepare for her old age. Memunatu hopes that this loan will earn her more profit to support her family 
Memunatu and her group members thank you for financing their businesses

loans.use: to purchase two bales of textiles for her business

loans.name: Gahama Group

texts.en:
Francine is a group leader; aged 24.  She is married with 5 children aged between 5 and 21 years. They all go to school. 

Francine's group is called GAHAMA, which means “FOCUS” in English. The members sell different products and they wish to expand their business to change their future for the better. 

Francine sells foodstuff and has been running her business for 15 years. With this loan, she would like to buy more rice, cassava, and bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be use to pay school fees for her children and renovate her house.

loans.use: buy rice, cassava & bananas

loans.name: Las Cinco Mujeres Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario ¨Las cinco mujeres¨ están con ADIM y solicitan el financiamiento de los inversionistas de KIVA, para poder mejorar sus negocios y poder desarrollarse empresarialmente. 
La líder del grupo es doña Mireya, de 46 años, acompañada y con muchas ganas de superación para poder seguir sacando adelante a sus 6 hijos. Desde hace 16 años se dedica a la venta de especies, este negocio lo inicio con la ayuda de su acompañante. Ahora requiere del crédito para la aumentar su inventario y comprar productos de mayor consumo como canelas, ayote, clavos de olor, manzanillas y más. 
Las otras socias son Esperanza de 55 años, se dedica a la venta de perecederos desde hace 15 años, doña Juana se dedica a la preparación y venta de tortillas y Elsa de 30 años a la venta de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
The "Las cinco mujeres" communal bank are with ADIM and are asking for funding from the KIVA investors to be able to improve their businesses and develop themselves entrepreneurially. The leader of the group is Mireya, who is 46 years old, married and eager to excel to be able to keep supporting her 6 children. She has made a living selling spices for 16 years. She started this business with the help of her partner. 

Now, she needs the loan to increase her inventory and to buy products at wholesale such as cinnamon, pumpkin, cloves, chamomile and more. The other members are Esperanza, who is 55 years old and has made a living selling perishables for 15 years, Juana, who makes a living making and selling tortillas, and Elsa, who is 30 years old and sells fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy cinnamon, pumpkin, cloves, chamomile and more.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Once a man was quoted as saying, "Everyone can be great because anyone can serve. You don't have to have a college degree to serve. You don't even have to make your subject and your verb agree to serve. You only need a heart full of grace. A soul generated by love." 

This is "truth-alive" in most entrepreneurs like Mary Grace. She serves people by giving massages in exchange for a given price. She is not a professional worker, and what she receives from clients usually doesn't meet her family needs. She's also not that witty, like those working in high-paying jobs. Despite that, she is still willing to work, because she believes that she has the skills and the passion to serve people and to work for her loved ones. 

Her job is never easy. It's obviously energy-consuming and, at times, especially in rainy seasons, she encounters difficulty in attracting customers. In jobs like this, it's automatically "no client, no income." But Mary Grace is thankful that she continues to earn from this job enough to supply her family's basic household necessities. 

Today, she is thinking about further enhancing her inventory. She wants to buy additional materials for her massage business. To that end, she would like to borrow 15,000 Philippine pesos. This loan would be so essential in elevating the quality of service that she is able to offer her customers. With better equipment, it would be easier for her to catch people's interest and earn better than before. 

If she continued to earn well, she would have the opportunity to save money for her dream, which is to have her own spa salon someday. Today, she only prays for good health for her family members. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and also to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her massage business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stocks of products such as cooking oil, soap and baking flour for sale to clients and meet both client and family needs.

loans.name: Ronilo

texts.en:
Ronilo runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling  various commodities ranging like chips, noodles, seasonings, sugar, coffee, powdered milk and toiletries.  He is 54 year old single  man. He resides in Talibon, Bohol.

He is asking for a loan to buy stocks like rice, soft drinks, candies, bread and gasoline. These will improve the stocks of his store and enables more customers to come. Thus, his daily earnings will augment and able to pay his obligation. He could set aside some savings for emergency use. 

Ronilo would like to expand his sari-sari(variety) store business to become financially sustainable.

loans.use: to buy stocks like rice, soft drinks,candies, bread and gasoline

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen is a 49 years old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her son who is also shown in the photo. Her son assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market as he has maintained many contacts in years.  

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR  to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands of her customers efficiently to get boost in her earnings for expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to handle increasing demands.

loans.name: Amaska

texts.en:
Eleven years ago Amaska started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Muiru, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has abut farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. 

Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and also prevent them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. 

Amaska believes that through this loan his living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Amaska waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To construct a modern dairy unit for the welfare of her cow

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Robert, a 29-year-old who is so humble and honest and a very hardworking man on this planet Earth. Robert has a lovely family, whom he really adores so much, and will always do anything good to prevent them from ever going to bed with hungry stomachs. 

Robert hails from the Kericho area of Kenya. He never got the opportunity to advance his education and get a white collar job, but these realities did not kill his dream of wanting to succeed in life. Robert has been farming for the past five years. Through these years, he has gathered so much experience, and all the farming techniques are at his fingertips. 

Robert practices mixed farming. With his profits, he has managed to take care of his family's needs. He is very enterprising and he is seeking a loan of 30,000 Kenyan shillings to buy seeds and start horticulture farming on his farm. Robert wants to take advantage of various conditions -- favorable weather patterns, a good road network in his village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products -- and reap more profits. 

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring men like Robert turn their farming dreams into reality through training and loan financing. Robert hopes that he will improve his living conditions through this loan. By the end of the first year, his dreams and projections are that he will not only be selling in the local market but also in international markets through the export of fruits and vegetables. Through these endevours, he will be able to assure his family a secure future. 

Robert is not a selfish man and he wants to help society, which is why he will employ people on his horticulture farm, hence have an impact on society.

loans.use: To buy seeds and start horticulture farming

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka, 25, is one of seven members of his family from the Zestaponi district of Georgia. His mother earns a small income as a seamstress. The family has a plot of farmland and a vineyard, and he earns a small income of approximately 200 GEL a month from that.

To better the living conditions of his family, Beka has decided to expand into livestock. He has been approved for a 2,600 GEL loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

Beka will buy sheep and then breed and sell them for a good price at the local market. This will greatly help Beka improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life. He awaits Kiva lenders' support and kindness.

loans.use: buy sheep and then breed and sell them for a good price

loans.name: Red Group

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has four children, all of whom go to school. Fatmata belongs to a solidarity group of four women, who have come together to support each other in achieving their individual dreams.  

“Red” is the name of Fatmata’s solidarity group. The “Red” group needs a total loan of 4,000,000 SLL. Fatmata will receive 1, 000,000 SLL, which she needs in order to buy 100 bags of garri (tapioca) for her business.

Fatmata established her fish business in 2005 to ensure her family would have enough money for their basic needs.  Fatmata uses the profits from this business to provide for her family and support her children’s education.  She operates her business Monday through Saturday every week.  Fatmata is a hardworking woman; her business is open from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m.  

In the future, Fatmata plans to support her children in acquiring a university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international businesswoman.  She thanks you for supporting them.  

In the picture, Fatmata is on the left.

loans.use: to buy 100 bags of garri (tapioca) for her business.

loans.name: Mamata Rani

texts.en:
Mamata, 47 years old, hails from Parengerpar village in Falakata.  She is a rural housewife living with her family of four: her husband and three sons. Two of her sons are engaged in house centering work and the youngest one is a student of Higher Secondary grade. 

Mamata's husband is a small carpenter who makes and sells small wooden furniture for the family’s living. But the income is uncertain and is only enough to meet the daily needs of the five members of his family, so it would be difficult for him to finance his youngest son’s education.

Mamata's youngest son, 18-year-old Hriday is a prospective student of Parangerpaar Sishu Kalyan High School. He studies in higher secondary grade and is a good student. He wants to complete his higher secondary level education but he dislikes burdening his parents with the cost of his studies. He is going to appear for his Board Examination next year, so he needs private tutors and other educational help. But due to lack of money his family is not in a position to continue to support his studies. It is for this reason that his mother Mamata is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).

She will use the loan amount for Hriday's educational expenditures. The loan will enable Mamata to provide her son with necessary educational articles, a bicycle, school fees, private tuition fees, etc. so he can continue his uninterrupted education.

Mamata and Hriday (in the photograph) are grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase educational equipment and pay all educational fees of her youngest son.

loans.name: Buenas Nuevas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario ¨Buenas Nuevas¨ está coordinado por doña Janette de 40 años de edad, ella y su acompañante de vida se dedican a la venta de ropa y electrodomésticos de manera ambulante, desde hace 5 años. Por 3era vez solicitan el financiamiento para poder invertirlo en la compra mercadería como electrodomésticos variados, plásticos, ropa (blusas, camisetas, pantalones para hombre y mujeres). Con el crédito anterior expresa que pudo reforzar su negocio. 
Las otras integrantes son Karla de 40 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos  y calzados  desde hace 6 años y Jacqueline de 30 años a la venta de bolis, crema, huevos desde hace 13 años.
texts.en:
The solidarity group "Buenas Nuevas" is coordinated by 40 year old Janette. She and her partner have been earning a living selling clothes and household appliances for the last 5 years. 

For a third time they are applying for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as household appliances, plastic products and clothes (blouses, T-shirts and men's and women's trousers). She says that the previous loan helped to strengthen their business.

The other members are 40 year old Karla, who has earned a living selling cosmetics and footwear for the last 6 years, and 30 year old Jacqueline who has been selling Bolis (ice cream treats), cream and eggs for 13 years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as household appliances, plastic products and clothes (blouses, T-shirts and men's and women's trousers).

loans.name: José Mercedes

texts.es:
Don José, es una persona quien ha demostrado ser trabajadora, honrada y responsables. Esta con ADIM por 2da vez, para solicitar el financiamiento para su microempresa. 
Está casado y tiene un hijo de 21 años a su responsabilidad, desde hace 32 años administra su taller de mueblería, y con la ayuda de su hijo mayor, ha podido sacarlo adelante.  Esforzadamente lo tiene su negocio  con los ahorros personales de sus trabajos anteriores. Ahora con el crédito que solicita lo requiere para la compra al por mayor de madera fina como laurel, cedro, pochote y Ním, así  garantizara a su clientela producción de calidad.
texts.en:
Jose is a person who has demonstrated himself to be a hard worker, honorable and responsible. This is the second time he is asking for a loan through ADIM. 

He is married and has a 21 year old son in his care. For the last 32 years he has managed his furniture workshop, and with the help of his eldest son he has been able to get ahead. With a lot of effort, he began business with his personal savings from his previous jobs. He needs this current loan he is requesting to purchase fine woods like Laurel, Cedar, Pochote, and Neem in bulk, therefore guaranteeing his customers quality production.

loans.use: to purchase fine woods like Laurel, Cedar, Pochote, and Neem in bulk.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Pratima hails from a poor family. She is a married woman of 42 years. She lives with her husband and two sons in a small village, Dalimpur, in the district of Alipurduar. Pratima's husband is engaged in vegetable cultivation. Both Pratima and her husband could not complete secondary education, so they try their hardest to provide education to their sons. Pratima's 19-year-old son studied up to grade 9, and now he works as a mason. The other son is a student.

Pratima's husband's meager income is the main hindrance in the education of her son. Her younger son is 17 years old. Goutam reads in grade 12 at Khirerkote High School. Recently, he has passed grade 11 with good marks. His parents plan to provide better education to Goutam so as to enable him to lead a better life. With an aim to be a teacher in the future, he wants to score good marks in his examination. But, their household income is not sufficient to meet all his educational expenses.

Pratima heard that BJS (Kiva's partner) gives education loans to the poor and meritorious students so that they can keep on with their studies. So, she has taken a loan from them. She plans to utilize the total loan amount for her son's education. She will use the loan amount for coaching fees and purchase necessary educational materials for her son.

Pratima and her son Goutam (in the picture) give their thanks to the lenders (BJS and Kiva) .

loans.use: to bear all the education-related costs of her son.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Forty-seven-year-old Rama is a mother of two children: one son and one daughter. Her daughter got married. She lives with her family at Falakata in Alipurduar district of West Bengal. Rama’s 17-year-old son is in college. Being a housewife, Rama manages household jobs, and her husband is running their modest grocery shop.

Rama's younger son Sayan is doing his first year of Bachelor of Arts education from Falakata College. He is a good student and passed his last board exam with good marks. He has a long-cherished dream to take teaching as his profession. There are good job opportunities in the teaching sector. Now, to gain an added advantage, Sayan has decided to enroll him in good private tuition classes. So, he needs to pay the tuition fees, which his parents are unable to afford.

So, his mother Rama is requesting an education loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to bear the education expenses of her son. She will pay the tuition fees and purchase other necessary study materials for her son. With this help, her son Sayan is certain he will find excellent employment opportunities in the teaching sector.

Rama and Sayan express their gratitude towards BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: to cover the educational costs of her son.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric, marking pens, colored thread, and hand and machine needles.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella believes in the importance of hard work. She could probably spend 16 hours a day working just to escape the typical eight-hour working day. She has taken every opportunity to develop her variety store because she believes success comes to those entrepreneurs who think about other people's convenience rather than their own. 

In fact, recently, she borrowed a loan through Kiva to add to her business capital. Having faithfully paid back her previous loan, she would respectfully like to avail another loan, for 27,000 Philippine pesos. She would use this loan to purchase more grocery items, such as shampoo, biscuits and condimentss. 

She wants to express her thanksgiving for your deep-rooted generosity and kindness. She won't risk your trust in the event you let her borrow this amount. With assurance, she promises to grab this open door to further enlarge her enterprise and make headway toward her dream of having her own house and lot someday. 

She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items for her business, such as shampoo, biscuits and condiments.

loans.name: Jose  Luis

texts.es: José de 35 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 10 años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y así tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 35 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two kids. He has made a living cultivating corn and sorghum for the past 10 years.

He sells his products in the areas surrounding the region where he lives. With what he earns from his sales he covers some of his home costs.

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural products such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc. to improve the land that is shown in the photograph and therefore improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, etc. to improve his land.

loans.name: Nonglom Moince Group

texts.fr:
Mme ABZETA  est responsable du groupe NONGLOM MOINCE.  Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02 vont  à l’école. Mme a 07personnes en charge.
 Mme achète et stock l’oignon depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants. 
Elle veut s’acheter 04sacs d’oignon pour stocker et revendre en temps auportin.
 Mme veut renforcer son activité avec ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne s’acheter une moto.
texts.en:
Mme Abzeta is the leader of the group called   Nonglom Moince.  She is the married mother of five children. The oldest is 19 and the youngest 6 years old. Two of them attend school. She has seven people for whom she is responsible. 

Mme Abzeta has been buying and warehousing onions for 20 years. She buys her stocks in the nearby markets. She would like to buy four sacks of onions to stock and resell when the time is right. 

She wants to strengthen her business with her profit. Her ambition is to buy herself a motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of onions to warehouse and resell when the time is right

loans.name: Mary Elvira

texts.es: Mary en su almacén misceláneo exhibe un amplio surtido de artículos de papelería, cuidado personal, higiene, accesorios e incluso bebidas y mecatos, esta emprendedora mujer inició su negocio en el año 2007 y con sus ahorros logro adecuar el lugar con vitrinas y mercancías varias, hoy en día cuenta con el posicionamiento en el sector donde reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, en donde habita la gran mayoría de sus clientes y realizan sus compras a partir de las 9 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  Con la finalidad de mejorar la apariencia de su negocio, está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo que invertirá en la compra de vitrinas y un mayor surtido. Con esta inversión renovará la gama de productos e incrementará sus ventas.  Mary desea tener una casa propia y aperturar otras sucursales.
texts.en:
In her miscellaneous store, Mary displays an ample supply of paper products, personal care and hygiene products, accessories and also drinks and pastries. This entrepreneurial woman started her business in 2007, and with her savings she managed to tailor the place with display cabinets and various merchandise. 

Today, she has the positioning in the sector where she lives in a neighborhood in south Barranquilla, where the great majority of her clients live and make their purchases from 9 A.M until 8 P.M. In order to improve the appearance of her business, she is asking for a Credikiva, the first loan that she has made to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, which she will invest into buying display cabinets and a larger supply. With this investment, she will update the range of products and increase her sales. Mary hopes to have her own home and open other subsidiaries.

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and a larger supply.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy himself a single-seed planting machine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy ten more gallons of palm oil and five cartons of Maggi.

loans.name: Rambo Group

texts.en:
Mabinty is a 37-year-old businesswoman. She is a member of “Rambo” Solidarity Group with four women. Mabinty sells charcoal to many households that depend on her charcoal as a source of energy for cooking.

Mabinty has been in this business for the past ten years. She opens her business six days a week from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Mabinty established her business to help support her children in school. She pays school fees, buys learning materials, and provides food from the profit she gets from her business.

Mabinty and her group members need a loan totaling 4,000,000 SLL, of which she is entitled to 1,000,000 SLL, which she will use to buy 50 more bags of charcoal and 50 bundles of firewood for her business.

She hopes that this loan will help her generate more profit to support her family. Mabinty is married and has five children with the ages of 16, 14, 13, 8, and 3 years.

In the future, Mabinty plans to save more money to provide for her children’s university education. She believes educating her children to university level will better the lives of her family. She also plans to build a house for her family.

Mabinty and the rest of the group members thank you for your support. (Mabinty is on the left in the picture).

loans.use: to buy 50 more bags of charcoal and 50 bundles of firewood for her business.

loans.name: Edison De Jesus

texts.en:
Edison is a 26-year-old married man with a beautiful little daughter who is just 3 years old. They all live in a town called Sonson, a place that doesn’t offer the best opportunities, but that this man has learned to deal with. He started his own business ten years ago. He has a farm where he grows different kinds of products.

The inputs he needs for his growing are really expensive, so he isn’t able to buy as much as he would like to. That’s the reason why he is asking for a loan so he can buy some pesticide, fungicide, and fertilizer. In this way, he can protect his products and give the best to his clients.

He dreams big, and for him, his daughter is the motor of his life. He wants to give her the best education so she can be an amazing person in the future. He also would like to improve the conditions of his home that right now are not at their best.

Help Edison make his dreams come true; this loan can change his life.

loans.use: to buy some pesticide, fungicide, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Chiquitos Group

texts.es:
El grupo ¨Los chiquitos¨  este grupo solidario esta por 2da vez, requiriendo crédito de ADIM, para engrandecer sus  pequeños negocios y así aumentar sus ganancias. 
Quien coordina el grupo es Francisco, de 38 años,  casado y con 3 hijos de edades de 19, 17 y 12 años, de los cuales su hija de 12 años está cursando a escuela primaria. Con esfuerzo tiene su negocio y vende carbón, leña desde hace 22 años, con el dinero que prestara lo invertirá para poder aumentar su inventario y comprara en grandes cantidades fletes de leña, sacos de carbón y sacos vacíos. Así podrá ofrecer al por mayor a su clientela. Con el crédito anterior lo invirtió en su negocio y compro laminas de zinc y piedras para mejorar su casa. 
Los otros miembros son Pedro de 42 años, quien se dedica a la venta de accesorios para celulares. Joconda de 40 años a la venta de carbón y Nicolás de 40 años se dedica a la compra de cosechas.
texts.en:
The "Los chiquitos" solidarity group is needing a loan through ADIM for the second time, in order to enlarge their small business and thus increase their earnings. Francisco coordinates the group. He is 38 years old, married and has 3 children who are 19, 17, and 12 years old. His 12 year old daughter is in elementary school. 

With effort he has his business and has sold charcoal and firewood for 22 years. With the loan money, he will invest it to be able to increase his inventory and will buy large quantities of firewood, bags of charcoal and empty bags. This way, he will be able to offer wholesale prices to his customers. 

With the previous loan, he invested it into his business and bought zinc sheets and rocks to improve his house. The other members of the group are Pedro, who is 42 years old and makes a living selling cell phone accessories, Joconda, who is 40 years old and sells charcoal, and Nicolás, who is 40 years old and makes a living buying crops.

loans.use: to buy large quantities of firewood, bags of charcoal and empty bags.

loans.name: Alba Lucia

texts.en:
Alba is a 41-year-old married mother of two daughters who are nine and 15 years of age. The family lives in Rionegro, a town not too far away from Medellín, where Alba owns a sewing business that she operates six hours a day. She’s really talented and loves what she does.

Alba wants to start investing in her business so it will grow and become successful and recognized in her town. She is therefore requesting a loan to buy some fabrics, threads and buttons so she can produce more, expand her client base and have more to offer them. 

Alba dreams that someday she will be able to offer jobs to more people so she can help those who lack jobs and don’t have many opportunities. She also wants to improve her home living conditions. Please help Alba accomplish all of her dreams.

loans.use: to buy some fabrics, threads and buttons

loans.name: Boubakar

texts.fr: Boubacar est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Kamale au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 56 ans, Boubacar est le père de 12 enfants âgés de 27 à 08 ans, dont 12 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Boubacar à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs et le mil sur sa parcelle de 4 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles, de pluie et de semences de qualité . Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour la culture du maïs et d'autres espèces si possible. L’accès au semoir lui permettra d'aider pour les semis. Boubacar espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille et couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants .
texts.en:
Boubacar is a farmer who is registered with myAgro and works in the village of Kamale, southwest of Bamako. Aged 56, he is the father of 12 children aged 27 to 8 years; 12 of them are presently enrolled in school. The anchoring of the traditional family in agricultural practice, principle source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the family, but also the agricultural pursuit which permits him to ensure food self-sufficiency for his family encouraged Boubacar to become a farmer. He grows maize and millet on his plot of four hectares, but as a farmer he has to confront challenges such as the lack of agricultural materials, of rain, and of quality seeds. 

This year he wants to buy a seeder for growing maize and if possible, other grains. Access to a seeder will help him with seeding. Boubacar hopes, with the expansion of his harvest and thus of his income, to be able to build  a house for the family and pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to possess a precision seeding machine

loans.name: Marta Alicia

texts.es:
Marta, de 54 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, ya que en su tiempo no tenían la posibilidad de estudiar más, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la venta de billetes de la lotería, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo una está con ella, porque las otras están trabajando y tiene sus propios hogares.

Marta, se dedica a la venta de calzado desde hace 5 años, anteriormente ella andaba vendiendo ropa en los cantones, pero desde hace cinco años le dieron la oportunidad de obtener un puesto en el mercado y ella decidió poner el negocio de calzado y ropa.- Marta, todo los días de lunes a domingo se levanta en la mañana y viaja en micro bus unos 20 minutos desde su casa, su hija le ayuda los fines de semana, porque los días de semana la hija estudia.

Marta, necesita el crédito para comprar 5 docenas de calzado para niño y 10 docenas de calzado para hombre y para mujer, ya que en el lugar de donde ella vende, serán las fiestas patronales próximamente y llega más afluencia de personas.

Marta, sueña con tener una gran zapatería.
texts.en:
Marta is 54 years old. She went to school until the fourth grade, because in her time she didn't have the possibility of studying more. She is married and her husband makes a living selling lottery tickets. They have 3 children and only one is with them because the others are working and have their own homes. Marta has made a living selling shoes for 5 years. Previously, she was selling clothing in the cantons, but 5 years ago she was given the opportunity to have a place in the market and she decided to put a shoe and clothing store there. 

Everyday from Monday to Sunday, Marta wakes up in the morning and travels by bus some 20 minutes from her house. Her daughter helps her on the weekends because she goes to school on weekdays. Marta needs the loan to buy 5 dozen shoes for children and 10 dozen shoes for men and women. In the place that she lives, there will be local festivities soon and an influx of people will arrive. Marta dreams of having a large shoe store.

loans.use: to buy 5 dozen shoes for children and 10 dozen shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Hương

texts.en:
Mrs Hương is 42 years old and she is married. Hương lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables for five years.

Her family has no latrine. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Hương's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Hương hopes to build a new house. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Ngọc

texts.en:
Mrs Ngọc is 53 years old and she is married. Ngọc lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in the Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region.  

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic sanitation. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2008, Ngọc joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Ngọc has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Ngọc hopes to maintain a successful business and for it to do well. She also hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Humberto Jose

texts.es: Humberto es un hombre trabajador y luchador, casado y con un hijo de 2 añitos. A sus 28 años maneja la comercialización de ventas de electrodomésticos en el norte del país. Este negocio lo empezó hace 4 años, con ahorros personales que consiguió de los trabajos anteriores. Esta por primera vez con ADIM y Kiva, para solicitar financiamiento para reforzar su inventario. E invertirá en la compra máquinas de rasurar, planchas para el cabello, planchas para ropa y más. Entre sus grandes proyectos esta manejar su propia distribuidora de electrodomésticos.
texts.en: Humberto is a hard worker and fighter. He is married with a 2 year old son. At 28 years old, he manages the marketing sales of appliances in the North of the country. He started this business 4 years ago with personal savings that he got from previous jobs. This is his first time with ADIM and Kiva, to ask for funding to strengthen his inventory. He will invest into buying razors, hair straighteners, irons and more. Among his great projects is to manage his own distributor of appliances.

loans.use: to buy razors, hair straighteners, irons, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops for better harvests

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita and she is very thankful that Kiva has become an instrument in improving her variety store in Caloocan City. The help of a previous loan was indeed a great remedy for her family's daily expenses. It was a relief for the household and, at the same time, a hope for a better future. 

So far, Teresita's store is running well. But she needs a little help to continue her business operations. She requests 40,000 Philippine pesos to supply her store with more grocery items to sell. With additional supplies, she will be able to cater to customer demands while benefiting from an anticipated increase in profits. 

She hopes that you can help her with this request, because her store is a very relevant source of income for the family, especially since Fernando (her husband) has already retired from work. That's why Teresita hopes very much that you will lend her your helping hands. 

Someday, she dreams about her business expanding and growing it into a grocery store. 

Teresita meets weekly with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and also to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to supply her store with more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supplies

loans.name: Girimpuhwe Group

texts.en:
GIRIMPUHWE is a group led by Julienne, who is 57 years old. The group name means “merciful” in English. 

Julienne is married with nine children aged between 15 and 36 years. She sells soft drinks and has been doing a business for the past 21 years. 

The group members sell different items and they have same idea for changing their lives. 

With the loan, she would like to buy more drinks to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to improve her standards of living and to make savings.

loans.use: to buy more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Edelberto

texts.en:
Edelberto is a 41-year-old married man who has two children, a son of 16 and a daughter of 12 years old. They live in Sonson, Antioquia where this committed father owns a farm where he grows different kinds of plants to sell to clients. He inherited this business from his family and was taught by his father. 

He is a really hard-working person, who sees his business as a way to give his family a good quality of life, something that is really important to him. He wants to get his grow bigger so it might let him more profits, that’s why he asked for a loan so he can buy some inputs like insecticide, fungicide, and fertilizer, and with these improve his business. 

He dreams of giving to his children the best education so that in the future they might be professionals, because they are the reason why he wants to be more successful. You can help Edelberto accomplish his dreams and let him give his family all that they need, just with a loan.

loans.use: buy some inputs like insecticide, fungicide, and fertilizer

loans.name: Nasibahan

texts.ru: Насибахан, 57 лет, замужем, 3 детей, 2 внуков. В качестве источника дохода для своей семьи, она в 2009 году начала заниматься разведением скота и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду на сегодняшний день Насибахан имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы. На земельном участке мерою 0,78 Га она выращивает экологически-чистую кукурузу. Сделав вывод, что данный бизнес рентабелен, Насибахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян и удобрений для обработки почвы и выращивания органической кукурузы. Доходы от кредита Насибахан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и увеличение площади поливной земли.
texts.en: Nasibahan is 57 years old, married, and has three children and two grandchildren. She started rearing livestock and growing crops in 2009 for a source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, today Nasibahan has two cows. She grows organic corn on a 0.78 hectare plot of land. Having concluded that this business is profitable, Nasibahan has decided to apply to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy seeds and fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic corn. Nasibahan plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in developing her business further and increasing the area of her irrigated land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to treat her land and grow organic corn.

loans.name: Grupo Tonquin 1 Group

texts.es:
Linda (es la tercera de derecha a izquierda de blusa color café)  es una gran mujer que todos los días se esmera para darle a su querida familia lo mejor, ella tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera cuenta con una familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 11 y 19 años,  esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de San Antonio Suchitepéquez.  Linda para obtener sus ingresos se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes, con este negocio lleva  seis años de realizarlo, pero en su  tienda también les ofrece a sus clientes el servicio de molino de nixtamal con esto genera un poco más de ingresos. A  Linda su amabilidad, sinceridad  y carisma es lo que la caracteriza ante sus clientes, es por eso que ahora con el producto que cuenta ya no se da abasto, por tal razón solicita un crédito junto a un grupo de personas para comprar productos de abarrotes como: aceite, azúcar, arroz y golosinas.
El gran sueño de Linda es poder brindarle a sus hijas mejores condiciones de vida, y que su tienda siga prosperando.
texts.en: Linda (the third woman from right to left in a brown shirt) is a great woman who strives to give her dear family the best she can every day. She is 35 years old, is single, and has a family of five children between the ages of 11 and 19 years. This humble family lives in a community of San Antonio Suchitepéquez. To earn an income, Linda makes a living by buying and selling groceries. She has had this business for six years, and she also offers her customers corn-grinding service in her store, earning a bit more of an income with this. Linda's friendliness, sincerity and charisma are what characterizes her among her customers, and these are why the products she has in stock are no longer enough. For this reason she is asking for a loan along with a group of people to buy grocery products like oil, sugar, rice and candy. Linda's great dream is to be able to provide her daughters with better living conditions, and that her store will keep prospering.

loans.use: to buy products like oil, sugar, rice and candy.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Life is a survival game. So when you don't see opportunities, create them.

That's the main reason Esperanza works hard in her current business. She dreams of improving her business but she believes that dreaming alone is not enough. Work is also required.

Although she is already 56 years old, she still helps her husband, Rodolfo, a vendor, in providing for her family's needs. She sells fruits and vegetables in the market. She wakes up early to assemble her place in the market every day, then diligently waits for customers and serves at hand. 

She earns just enough every day. Of course, she wants to earn a higher income. So she asks you for a loan to help her improve her stall. She would like to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables plus other necessary materials for beautifying her stand. A loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos would be sufficient.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God, which she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits and vegetables plus other necessary materials for beautifying her stand.

loans.name: Thắm

texts.en:
Mrs Thắm is 39 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp for more than 10 years.

Thắm lives in Hoang Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having hygienic sanitation. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2015, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Thắm hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Hiên

texts.en:
Mrs Hiên is 34 years old and she is married. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for more than 10 years.

Hiên lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, this region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

In 2012, Hiên joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Hiên has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Hiên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to maintain a successful business, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en:
Thùy is 33 years old and married.
 
She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fish for eight years.
Thùy lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in the village. This region often suffers from natural disasters such as storms because it is near the sea. 
One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.
This is Thùy's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Kunduz

texts.ru: Кундуз, 57 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей. У нее среднее образование, уже 11 лет занимается животноводством, садоводством и полеводством, начав с суммы 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Кундуз на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет 21,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка саженцев деревьев для перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Кундуз планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Kunduz is 57 years old, married, and has three children. She has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals, horticulture and growing crops for 11 years, having starting with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today Kunduz has two cows and ten sheep. Her monthly profit is 21,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) with the aim of buying tree seedlings for resale. Kunduz plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit tree seedlings for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric, fabric paints, and many colors of thread.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is married and has three children. He has his own business growing vegetables in greenhouses. Mostly, he grows cucumbers and tomatoes. Vardan started his business only few years ago. Now he has two pieces of land and seven greenhouses. Vardan is an active and hard-working person. He also has a part-time job doing renovations. 

Vardan is asking for a loan of 60 000 UAH to purchase coal to heat his greenhouses. He wants to start next season earlier and get increased income from selling vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase coal to heat greenhouses

loans.name: Artush

texts.en:
Artush is married and has a child. A second child is going to be born in August. Artush has his own business growing cucumbers and tomatoes in his greenhouses. He has three big greenhouses and one smaller greenhouse for seedlings.  Artush has a part-time job renovating houses. Artush wants to develop his business. He plans to buy another piece of land. Also he plans to finish the renovation of his own house.

Artush is asking for a loan of 60 000 UAH to purchase coal to heat his greenhouses. The loan will help him earn a good income from selling vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase coal to heat greenhouses

loans.name: Ramazon

texts.ru: Рамазон трудолюбивый человек. Живет со своей семьей в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 56 лет, женат и хороший отец троих детей.  Рамазон уже на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Эта их семейная деятельность. Рамазон с женой и детьми вместе помогают друг другу. Он с женой занимается растениеводством, а  сыновья животноводством. Рамазон уже 25 лет в этом деле. Если бы не их упорная работа, они бы не смогли хорошо жить. У них средние условия жизни. Сейчас Рамазону необходимо купить минеральные удобрения. У него не хватает средств. Поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Рамазон надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en: Ramazon is a hardworking man. He lives with his family in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 56 years old and married. He is a good father to three children. For many years already, Ramazon has been practicing agriculture. This is their family business. Ramazon, his wife and his children help one another. He and his wife practice crop farming, and his sons practice livestock breeding. Ramazon has already been in this business for 25 years. If they did not have their hard work, they would not be able to live well. They have an average standard of living. Now Ramazon needs to buy mineral fertilizers, but he does not have enough money. This is why is applied for a loan. Ramazon relies on your support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Andres David

texts.en:
Andrés is 26 years old and has two beautiful little daughters; one is four and the other just one year old, and they are the driving force of Andres´s life and the reason why he works so hard in his business. He owns a farm where he raises cattle; he specializes in cows, a job that he’s been doing for more than 10 years.

He wants to stock up so he can increase his profits and let the business be more successful; that’s why he wants to buy two more calves that will let him increase his inputs to work. He wants to see his work be sustainable over time, so he’s willing to invest more in his business. 

Someday, Andrés expects to pay for his daughters’ education because he believes that is the way to do better in life. He just needs a little help, and you can give it to him now, so he can accomplish all that he dreams of.

loans.use: to buy two more calves

loans.name: Nora Alicia

texts.en:
Nora is 63 years old and lives in Medellín, Antioquia, where she has owned a store since 2010, which has helped her not only survive but become an entrepreneur; at her age that is not that common, but she knows that it doesn’t come with an age limit. She is committed, responsible, and works really hard to see her business become successful.

Nora is willing to improve her sales, so she can increase her profits, but the high cost of the inputs and how complicated the market is haven’t given her the opportunity to make her business grow. She’s asking for a loan so she can pay the debts she has and to buy more inventory for the store. She wants to offer different kind of products so her customers prefer her rather than other stores in the region. 

Nora dreams of repairing her home because it isn’t in good condition; she wants to feel protected and comfortable, and she also wants to keep working for a long time and give her family everything that they need. You can help Nora with a loan that will allow her accomplish all her dreams.

loans.use: pay the debts she has and to buy more inventory for the store

loans.name: Twitezimbere Group

texts.en: Twitezimbere Group is led by Vestine. who is 46 years old. The group name means “improve themselves” in English. Vestine is married with six children, ages 7 to 21 years. She owns a bar and has been in business for the past 10 years. The group members sell different items and they share the same idea for changing their lives.. With the loan, Vestine would like to buy more beer to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and contribute to her savings.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Utatlan Group

texts.en:
Utatlan is a trust bank located in Quiche, Guatemala. The group consists of seven women who have initiated another loan with Friendship Bridge and hope to be financed by Kiva once again. The mutual goal that these women have is to work hard and expand their business so that they can build a better future for their children and obtain a better quality of life. Some of the small businesses that these women have include making and selling typical clothing, selling food, making and selling tortillas, and selling cosmetics.

Evelia, one of Utatlan’s members, is a single working mother of three. Evelia is incredibly grateful for her ability to run her business selling small Guatemalan-styled food dishes. This business has supported and fed her family for years, Evelia hopes to continue her work with the support of Friendship Bridge and Kiva. She hopes to reinvest her loan into a new stove, table, and 12 chairs so that she may better accommodate her customers. Evelia yearns to provide a good education for her children so that they may continue on with their studies and eventually graduate from a university. 

Other than the loan, Evelia receives monthly informal education sessions touching on all topics of personal development including health, family planning, business administration, financial literacy, and more. Thank you Kiva investors or your support for Evelia and the Utatlan trust bank.

loans.use: To buy a stove, a table, and 12 chairs so that she may better accommodate her customers.

location.town: Santa Cruz del Quiche, El Quiche

loans.name: La Loma De Gumarkaj Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank's 'La Loma de Gumarkaj' or 'The Hill of Gumarkaj' initiated another loan cycle with Friendship Bridge and its first with Kiva. There are seven women that form this group, located in a community roughly 208 km from Guatemala City, known as Quiche. 

Elisa, a member of the group, is a 33-year-old, single woman who dedicates herself to the sale of cosmetics. The inflow of cash that she acquires from work goes to helping support her parents and the cost of the house, while she pays for her studies at a university. 

Elisa is requesting a loan, so that she may deepen her cosmetic selection and better satisfy her clients' desires. Elisa’s main drive to continue growing her business is to be able to financially maintain herself enough to graduate from the university. 

Elisa, along with the rest of the group members, is beyond grateful for the support that Friendship Bridge and Kiva have given. The loans have provided a much needed, helping hand that has financed their path to a better quality of life. 

Other than the loan she receives, Elisa, along with the rest of Friendship Bridge clients, is offered a monthly, non-formal education session that touches on various topics of personal development. The topics which Elisa and others receive include: health, family planning, business administration, financial literacy, and more. Thank you Kiva investors for your support for Elisa and all the other women!

loans.use: to buy a good selection of cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos (maíz y frijol) tiene 9 años de dedicarse a esa actividad y gracias a ese trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante, el joven vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo de 10 meses, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, fertilizantes, etc. para continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en: This young borrower whose face is blurred in the picture is 21 years old. He lives in a high risk area. He is a farmer who cultivates staple grains (corn and beans). He's been doing this work for 9 years, and thanks to this work he has been able to get ahead.  He lives in his own home with his wife and their 10 month-old baby.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies so that he can continue with his work and obtain greater earnings.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of office supplies and office equipment such as a printer to expand her business

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Since 2012, Melinda has owned Conscious Coconuts, a “farm-to-cup” mobile smoothie, juice, and coconut business using only products sourced from local farmers with no added sweeteners. Her seasonal menu includes juices, smoothies, Acai bowls, fresh coconuts, and home brewed Kombucha. Her booth can be found selling these hydrating drinks at various farmers' markets all over town. 

Melinda will use her Kiva loan to upgrade her equipment and to purchase additional signage to improve her visibility at markets and events. Through this loan, she will also be retaining three part-time jobs and one full-time job. Melinda has built a great reputation in the raw and health food community over the past few years and hopes to one day open up a store-front location.
 
Check out Melinda’s website: http://consciouscoconuts.com/.

loans.use: to upgrade her equipment and to purchase additional signage to improve her visibility at markets and events.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel es un gran hombre de 54 años de edad, es soltero vive junto a su familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre 19 y 31 años  en una comunidad de Nahualá. Miguel desde hace 20 años se dedica al cultivo de banano y café, gracias a esta  labor él ha sacado adelante a su familia. Durante estos días es la época de la siembra de pilones de café pero Miguel en este momento no tiene el dinero suficiente para poder cultivar, pero también hace algún tiempo a sembrando unas parcelas de café y banano que ahora ya necesitan de su mantenimiento, por tal motivo ha tomado  la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la siembra y mantenimiento de café y banano.
El gran sueño de Miguel es construir una casa de block más grande para su familia.
texts.en: Miguel is a great man who is 54 years old. His is single and lives with his family of 5 children who are between the ages of 19 and 31. They live in the community of Nahuala.  For 20 years, Miguel has been cultivating bananas and coffee. Thanks to this work he has provided for his family.  Right now it is the season to plant coffee in mounds.  However, at this time Miguel lacks the money he needs for the planting, and also he's been cultivating some plots of coffee and bananas for some time and they need some maintenance.  This is why he decided to request a loan to invest in the planting and maintenance of coffee and banana crops.  Miguel's greatest dream is to build a bigger house made of concrete blocks for his family.

loans.use: to cultivate and maintain his coffee and banana crops

loans.name: Mahabat

texts.ru: Махабат, 27 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У нее - среднее образование, знает, как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве дохода для своей семьи, Махабат примерно с 2006 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется 7 коров, 18 овец, также есть 0,20 ГА собственной и 0,80 ГА арендованной земли, где Махабат выращивает картофель и фасоль. Махабат решила обратиться в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита Махабат планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mahabat is 27 years old, married and is a mother to three children. She has a secondary education. She knows how to properly use and budget funds to accomplish a specific goal. As a source of income for her family, Mahabat has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming since 2006. She currently has 7 cows and 18 sheep on her farm. She also has a 0.20 hectare plot of her own land and a 0.80 plot rented land on which she grows potatoes and beans. Mahabat decided to turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" to request a loan for 100,00 som (KGS) to buy two cows for fattening up and reselling. Mahabat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows for fattening up and reselling.

loans.name: Samah

texts.en:
Samah is a 31-year-old married woman from Nablus City. She lives with her husband in a humble old house. Her husband works in the public sector where he can barely cover his family's needs. 

Samah decided to help her husband. She look a USD loan from FATEN. This loan is to open a beauty salon in her house and buy the necessary tools.

Samah dreams of opening a big salon in the future and  improving the living conditions of her family.

Samah appears in the photo.

loans.use: to open a salon in her house and buy the necessary tools.

loans.name: Rafaela Argentina
