texts.es: La señora Rafaela, de 50 años, soltera, es fiel cliente de ADIM, está por 8va vez solicitando crédito para el financiamiento de su pequeño negocio, que es la venta de calzado. Desde hace 25 años se dedica a esta actividad, anteriormente ella manejaba su taller, ahora solo se dedica a la compra-venta. En el negocio le ayuda sus 2 hijos. Con el crédito solicitado ella comprara zapatos juveniles, de adultos e infantiles asi dentra mayor productos. Entre sus proyectos esta poder tener su tramo y así poder brindarle mejor calidad a su apreciable clientela.
texts.en: Rafaela is 50 years old, single, and a loyal customer of ADIM; she is asking for a loan to finance her small business selling shoes for the eighth time. She has had this business for 25 years. She used to manage her workshop, but now she only buys and sells. Her two children help her with the business. With the loan requested she will buy shoes for children, adults and babies so she will have more products. Among her projects is being able to have her lot and thus offering better quality to her appreciable customers.

loans.use: to buy shoes for children, adults and babies

loans.name: Diarra

texts.fr: Diarra est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Tabou au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 42 ans, Diarra est le père de 5 enfants âgés de 20 à 3 ans, dont 2 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille ont incité Diarra à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs et le sorgho sur sa parcelle de 7 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité, de semences de qualité  et de pluie. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour la culture du maïs. L’accès au semoir lui permettra de faire le semis avec moins de personnes. Diarra espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille et couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants .
texts.en:
Diarra is a farmer who is registered with myAgro who lives and works in the village of Tabou, southwest of Bamako, Mali. Aged 42, Diarra is the father of five children aged 20 to 3, of whom two are presently in school.  The anchoring of the traditional family in agricultural practice, principle source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the family, but also the agricultural pursuit which permits him to ensure food self-sufficiency for his family encouraged Diarra to become a farmer. He grows maize and sorghum on his plot of seven hectares, but as a farmer he has to contend with difficulties such as a lack of quality fertilizer and seeds and lack of rain. 

This year he wanted to buy a seeder for maize growing. Access to the seeder will permit him to sow his fields with fewer people. Diarra hopes that the increase in his yield and thus in his income will allow him to ensure food self-sufficiency for his family and cover school fees for his children.

loans.use: to get a precision seeding machine

loans.name: N4P7Đsơn-New Begining Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khẩn is 61 years old and she is married. She is a member of N4P7Dson-New Begining Group. For five years, she has operated a food stall/restaurant, selling vegetables. 

Khẩn lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Khẩn faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to sell.

In 2014, Khẩn joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Khẩn has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Khẩn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to sell.

loans.name: N3P5Phú Sơn-Smile Group

texts.en:
Mrs Phượng is 43 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for more than 10 years. Phượng lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, this job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Phượng faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry eggs to incubate and sell baby poultry. In 2014, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Phượng has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profits, Phượng hopes for her business to do well, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase poultry eggs to incubate and sell baby poultry.

loans.name: Sékou

texts.fr: Sekou est un agriculteur inscrit à myAgro qui vit et travaille dans le village de Congola au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Agé de 76 ans, Sekou est le père de 16 enfants âgés de 50 à 23 ans, dont 9 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l’autosuffisance pour sa famille, mais aussi l’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer ont incité Sekou à devenir agriculteur. Il cultive le maïs  sur sa parcelle de 4 hectares, mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie, de matériels agricoles et d'engrais de qualité. Cette année, il a voulu acheter un semoir pour la culture du maïs. L’accès au semoir lui permettra de faire le semis avec rapidité. Sekou espère avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pouvoir couvrir les frais scolaires des enfants  et construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en:
Sékou is a farmer who is registered with myAgro who lives and works in the village of Congola, southwest of Bamako, Mali. Aged 76, Sékou is the father of 16 children aged 50 to 23, of whom nine are presently in school. The anchoring of the traditional family in agricultural practice, principle source of income and of food self-sufficiency for the family, but also the agricultural pursuit which permits him to ensure food self-sufficiency for his family encouraged Sékou to become a farmer. He grows maize on his plot of four hectares, but as a farmer he has to contend with difficulties such as a lack of rain, of agricultural materials, and of quality fertilizer.  

This year he wanted to buy a seeder for his maize crop. Access to the seeder will permit him to sow his fields quickly. Sékou hopes that the increase in his yield and thus in his income will allow him to cover school fees for his children and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to get himself a precision seeder

loans.name: N6P7Qthắng-Funny Farm Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hoa is 58 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for three years.  Hoa lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Hoa faces is lack of capital.  She is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is her first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member agreed to vote her to be the leader of "N6P7QThắng-Funny farm" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profits, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: N1Hòabìnhđhương-Hard Working For Future Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga is 53 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for five years. Nga lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover this job is unstable. 

The main hardship that Nga faces is lack of capital.  She is a reputable person in the community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Although this is Nga's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member agreed to vote for her to be the leader of "N1HòaBìnhĐHương-Hard Working for Future" group. 

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to travel for vacation internationally, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: N4T8Quảngthái-Pretty Mothers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Lan is 31 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for two years. Lan lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Lan faces is lack of capital.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. In 2011, Lan joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Lan has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Lan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: N7T5Qthái-Old And Blithesome Group

texts.en:
Mrs Uyển is 33 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling tapes for two years. Uyển lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Uyển faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Uyển joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Uyển has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profits, Uyển hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Elis Isabel

texts.es:
Elis tiene 42 años de edad de estado civil conviviente, vive en casa propia de material adobe, junto a su cónyuge sin carga familiar, en el caserío Laynas del Distrito de la Matanza, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura , ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz, que pertenece a la Provincia de Morropón, Región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla es la preparación y venta de chicha de jora el día miércoles, hace más de 15años, realizando la venta en su propio domicilio y contando con clientela fija. El destino del crédito será para invertirlo en la compra de insumos harina, leña azúcar y otros, para incrementar ventas y reducir los costos. la compra le ayudará tener un mejor modo de vida.
texts.en:
Elis is 42 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She lives in her own house made out of adobe with her partner and no other family. They live in the village of Laynas in the district of Matanza which belongs to the province of Morropón, Piura region. It's inhabitants work in agriculture, raising cattle and commerce and it has basic services like electricity and water.

Elis's business is preparing and selling corn beer every Wednesday. She has been doing this for 15 years from her house. She has a regular clientele. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of supplies like flour, wood, sugar and others to increase her sales and reduce her costs. This investment will help her have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy supplies like flour, wood, sugar and others for the preparation of corn beer.

loans.name: N8T6Qnhân-Solidarity To Repay Group

texts.en:
Mrs Vân is 46 years old and married. She is a member of N8T6Qnhan-Solidarity To Repay Group. For five years, she has worked in agriculture, raising poultry.

Vân lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family has a low-income household in the village. Moreover, the market need is low in this region. 

The main hardship that Vân faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

In 2015, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: N1Kp9Ba Đình-Sunset Group

texts.en:
Mrs Cảnh is 59 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general items for more than 10 years. Cảnh lives in Bim Son, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household; moreover. the market need is low in this region. The main hardship that Cảnh faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell.

In 2014, Cảnh joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. With her business profit, Cảnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to travel internationally for vacation.

loans.use: to purchase more cakes, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: N2Hòabìnhđhương-Kind Grandmothers Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thoa is 61 years old and she is married. 	She has had a retail business selling dry food and general merchandise for five years. Thoa lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

The main hardship that Thoa faces is lack of capital.  Her family is a low-income household in a village, moreover this job is unstable, but she is a reputable person in the community.

Although this is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution, every member agreed to vote for her to be the leader of "N2HòaBìnhĐHương-Kind Grandmothers" group. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell.

In future, Thoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more cake, sweets, sugar, milk, etc. to resell

loans.name: N13Tthanh10Qnham-Mother's Heart Group

texts.en:
Mrs Quy is 65 years old and she is married. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry for seven years. Quy lives in Quang Xuong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future. 
 
The main hardship that Quy faces is lack of capital. In 2011, Quy joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Quy has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Quy hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: José de 23 años de edad habita con su grupo familiar, y él se dedica a prestar sus servicios en una coctelera que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, es así como gracias a su trabajo él puede aportar al hogar y al mismo tiempo poder suplir sus necesidades personales. José es un joven visionario que buscando la forma de ampliar su hogar a tomado la decisión de adquirir un crédito en FUSAI para poder construir un cuarto dormitorio en el lugar donde actualmente se encuentra una pequeña galera y de esta manera poder brindar a su familia una mejor comodidad. Por lo anterior con el monto solicitado piensa comprar: lámina, madera y clavos para construir un cuarto de habitación.
texts.en:
José is 23 years old and he lives with his family. He works providing his services in a cocktail bar close to his house. It is thanks to this job that he can contribute to his household and at the same time can provide for his personal needs.

José is a young visionary who is looking for a way to expand his house. He has made the decision to acquire a loan from FUSAI so he can construct a bedroom where there is currently a small shed and in this way provide his family with greater comfort. For this reason and with the amount requested he is thinking of buying laminated sheeting, wood and nails to construct a bedroom.

loans.use: to invest in laminate sheeting, wood and nails to construct a bedroom.

loans.name: Lan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan, born in 1970, is a Thai ethnic woman. She lives with her husband and her two children (a son and a daughter) in the city of Son La, in Son La province. The family’s main income is from the couple's salaries as civil servants. However, the income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses while both children are in school. 

Lan's son is majoring in forest management at a forestry university and her daughter is in junior high school. Lan is requesting a loan because she wants to invest in her children’s education but does not have enough money. She hopes that the loan will help her two children have good conditions for studying and that they will have good jobs with stable incomes when they graduate from school.

loans.use: to invest in her children’s education

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Yen, 27 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She has been a member of M7-MFI since January 2013. Yen lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Yen's family’s main income is from cultivation and breeding, and it is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. Yen intends to raise breeding goats but her savings are not enough for her to invest in the goats. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose. She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively with high productivity, and that next year the female goats will produce tens of small goats.

loans.use: to invest in breeding goats

loans.name: Tu's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tu, 55 years old, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her husband, son, daughter-in-law and grandchild in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. Each year her family can sell several pig herds. Their income after deducting all costs is just VND 50 to 60 million, which is just enough to cover the family's living expenses and to save a small amount. 

Tu is requesting a loan to raise pigs to sell the meat because her savings are not enough to invest in the breeding. She will find an extra job to work hard to get money to repay the loan to M7-MFI on time. Tu hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and that the next sale of the pig herd will bring her family a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise pigs to sell the meat

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Van is a Kinh ethnic majority woman. She lives with her husband, son and daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family’s main occupation is farming and their income is just enough to cover the family's living expenses, including the children’s education fees. 

Van is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the corn since she does not have enough money. She hopes the loan will help her family have money to invest in the cornfield and that, in the next crop, the cornfield will bring her family big corncobs with solid seeds and double the yield of the previous crop.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 50 years old, married and supports a family of six children. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last three years earning KES.12,000 per month.

Thomas has applied for his first loan of KES.25,000 from Vision Fund Kenya to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to improve his dairy farming. His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for milk production and supply in the area for more income gain.

loans.name: Dana Group

texts.en:
Zainab is the featured borrower for Dana Group. She joined with the other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Zainab is a 45-year-old married mother of three children. A year ago, she started selling clothes from her house to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is now well-known among her region and she has her own customers. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of summer clothes to attract more customers. Zainab is the first lady on the left of the photo, Fatima is the lady sitting in the middle and Sabah is the first lady on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new collection of summer clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her to have a better harvest for sale and family use.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
She is Josephine, 38 years old, married to Nelson, and they are still praying for a child. As of now, Josephine focuses her attention in developing her variety store and internet café business. She has been running her variety store for seven years. She had substantial amount of savings from these years of operation which she used to put up her internet café last year. 

Her new business is currently stabilizing from its start-up costs, while her old business, the sari-sari, is facing stiff competition within their area in Davao City. Last June she had incurred considerable amount of expenses in relation to the educational needs of her niece. She has a pledge to support her while she is still waiting for her own child. Now she is struggling at this period of adjustment because she almost emptied her cash. 

She has to acquire additional capital to continuously operate her sari-sari with sufficient stocks, and also reserve some amount for the maintenance of her internet café. A loan worth PhP 20,000 would be enough for this purpose. She can roll this capital wisely to generate more income and savings. She hopes that if their own child arrives, she has enough money to provide for his/her needs, but she doesn’t want to leave behind her pledge to her niece. 

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy sufficient stocks for her variety store

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a married woman with 2 children and she describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are of all types. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits. 

Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more stock of fruits

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es una gran mujer de 57 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre 16 y 28 años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Nahualá.
Antonia para sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de cortes típicos, con este negocio lleva ella quince años, pero Antonia no es ninguna mujer conformista es por eso que para mejorar sus ingresos se dedica a la producción de banano, Antonia con el afán de seguir incrementando su cultivo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de una cuerda de terreno para cultivo de café y banano.
El gran anhelo de Antonia es poder construir un local donde pueda instalar una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Antonia is a great 57 year old woman. She is married and she has a beautiful family of three children between the ages of 16 and 28 years old. This humble family lives in the community of Nahualá.

In order to get her family ahead Antonia works buying and selling traditional skirts. She has had this business for 15 years but she is not content with this. So in order to improve her income she is growing bananas. Antonia has the urge to continue increasing her crops and has made the decision to request a loan which she will invest in buying a plot of land (one cuerda) to grow coffee and bananas. Antonia's great dream is to construct a shop where she can open a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land to farm.

loans.name: Judil

texts.en:
Judil is a 39 years old, married and has two children to provide. She engaged in a sari-sari store business to earn for income. She wants to give her family a good life so she must increase her income and to achieve this she decided to borrowed a loan to buy more good items and increase her store inventory to generate better income.

Judil plan for the future to save money out from her business income to sustain their family needs.

loans.use: To buy more items for selling in her store

location.town: Sto. ñino, Tukuran Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Srey Neth's Group

texts.en:
A young mother is 25-year-old, living in a remote area of the Mondulkiri province’s Keo Seima district; Srey Neth has a small kid. Nowadays, she grows cassava as the main source of her family’s income and she is a hairdresser to earn more income to support her living standard for two years. Her crops did not grow well last season, is the main challenge for her business. 

She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for one loan cycle already and completely repaid the past loan. The previous loan helps her to have a better living condition. 

Due to having not enough funds to do farming, she is now leading a group of three members to request for new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer for supporting her farm and boost her crop yields. She hopes that this loan will help her to earn more income and have the ability to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for supporting her farm and boost her crop yields.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov, who is a farmer and lives in Snoul district of Kratie province, is 44 years old and she is the married mother of three dependent children. She struggles for a living by growing cassava as the main source of income and she has been in this job for 8 years already. She sometimes works for others for a fee to earn supplement income. 

Her endangered job earns her a little income than before due to lacking of fertilizers to support. She decided to lead a group of three members to take out a new loan, which is their second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the previous loan she got, she has used it to improve her living conditions. 

This time the loan will be used to buy organic fertilizers to enrich the farmland so that she can have better outputs. She hopes to earn more income to do home repair and make it bigger and she also wants to support her family’s needs on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to enrich the farmland so that she can have a better production

loans.name: Roribel

texts.en:
Roribel is wholeheartedly thanking you for the continuous financial assistance she receives for her store business. It sustained her store operations. As with most Filipina mothers, Roribel does her best to help her husband earn a living and provide for their children's schooling and their daily needs.

She is hoping that she can access another 50,000 PHP loan to buy large quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, and frozen foods to grow her store. With the rising cost of living in her country and the competition she faces, she needs to make sure that she offers all essential food items in order to attract more customers. She is thanking God and you in advance for your tireless support of her livelihood.

Roribel dreams of having a bigger grocery store someday. She aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en:
Hon, a farmer living in a rural area of Snoul district, Kratie province, is 23 years old and a married mother of two dependent children, who are under school age. To make a living, she grows cassava as her main source of income. She has been in this job for ages. Sometimes she works for others for a fee to earn additional income to better support her family. From her endangered business, which was threatened by pests, she can earn about 38,000 riels per day. 

Now Hon is leading a group of two to get a new loan. This will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She managed her past loan so well it made a positive impact on her family. This new loan will be used to buy organic fertilizers to enhance her crop production. She hopes to earn more income to buy an additional plot of farmland so that she can get more crop outputs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers to increase cassava production

loans.name: Arshad

texts.en:
Arshad is 46 years old, married woman with 3 children, running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purpose. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation, now she has requested for a loan of 40000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn a good income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children

loans.name: Hortencia Del Socorro

texts.es:
Hortensia de 46 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad,  es originaria del Sauce lugar que  está ubicado en la zona norte de la región y se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias   a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad la venta de productos lácteos como leche, cuajada, queso, crema, etc.    El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, los compradores son clientes fijos. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ochos horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo en una compra de una reses, para la producción de leche, y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.  Hortensia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Forty-six-year-old Hortensia is a single mother with two young children. She is from Sauce, a place located in the northern zone of the region. Hortensia is a hard-working, responsible person with a desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to the lack of economic resources, she could not pursue an education and found herself obligated to work from an early age in order to help with household expenses. 

Thanks to her desire to get ahead, she sells dairy products like milk, curd, cheese, cream, etc. Her business is located in the house she lives in, and the buyers are regular clients. 

She works some eight hours a day at her business, offering her products. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and purchase some cows to produce milk to satisfy the demand of her clients.

Hortensia appreciates the support that Kiva investors offer to people of limited resources and poor countries like Nicaragua so that they have a dignified means of work.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to sell milk, curd and cheese.

loans.name: Felipe Amador

texts.es:
Felipe de 47 años de edad, casado con  tres hijos menores de edad, los cuales están estudiando, es originario del Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche, y sus derivados. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar, en la actualidad se dedica a sacar adelante su negocio su familia, y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida a sus hijos.
Gracias  a sus ganas de salir adelante la  tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en,  pies, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. Este negocio lo desempeña desde hace diez años,  y la rutina de trabajo de este hombre es de unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. el objetivo del crédito es comprar un lote de cerdos en pie para la crianza y venta a clientes fijos.  Felipe agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Felipe is 47 years old.  He is married with three minor children who are in school.  He is originally from Sauce, a place known for the production of milk and milk products.  He is a hard worker and responsible, with a desire to improve himself.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, he wasn't able to attend school.  He currently works to move his business and family forward, and to provide better opportunities to his children.  

Thanks to his desire to succeed, he makes his living raising and selling live pigs.  His business is located at his home.  He has worked at this business for ten years.  His routine is to work eight hours a day offering his products.  The purpose of the loan is to buy a herd of pigs to raise and sell to regular customers.  Felipe is thankful for the help that Kiva investors provide to people with limited resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, by providing them a means of decent work.

loans.use: to buy and raise a herd of pigs.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Mom makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren’s Group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Ren makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Hoy's Group

texts.en:
Hoy, 46, is a farmer living in Keo Seima district of Mondulkiri province and a married mother of two children, one of whom is dependent on her. Growing cassava is the main source of her family’s income, which she has been involved in for 13 years. She sometimes works as a paid worker to earn additional income for family. 

As the crop has disease last season, it produces lower-than-expected outputs for her. Hoy, leading a three-member group, is now applying for a loan to save her business, which will be her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has been repaid completely and it has enabled her to improve her living standard better. 

As a representative, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to support her business. She hopes to earn more income to support her family’s needs timely and improve it much better than ever before.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to support her business

loans.name: Savern's Group

texts.en: Savern’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Savern makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: Doña Fátima es fiel cliente de ADIM, demostrando ser una emprendedora, capaz, responsable y luchadora para salir adelante con su negocio y familia. A sus 36 años, casada y con 2 hijos de edades 12 y 10 años respectivamente, de los cuales uno de ellos estudia en primaria y el otro en secundaria. Se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa de manera ambulante, desde hace 10 años, inicio el negocio con los ingresos recibidos del trabajo  de su esposo. Ahora con el crédito ella invertirá en la compra de materiales para construcción en mejoras de su casa, ropas variadas para adultos como camisas y pantalones; y cosméticos como perfumes, cremas y shampu. Esto para poder ofrecer variedad a su fiel clientela. Con el crédito anterior logro invertir en su negocio y lo engrandeció.
texts.en:
Fátima is a loyal customer of ADIM and has shown herself to be an enterprising, capable, responsible and hardworking woman in getting ahead with her business and family. She is 36 years old and married and has two children ages 12 and 10 respectively, one of whom is in primary school and the other in secondary school. She has made a living selling cosmetics and clothing in an itinerant fashion for the last ten years. She started the business with the income she received from her husband's work. 

This time she will invest the loan in buying construction materials for home improvement, a variety of clothing for adults like shirts and pants, and cosmetics like perfumes, creams and shampoo in order to be able to offer variety to her loyal customers. With the previous loan she was able to invest in and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for home improvement, a variety of clothing for adults like shirts and pants, and cosmetics like perfumes, creams and shampoo

loans.name: Souy's Group

texts.en: Souy’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Souy makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help this woman and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: International Group

texts.en:
This is 35 years old Aminata, married,with four children, who are all in school.  Aminata belongs to a solidarity group of five women, who have come together to complement each other to achieve their individual dreams.  “International” is the name of Aminata’s solidarity group. 

 “International” group needs a total loan of 5,000,000SLL.  Aminata will receive 1,000,000SLL which she needs in order to purchase more than 350 bags of charcoal for her business. Aminata trades in charcoal in a rented shop right in the city centre of Freetown.  Her business which has been in existence for over fifteen years, is the main source of her livelihood and that of her family and supports her children’s education.  She opens her business Monday through Saturday every week.  Aminata (in the middle of the group picture).

In the future, Aminata plans to support her children to acquire university education.  She hopes that one day she will become an international business woman.  She will be very appreciative to anyone that can help.  She thanks you for supporting them.

loans.use: to purchase more than 350 bags of charcoal for her business..

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs and fertilizer for her crops

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
Reinero tiene 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyugue y sus 2 menores hijos, los dos se encuentran cursando estudios en el colegio de la zona, en el distrito de Querocotillo, que pertenece a la provincia de Cutervo, Región Cajamarca, Sierra norte de Perú.

Reinero tiene muy buena referencias tanto personales como laborales en su comunidad.La actividad a la que se dedica el cliente es la de comercio de ganado vacuno, ubicado en el caserío de el Limón que pertenece al distrito de Querocotillo, con una experiencia en el rubro de 10 años, el préstamo que se le otorgara lo utilizara en compra de animales vacunos asi como de alimentos para su ganado. De esta manera lo ayudara a la mejora de su negocio , así como también tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Reinero is 52 years old.  He lives in his own home, made from rustic material.  He lives with his partner and their two minor children, both of whom study in the local school, in the district of Querocotillo, in the province of Cutervo, in Cajamarca, in the northern mountains of Perú.

Reinero has very good references in his community, both personal and work related.  He works in the sale of cattle, in the village of El Limón within the district of Querocotillo.  He has 10 years experience in this line of work.  The loan he seeks will be used to buy cattle and food for his livestock.  It will help him to better his business as well as achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and food for his livestock.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees and food. 

Mary has operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over three years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business.Mary dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feeds. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: Sok’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sok makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Dương

texts.en:
Mrs Dương is 28 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling fish for eight years. Dương lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover her job is unstable.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is her latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Dương first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her business profit, Dương hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a toilet.

loans.name: Martha Patricia

texts.es:
Martha patricia de 40 años de edad, casada con tres hijos menores de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que se caracteriza por ser productor de leche y sus derivados. Se caracteriza por ser una persona trabajadora, con ganas de superación personal.  En la actualidad lucha día a día para sacar adelante a su familia y los desafíos que presenta día a día con su negocio.
Gracias a sus ganas de salir adelante tiene el servicio de costura el cual desempeña en su casa de habitación, desde hace diez años, el negocio consiste en elaborar prendas de vestir como: pantalones, vestidos, faldas, camisas, de mujer y de hombre.  La rutina de trabajo de esta mujer es de unos diez años. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo como: telas, hilos, encajes,  forros,  botones, agujas, etc. Para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Martha agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Martha Patricia, 40, is married and has three children. She is originally from Sauce, an area know for producing dairy products. She is a hardworking person with a desire for personal betterment. She fights every day to help her family get ahead and to deal with the daily challenges that her business presents. Thanks to her determination, she has operated a sewing business out of her home for the last 10 years. She makes garments like pants, dresses, skirts, blouses and men's shirts.

The goal for this loan is to invest in business capital like fabric, thread, lace, liners, buttons, needles, etc. This will allow her to have greater profits in the near future.

Martha is thankful for the help that Kiva lenders give to people with fewer resources in poor counties like Nicaragua, so that they can have honest work.

loans.use: to buy materials like fabric, thread, lace, liners, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old, married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid 27 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loans, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Jocelyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Kratie province’s Snoul district, Sophorn is 36-year-old and a mother of five children. For her living, she grows potatoes and works for others for a fee. She has been involved both business for five years. She is able to save around 16,000KHR each day after offsetting her family expenses. Her crops did not grow well last season, which was the problem for her business. She can keep her children in school from her past loan. 

This is her second loan cycle for her with VisionFund. She is now leading a group of four members to take new loan via VisionFund to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for her farm. She hopes her current business will earn more income so as to improve her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees for her farm.

loans.name: Suchean

texts.en:
Suchean is from  Banteay Chmar, a village in the North-West of Cambodia. She is 26 years old and she lives in a wooden pile house with her husband and her 2 young children. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields, 8 pigs and a half hectare cassava field. 

In 2005 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong,  a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village.Suchean makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. 

She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for her field, food for the pig  and to develop her business. Thanks to the loan, she will buy the silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. 

Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: To buy silk and pay for loom preparation related fees

loans.name: Chern's Group

texts.en: Chern’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Chern makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In his village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old, married and a mother of five children; one child is attending secondary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013 to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

Jane is involved in maize, beans and potatoes farming. She is also employed in a school as a cook to supplement her income. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and certified seeds in order to increase production. This will enable her meet her customer’s demands hence earn more income to enable her pay school fees for her child.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and certified seeds to increase production and earn more income to pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Napakha Group

texts.en:
Phadee’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Phadee and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  

Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Phadee and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Phadee’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water

loans.name: Lyne

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lyne works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell charcoal and raising pigs. Lyne is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to  purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc for her general store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lyne has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs, noodles, etc

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Azucena works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Azucena is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients for her food production business for her food vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Azucena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials like gravel, cinder block and cement.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, three of whom in school. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell recycled materials.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Liezel dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods to sell

loans.name: Quirina

texts.en:
Quirina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy sacks of feeds and vitamins.

She supplements this income with earnings from her farming rice. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Quirina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Jagannath Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Pratima, aged 33 years, is the featured borrower of Jagannath SHG-D from the village Ramgiri of Koraput district. She is the one standing to the right in the photo. 

She lives with her husband and three children. Her husband works as a carpenter in a local shop. Pratima has undergone a lot of hardships as her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the basic requirements of the family. This is the reason why she took the initiative to start a poultry business.

Pratima, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR to purchase feeds and fodders, vaccines, and medicines for the chicks. This will enable Pratima in the increase of the volume of sales, resulting in the rise of her income.

She aspires to build a large poultry house for the breeding of chickens through the money that she will generate from her poultry business and will use a certain part of her income in educating her children.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and fodders, vaccines, and medicines for the chicks.

loans.name: Lusvina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lusvina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Lusvina is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Lusvina has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business

loans.name: Marfely

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Marfely works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables and fruits business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Marfely is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to  purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell in her buy and sell vegetables and fruits business.

Marfely has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vegetables and fruits to sell

loans.name: Ilyn

texts.en:
Ilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to purchase feed, rice bran, and vitamins for her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Ilyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, rice bran, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Editha is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizer and pay for laborer salaries.

Editha dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ranny's Group

texts.en: A resident living in Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province, Ranny is 35-years-old and a married mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school and the other one is under the age of school. She is fishing in the inland water to earn the main income to support her family. Meanwhile, she is also growing rice to supplement income. Now, the rice farming business is in danger as there is shortage of water and fertilizers to supply the farmland. She is now leading a group of three members to get a new loan and this is the first time for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As a leader, she will use her loan to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to support her farmland. She hopes to earn more income to support her children’s studies until they graduate and get good jobs.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers and organic pesticides to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jagannath Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Gitanjali, aged 36 years, is the featured borrower of Jagannath SHG-C from the village Ramagiri of Koraput district. She lives with her husband who is engaged in sugarcane cultivation and her two minor children. Gitanjali has engaged in cultivating vegetables for the last two years. Gitanjali is standing to the right in the photograph.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Gitanjali will use her portion of loan amount to pay for farm labour costs, applications, and incorporation of plant treatment. This will help improve her crop physiologically, morphologically, and productively. 

It will also allow her to have an opportune harvest and greater production. The product will be of better quality so she will not have any problem selling it, which will give her more income for a better quality of life.

She has a plan to purchase a power tiller which will facilitate her farming business in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for farm labour costs, applications, and incorporation of plant treatment

loans.name: Koy's Group

texts.en: Koy’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Koy makes a living cultivating rice to support his family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Saran's Group

texts.en: Saran’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Saran makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as teacher to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Korn's Group

texts.en: Korn’s group live in a rural village in Kompong Thom province in Cambodia. Korn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a farmer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Jagannath Shg-B Group

texts.en:
45-year-old Mukta lives with her six children in Ramgiri village of Koraput district. She is the one standing to the left. She has two sons aged 22 years and 18 years and four daughters aged 20, 19, 16 and 14 years respectively. 

Five years back her husband passed away in an accident. That was a very hard time for Mukta because the entire family burden came on her. She is a good mother and is enterprising, sincere, intelligent, generous, understanding, patient, responsible, and hard-working. Despite the bad times, she was able to overcome all the hurdles and proved her efficiency by becoming financially independent. Mukta is engaged in cultivating paddy and wheat and earns a pretty good amount of money after selling the harvest in the market.

She, along with her group member, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. Mukta will use her portion of the loan to purchase high yielding varieties of seeds, insecticides, organic manures, and other farm equipment in order to increase the yield per hectare and earn a higher amount of money after selling the harvest in the market, so that she can reinvest her profit in her farming business and purchase a land where she can cultivate different varieties of vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase high yielding varities of seeds, insecticides, organic manures, and other farm equipment

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre casado de 51 años de edad, vive junto a su familia de cuatro hijos en  una comunidad de Santo Tomas la Unión.  Antonio para poder obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como fotógrafo desde hace siete años, pero también cuenta con un telar para elaboración de cortes de donde proviene otra parte de sus ingresos, Antonio afortunadamente no es un hombre conformista si no con muchos sueños es por ello que tiene la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para comprar leña y maíz para su negocio de tortillería que hace poco instalo, para así satisfacer mejo a sus clientes.
El gran sueño de Antonio es poder construir una casa más cómoda para que su familia viva mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Antonio is a married man of 51. He lives with his family of four children in a community of Santo Tomas la Unión. In order to obtain his income and support his family, Antonio has worked as a photographer for seven years, but he also has a loom for making weavings, from which another part of his income comes.

Fortunately, Antonio is not a man who resigns himself to his situation but instead has many dreams. It is for this reason that he needs to apply for a loan to purchase firewood and corn for his business of making tortillas, which he set up recently, in order to thus better satisfy his customers.

Antonio's great dream is to be able to build a more comfortable house so that his family can live much better.

loans.use: to buy firewood and corn to make tortillas to sell

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Sovann is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the north-west of Cambodia. She is 29 years old. She lives in a wooden house with one floor with her husband, her 4-year-old son and her sister, who is studying in high school. Her family owns 6 hectares of rice fields and 2.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2002 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in their village. Sovann makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for her family expenses. Thanks to the loan,  she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees

loans.name: Phlerng's Group

texts.en: Phlerng’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Phlerng makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and the man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 25 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la siembra de de maíz desde hace varios años, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y así tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
The youth whose face has been blurred out in the photo, is 25 years old and lives in a high risk area. 
He has worked planting corn for several years. He sells his products around the area where he lives. 
He lives in his own home with his family. 
He is requesting the loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to improve the land that is shown in the photograph to be able to continue with his work and to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and herbicides to improve the land.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is thanking you wholeheartedly for the faithful support she receives to maintain her salon and buy and sell business. Her two businesses means so much to her, since it provides for their basic needs. Although most Filipinos do not have the luxuries and privileges of the more progressive countries, it is typical for a Filipino family like Melba's to be happy and content as long as family is intact and united.

Melba trusts that she can again avail another 50,000 PHP loan to sustain the needs of her beauty salon and have enough capital for her direct selling business. Proceeds of her loan will be used to buy hair dyes, shampoo, hot oil, conditioner and hair scissors needed for her salon, and also to buy Personal Collection brand of personal products to sell.  She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, as it greatly helps meet their daily needs.

Melba dreams of having a bigger and more attractive salon to serve more customers. She prays for God to bless her efforts with success.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies 

. *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for beauty supplies and hair products such as hair dye, shampoo, conditioner, towels and scissors for her salon and some personal products to sell.

loans.name: Lorry

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lorry works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buying and selling fruits. 

Lorry is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy an ice box and other materials for her fishing business.

Lorry has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an ice box and other materials for her business

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Meriam works hard to support her family.

She has a beauty salon business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fishing.  She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business. 

Meriam is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for her beauty salon business.

Meriam has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her beauty parlor business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc...

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling rice.

Lydia dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Sumitra

texts.en:
Sumitra is a rural woman from Falakata. She is a 48-year-old married woman. Her three daughters are married.  Sumitra received a primary level education in her young age but she is very much eager to give her only son the best education he deserves. 

Sumitra's son Sujit is 18 years old. He is in B.A. (Bachelor of Arts) in the first Year in Falakata College. He is a hard working student and wants to be a teacher in the future. But his marks are not good enough in earlier exams. So he needs proper guidance to improve him and prepare for competitive exams. 

Sumitra's husband has a small shuttering business. His income covers the household expenses but he cannot afford the whole education cost of their only son. Sometimes they cannot even provide necessary books for their son. As such, providing him private coaching is too difficult for them to bear. 

So to remedy these problems Sumitra has applied for an educational loan from BJS (Kiva's partner). The loan amount will be utilized to purchase her son's necessary text books, pay all schooling fees, and enroll him in private coaching class. Sumitra is hopeful that the loan will help her son to go one step closer to his goals.

Sumitra and Sujit (in the photo) express their gratitude towards their generous lenders.

loans.use: To cover the education costs of her son.

loans.name: Manika

texts.en:
Manika is a rural housewife from Falakata. She is 46 years old and is blessed with two children, a son and a daughter. Her daughter got married. She lives with her husband and only son in a small village Balasundar in CoochBehar district. 

Manika and her husband Raimohan are associated with agricultural activities. They grow seasonal vegetables and crops and sell in the local market. This is their sole source of income which is not sufficient to meet their monthly household expenses.

Manika's son, 21-year-old Rathindra, is pursuing civil engineering in Camelian Institute of Engineering. Now he is a good student of the third year and wants to complete his four year engineering course with good marks. He requires private coaching and reference books to continue his engineering level education. 

Manika is determined to provide all necessary educational materials to her son so that he can continue his studies. But money is the main obstacle for his smooth education. So Manika wants an education loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to pay her son's course fees and purchase necessary education materials for him. 

The financial help will enable Manika to continue her son’s education because he has a desire to be a good civil engineer. Manika will be able to allow her son to get a job as a programmer with the help of this financial support.

Manika and Rathindra (as in photo) are very much obliged to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To afford the cost of her son's engineering level education.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 48 years old and has three children.  Gilda is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Gilda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Gilda has been farming sugarcane for 10 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Chhorvorn

texts.en: Chhorvorn is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the north-west of Cambodia. She is 27 years old. Her family owns 3 hectares of rice fields and 0.5 hectares of cassava fields. In 2012 she was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in their village. Chhorvorn makes scarves which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field, and to repair her house. Thanks to the loan, she will buy silk and pay for the dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful traditional hand woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and pay for loom preparation-related fees

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Elena works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Elena is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her buy and sell rice business.

Elena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 62 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, spices, coffee, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 10 years. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

In the future Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, spices, coffee, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en: Joyce is 50 years old and married. She has been running a genge (a retail shop with fruits and vegetables) for four years now. She works from 6 a.m. to 8 p.m. daily and she is able to make a fair monthly profit. This will be Joyce's 6th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans used to buy genge stock. She is doing great. She used the profit to take care of her family and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her genge stock. She dreams of owning a big shop. She will share this loan with her group "Ulezi" which consist of three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase genge stock.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 24 years old and married with two children who are in school. Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell.

Maricel has been in this business for 3 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, rice, sugar, etc. to sell

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to pay for salaries for laborers to clean the sugarcane.

She supplements this income with earnings from her buy and sell vegetables business. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Luz dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to pay the salaries for farming laborers to clean sugarcane

loans.name: Rudesa

texts.en:
Rudesa is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to pay for laborers salaries for land preparation and to buy fertilizer.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Rudesa dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family

loans.use: to pay for laborers salaries for land preparation and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
